author: {'steamid': '76561198348664326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1407, 'playtime_at_review': 1506, 'last_played': 1710692562}
review:
A real gem from the previous era. Wonderful satiric adventure which plays nicely still in 2024. The story, the humour, the action- it's all there if you may look past it outdated graphics (and frankly, you should). Some tips before you start:
- read the guide before you play if you want to get all achievements in one playthrough (if you just want to enjoy the game, you may as well ignore it)
- make multiple saves very often and if some achievements do not pop up, reload previous save and try again. Worked for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151696853', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1708457418}
review: I loved the first Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance game, and this is based on the same engine. But other than adding humor and a lot more cleavage this has nothing new to offer, and in fact has clumsily reworked much of what made Dark Alliance so much fun, with poor results. The combat feels dull and skills, the environments boring. The weapons don't feel that different from each other. In the end playing this feels like a chore, at least in the 1.5hrs I put in before writing this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198221999', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1708403465}
review:
因為操作問題，所以不推薦。

但遊戲本身是很吸引的，是我喜歡的類型。

玩的時侯不能夠單獨依賴手掣，必須配合滑鼠一起操作。因此，我還停留在第一個地方，沒有離開過。

1. 我用Xbox手掣在steam deck 上玩的。雖然我沒有推搖桿，但有時候角色會持續向某個方向走而不會停止，除非我主動推搖桿改變方向，同時手掣的ABXY鍵會失靈。

2. 在商店介面選擇物品時，如果我用手掣選擇，會出現跳回原點的情況

3. 與NPC的互動時，我不能夠有搖桿選擇自己的反應，一定要用滑鼠點......有夠不方便的......

希望開發商會考慮改善這遊戲在Steam Deck上運行的情況吧。

review:
It's actually not bad for a 20 year old game. The low res terrain textures can be a bit jarring to look at, combat can be a bit stiff, it also suffers from certain areas of the game being bloated with too many enemies in order to lengthen the game I imagine.

It's pretty fun, it pokes fun at your stereotypical RPG heroes and stories, Bard going around causing more harm than good.

review:
It's not bad for what it is, i just can't reccomend it.
Some chapters are drawn out too long. Combat is bit janky. Story is mediocre.
It's very similar to "Dungeons" games in terms of humor, "snark" and naration.

If you like "Friends" or similar simple comedy sitcoms you might enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128261551', 'num_games_owned': 766, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1700364742}
review: This game is not "Remastered", it's just the original running at a lazily upscaled resolution. The UI/menus are noticeably stretched. The keyboard and mouse controls are terriible, and the gamepad controls do not match the layout of any modern controller, so I have no idea what button does what (they don't correspond to the cardinal directions either, so I can't even guess).

author: {'steamid': '76561198323600177', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1390, 'last_played': 1640615781}
review:
Mi padre me regaló este juego en formato físico cuando cumplí 9 años, y mas de 10 años después, decidí revivir la experiencia de jugarlo en Steam. Es difícil ser objetivo, ya que soy una persona muy nostálgica, así que me voy a centrar en lo importante: Es cierto que la jugabilidad es mejorable y los gráficos no son nada del otro jueves... Pero tiene un humor brutal, los personajes tienen carisma y hay infinidad de escenarios... Mi aspecto favorito es que constantemente debes tomar decisiones que importan (y mucho).

En definitiva, The bard's tale es un ejemplo de un juego hecho con cariño y dedicación.

[spoiler] Beer, beer, beer, tiddly beer, beer, beer! [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198281612064', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1698771501}
review:
One day I decided to finish all games in my library before I buy my next game, and this is somehow the first one in my list. I might get this game via a certain humble bundle, I can't remember.
Anyway, this game is fun playing. You will go through an adventure and you can summon allies to assist both in battle and exploring. The NPCs just started singing all in a sudden, interesting.
And, yes, the controlling is sometimes annoying but considering the age of this game, you can't blame it too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201620245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1698756845}
review:
No old free manual saves available.
Ubisoft levels of corporate/console turditude.
Not PC-worthy. Not RPG-worthy.

Although the storytelling is amusing, the repetitive hack n' slash is not worth the pain caused by this lack of basic features, nor is the backtracking through respawning mobs and infinite traps.
The other technical issues, like the ridiculous default slowness or the absurd gamepad input, can be fixed with a bit of tinkering/remapping.

Not inXile's brightest hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968536252', 'num_games_owned': 702, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 2901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2901, 'last_played': 1599951417}
review:
I played through The Bard's Tale before they released the Remastered and Resnarkled Edition and added the achievements.  It's a tongue-in-cheek look at the classic fantasy RPG and its associated tropes, so can be amusing at times.

However, I got frustrated with the camera and controls and eventually got annoyed with all the silliness.  I can see what they were trying to do here, but it just didn't work for me.  I just prefer the more "serious" Bard's Tale games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198412953565', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 495, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1694313342}
review:

when all there was to drink was nothin but cups of tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023434508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1528900350}
review:
J'ai vraiment essayé d'aimer The Bard's Tale et j'ai fini le jeu tant bien que mal.

Mais forcé de constater que le gameplay répétitif et les mécaniques du jeu (les invocations qui combattent pour vous), font plus de mal que de bien.

L'histoire quand a elle se veut drôle et décalée par rapport au classique "Prince charmant sauve sa princesse", sauf que... C'est lourd. Très lourd. Les chansons du jeu et l'humour général sont plus gênants que drôle, même si ça reste bien sûr subjectif.

A des moments du jeu, dès ma première (et seule) partie, je me suis surpris à regarder une vidéo en même temps, tant certains passages étaient soporifiques.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069732523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2885, 'last_played': 1692979577}

author: {'steamid': '76561198998632246', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1692106968}
review: This game made me happy. That is simply it. Played it 20 years ago, revisited it randomly these last days. Forgot a lot of it, but also remembered a lot of it. Good old funny, careless childhood - yet do not underestimate the difficulty. You need brawn and wit to survive from time to time, but the journey is totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039999113', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 12796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12796, 'last_played': 1680592639}
review:
[h1] Череп, дерево, луна, солнце, цыпа и песенка?  
Какого черта, МакРат? Это не Армелло! И где вообще мои мертвецы?[/h1]
Может к ним ведет путеводный ствол дерева? Совсем как намек на то, что у вас все упадет в этом доме плясок смерти

[h1]"А это еще что такое?"[/h1]
Бл@. Ты совсем дурак чтоли? Это мои седые волосы в три часа ночи

ЗЫ

Данная игра является лучшим музыкальным симулятором всех времен. Ваш бард начинается тут и сейчас, а всякие Шейферовские Брутальные легенды лишь позорят мой музыкальный топор.
И да, если вы плохо споете, то вас хорошо отпоют. По одному и всей компанией. И я не об эльфах-идиотах.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192999331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1690917816}
review: If you're like me and looking to pick up the original Bards Tale 1-3 trilogy, which is included in this, I wouldn't recommend it. I'm experiencing a bug that erases all your progress/save once you close the game and reopen it, which makes it pretty much unplayable. Poking around online resulted in others complaining about the same thing, and some potential fixes, but I'm kind of over it. Don't advertise that Bards Tale 1 is included if it doesn't work out of the box.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983058251', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1700931794}
review:
The game is kinda funny, but janky.

Bugs (linux):
- The controls keep breaking (bard keeps running, or get stuck and can barely run) if you get hit when changing weapon or playing a song, or if playing songs too quickly, the controls get stuck.
- Savegames got erased once.
- The game randomly crashes.
- Curscens can break and softlock, the bard got stuck under ground in the water on the ferry thing, he kept walking out in the water then sank.

I want play it but it's horribly buggy and I try anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996314021', 'num_games_owned': 1279, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1629068736}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043388988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1691433167}
review: A really funny and well executed game. Superb narration, controls can be a little tricky. The low play time is due to playing if offline about a decade ago. Currently playing it again so have amended this review. It is still very funny with superb narration and still extremely well executed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998543056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 616, 'playtime_forever': 3753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3753, 'last_played': 1689366725}
review:
Genuinely one of the worst games I've ever played. So extremely badly designed it's unbelievable. 

I know my playtime is extremely high for this kind of game but I've tried to play through it a few times before the "Remaster" and have a TON of AFK time too.

You easily get SPAMMED both by enemies in numbers and stun-locking, attack spam. Enemies can attack you whilst you're down and you have no i-frames or invincibility frames when you're down, so you keep taking damage as you character SLOWLY recovers and then probably gets knocked down/stun-locked again anyway.

The balance of this game is non-existent and it requires extreme grinding and min-maxing even on the easiest difficulty. There's no warning about certain enemies being WAY stronger than you and them being able to one shot you potentially or two-shot usually and same for traps in some new areas too. 

It's just an extremely cynical, insufferable, irritating, miserable experience. I keep trying to give it more chances, chances to improve but its so bleak and I'm clearly insane/masochistic/operating on the blindest faith at this point.

In the first major dungeon and outside of it too, I was SWARMED by extremely strong enemies and despite having decent levels, loot and stats, me and my summons were still getting steamrolled generally.
I don't even know how THE FUCK the game expects you to play on higher difficulties with MUCH less stat points too!

The writing is just very self indulgent and there is a lot of humour that is absolutely beaten into the ground at times, including summons repeating the same voice lines OVER AND OVER AND OVER CONSTANTLY and this absolutely unfunny, way too dragged out, repetitious gags with the "Bodhs" in Kirkwall.

90% of the game is combat and thus grinding too, its extremely clunky, awkward and tedious too. Healing is a complete mess and on harder difficulties you get less save points and the game has no auto save at all, so if you die, you lose a LOT  of progress potentially.

There a LOT of cutscenes with the extreme self indulgence of the writer going on too, the writer who thinks they are the funniest and smartest person in the room, in every room, in every place and is the equivalent of Family Guy with those extremely long, forced, annoying, mood ruining etc cutaway gags and abuse of jokes until they're nothing but a bloody pulp at best.

The "Remaster" isn't even a remaster with the slightest of "upgrades" possible, no improvements on the controls, UI, key bindings and such. It's the most laziest, shameless, pathetic excuse for a remaster I've ever seen and there is VAST competition for that in this industry too.

The trailer introduced me to fantastic music and the setting is wonderful, I love the snarky parody of fantasy stories and RPGs BUT this game like a lot of parodies tends to try too hard and take it too far and ruin what good they have too.

I strongly cannot recommend this at all. One of the worst games I've ever played. I don't know why I gave it so much time in the first place but I guess me and this game have an ironically kindred lack of self respect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350412670', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2797, 'last_played': 1689074135}
review: The best part about this game is it doesn't feel like you're playing by yourself. Between the narrator's unique experience with the main character "The Bard", and the companions you can summon as you progress through the story you'll be hard pressed to be bored.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967516650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1689066448}
review:
This game is just really bad.. the humour is great, but everything else is making the experience bad.
Boring gameplay (way too much grind), and locks up on cinematics/ travel moments etc.
Just.. all about "my first video game"-vibes (but humour is great, so I didn't demand a refund and still try to play through it every now and then)

author: {'steamid': '76561198973817671', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1688847712}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034599753', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1463, 'last_played': 1688497537}
review: Просто отличная игра! Совет, если будете в нее играть, то лучше играть с джойстика

author: {'steamid': '76561197998690715', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1687806800}
review:
The Bard's Tale is a parody of fantasy RPG's, it makes fun of the kind of generic quests and characters you would usually find in a game like this. There's a lot of genuinely hilarious voice acting, the characters accents and the whole snarky tone of the story are very appealing and are the best part of this game.

Sadly the combat is old school in the worst possible way. Your attacks feel like you are fighting with a wet rolled up newspaper and enemies swarm and stunlock you until you die. You could play a ranged build and snipe them with a bow from outside their agro range but where is the fun in that?
The story is nice but 90% of your playtime will be spent dealing with this shite combat.
Also controller support is not very good. I used a PS4 controller and the game tells me to "press button 1". The hell is button 1? Once you figure that out you then have to get to grips with which buttons 2 - 8 are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077623263', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1687811897}
review:
[h1] A nice memory of old RPGs, but should stay a memory [/h1] 

[b] Overall [/b] : 5/10

The Bards Tale will give to the nostalgic, a flavor of the RPGs of old. The story, while basic, was quite funny to go through. However, I can't recommend it in 2023, and only went through to get rid of 1 more backlog game.

[b] Gameplay [/b] : 4/10

Very basic. Combines melee, archery and magic.

[b] Graphics [/b] : 3/10

I mean, the game is super old. Do not look for good graphics here

[b] Story [/b] : 5/10

The scenario itself is basic. However, the storytelling is very fun, as they actually make fun of those cliches.

[b] Achievements [/b] : 9/10

For the hunters out there, this game is rather pleasant to 100%. Very straightforward, and obtained while completing 1 playthrough. Just play straight on Old School Mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103874486', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1297, 'last_played': 1685869196}
review:
This game has aged really poorly. I can imagine myself playing this when it came out in my early teens and having loads of fun, but not now.

First, the good:
The story, characters, dialogue, songs - everything like that is just amazing. It's tongue and cheek humour, kid friendly adult jokes, story that is cliche as can be while almost every single character from friend to foe is making fun of that fact, the songs that you can't help but sing along, and a lot more.

But where the gameplay begins, the fun times end.
The combat is average, even by it's release day standards, but that is not the problem. The problem is that it makes up around 95% of the game, and that you'll be fighting the controls just as much as the enemies.
The controls are unresponsive, the enemies too spongy, getting stunlocked is really easy, your summon/companion AI is pretty trash... Honestly, the combat is just tedious while feeling too easy, but rushing ahead just a bit too much almost instantly gets you stunlocked or just surrounded and then killed. And if that wasn't enough, you will also need to grind some levels because later enemies get even more tanky and the combat will become even slower.
Also, why the hell the bard game that has great songs has barely any background music? Most of the maps just have a background ambience that's on repeat and can last for literal hours while you are clearing the location...

I don't know if i will finish this game, and if i do, it will probably require the use of cheats to skip as much combat as possible to make it enjoyable.

For those who want to try to play, just go for the easy difficulty and max out your preferred combat stat as soon as possible.
And for anyone else, just find some story/dialogue compilation and watch that...

author: {'steamid': '76561198019683606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2796, 'last_played': 1672416356}
review:
Not a classic The Bard's Tale™ experience, and definitely a parody of both the original game and the RPG genre as whole, but still fun neverthless.

The only "shame" on this might be the fact that the (long - term) gameplay seems to lack something that the lore, humor and voiceacting certainly didn't.

Still, I'd rate this game 7/10 for its self - humor, songs, dialogues and general anti-fantasy approach to cliche fantasy tropes (the Polish dubbing of this game is particulary meaty one!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198808786246', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1306, 'last_played': 1683356074}
review: Я люблю эту игру. И тем не менее, я НИКОМУ не советую играть в неё самостоятельно (на сложностях кроме лёгкой). Персонажи, сюжет, сценарий, всё это в игре - отменное, я прямо обожаю её юмор, но конкретно ИГРАТЬ в неё натурально больно. Система блоков у противников, их постоянный респавн при перезаходе на локацию, дурацкая система прокачки(давай, сначала купи оружие, и только через два уровня научись его брать в руки), финальный босс, который отбирает у тебя союзников - основную механику игры, всё это и ещё некоторые неупомянутые вещи делают прохождение этой прекрасной, с точки зрения сюжета, игры, невероятно раздражающим и болезненным, начиная буквально с самых первых локаций. Я очень советую посмотреть прохождение, или играть на минимальной сложности, но прошу вас, избегайте геймплейного опыта этой игры, он убьёт всё остальное.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194995051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1683492005}
review:
Giving this a nominal thumbs up, primarily for the phenomenal voice acting and general snarky attitude. Loved the songs and characters as well.

However, the actual game play was frustrating, and ultimately made this one too much to continue. I know I'm regretting not hearing more of the story or characters, but it just ended up being too much work to fully enjoy. (Controls, flow of combat, pathfinding -- not fun.)

So, I am giving this a technical thumbs up for its creativity, but in terms of technical gaming, a thumbs down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005661217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1683022249}
review:
This game has THE WORST combat I have ever experienced. Unresponsive and unbalanced (a wolf can knock you down and you cant get up again so you slowly die over the course of a minute, or mages will just chain cast a spell and knock you over). The Menu will randomly pop up during combat, randomly you'll just stop being able to attack or move, or you'll just stand there charging something up while not touching anything? 

The story and voice acting is great, the gameplay....complete trash, and unfortunately, combat is a large chunk of this game. Additionally, the RPG stats (charisma/Luck) do nothing.

If you buy the game, do yourself a favour, play on easiest setting, stack into dex and just bow attack everything off screen to speed through and enjoy the story.

If this game had some of the modern polish even the most basic games come with these days, it'd be amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198394442936', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2267, 'last_played': 1682013260}

author: {'steamid': '76561199337888200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1681320863}
review:
I've beaten it twice in my life, once as a teenager when it was new on the PS2 and again a few years later, but these last ten years or so have been so unkind to it that I can't force this third.

If you like the PS2 era Dungeons & Dragons ARPGs (Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance 1+2 and Champions of Norrath 1+2)) you should just play them instead. Make the gameplay slower and a lot less fun, remove class options, and try to counter boring action with a funny story and here's what you get. The Bard's Tale might be the same basic style of game but it's so clunky and repetitive that even nostalgia can't compensate. I'm maybe 40% through now but the best is over and I have better standards now than I did then.

It's a very soft recommendation for anyone interested in the history of Western ARPGs or that have the four games above but still want a weaker clone, but it's a very hard pass for everyone else. 4/10, this is why remasters need noticeable quality of life improvements and not just updated graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054216330', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 2025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2025, 'last_played': 1681205029}
review:
[h1]Handlung[/h1]
Unser Held, ein berüchtigter Schürzenjäger und Musikant, auch bekannt als "Der Barde" ist gerade dabei, im Keller eines Wirtshauses die Ungezieferplage auszumerzen, als er von einem kauzigen alten Mann auf die vermeintlich epische Quest geschickt wird, die obligatorische Maid in Nöten aus den Fängen des obligatorischen bösen Zauberers zu befreien. Weniger sein Hang zum Heldentum, als die Aussicht auf ein ausgelassenes Stelldichein mit einer echten (reichen) Prinzessin bewegen unseren Titelgebenden Schwerenöter dazu, sich der Sache anzunehmen und dabei das eine oder andere Fettnäpchen mitzunehmen.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

[b][u]eine Mär von Klobigen Kämpfen und anderen Widrigkeiten[/u][/b]

Wenn The Bards Tale Das ARPG eine gravierende schwäche aufweist, dann ist es wohl das [b]Kampfsystem[/b]. Unser Held ist, gemessen an der Masse an Gegnern, recht träge in der Bewegung und schlägt oder schießt auch gern mal dahin, wo er nicht soll. Hinzu kommt das eher lacklustere [b]Balancing und Levelupsystem[/b]. Traditionell werden nach einem Level-Up statuspunkte verteilt, die aber allenfalls auf Konstitution wirklich einen Unterschied zu machen scheinen, denn die Stärke erhöht den Angriffsschaden unseres Recken alle zwei verteilten lediglich um eins, was gemessen an dem Schaden, den die Waffen austeilen, vor allem gegen Ende kaum bis keinen echten Unterschied macht, zumal man diese ohne Statusbedingung anlegen kann. Ob man damit dann allerdings was bewirkt ist oft dem Zufall überlassen, denn das stärkste Schwert im Spiel richtet zwischen 20 und 56 Schaden an und nicht selten (vor allem im Endgame) ploppt auch nach einem erfolgreichen Treffer keine Zahl über dem Kopf des Feindes auf, was wohl bedeutet, dass der angerichtete Schaden null beträgt. Das und der Umstand, dass Gegner teils viele Lebenspunkte haben und eigentlich immer in großer Zahl auftreten, macht Kämpfe schon mal zur Geduldsprobe.

[b][u]Beschwörbare Kampfgefährten für alle Fälle[/u][/b]

Ein Schlüssel-Feature im Spiel ist die Möglichkeit, [b]Begleiter[/b] durch Musik herbeizurufen, die dann an der Seite des Barden Kämpfen oder andere wichtige Aufgaben wie das entschärfen von Fallen übernehmen. Offiziell sind die wackeren Gefährten eine Unterstützung im Kampf, aber tatsächlich sind sie oft nur besseres [b]Kanonenfutter[/b], das die Feindhorden auf Abstand hält, damit der Barde die Feinde mehr oder weniger in Ruhe dezimieren kann. Der mit Abstand wichtigste Begleiter ist ein Heiler, den man zum Glück recht zeitig bekommt. Ein weiterer Wermutstropfen ist, WO denn die eifrigen Helfer beschworen werden, denn der Ort ist gefühlt zufällig. Mehr als ein Mal habe ich meine Heilerin mitten in einer Falle beschworen, die die Heilerin dann traditionell zu Schaschlik oder Pfannkuchen verarbeitet hat.

[b][u]Meckern auf hohem Niveau[/u][/b]
[list]
[*] Einige der [b]Attribute[/b], die zur Steigerung bereit stehen lohnen sich nicht oder kaum. Konstitution ist noch das nützlichste, danach kommen Stärke und Geschick, um den Schaden ein wenig zu pushen. Kaum zu gebrauchen ist wohl das musikalische Talent, da es die stärke der Kampfgefährten wirklich nur marginal anhebt. Glück und Charisma kann man vernachlässigen, da man gerade am Ende kaum Geldprobleme hat.

[*] Es gibt viele [b]"Points of no return"[/b], die nicht angekündigt werden, wodurch Errungenschaften gern mal verpassbar sind

[*] Für einen [b]Barden[/b] hat der Barde kaum wirklich was drauf. Alles, was er kann, ist die beschwörung von Kanonenfutter. Keine Buff-Songs oder andere magische Lieder wie etwa in der mitgelieferten Trillogie.

[/list]

[h1]Schwierigkeitsgrad[/h1]

Die Schwierigkeit ist in drei Stufen zu Beginn eines Durchlaufs einstellbar und deffiniert sich dadurch, wie hoch die Startwerte des Barden sind. Auf "Leicht" ist man zu Beginn eigentlich fast stärker als am Ende auf "Schwer"

[h1]Soundtrack, Grafik, Steuerung[/h1]

Die akkustische Untermalung ist vermutlich die große Stärke des Spiels. Zwar hat man sich bei der Ambientmusik gut zurückgehalten, allerdings gibt es viele Gesangseinlagen (in englisch), die sogar zum Mitsingen einladen, auch wenn der Gelbe punkt, der den Takt angibt, öfter mal hinter dem Text lag.

Die Grafik ist nicht schlecht, aber halt auch eben nicht sonderlich gut. Muss man mögen, gestört hat es mich nicht.

Für die Steuerung werden Maus und Tastatur verwendet. Normal bewegt man sich mittels WASD durch die Welt und bedient die Maus, um das Ziel für Angriffe festzulegen.

[h1]Zusammenfassung[/h1]
[b]Pro:[/b]
[list]
[*] Nette Gesangseinlagen
[*] Lustiger Humor in Form markiger Kommentare des Erzählers und Barden
[/list]

[b]Kontra:[/b]
[list]
[*] Kämpfe träge
[*] Beschwörungen nur bedingt hilfreich
[/list]

[b]Achievements[/b]
[list]
[*] Einige sind leicht zu bekommen
[*] Einige sind mit Grinding verbunden
[*] Einige sind schwer zu bekommen
[/list]

[b]Fazit:[/b]
Bei kaum einem Spiel musste ich mich so schwer tun, mich für eine Bewertung zu entscheiden. Gäbe es Informative Reviews, hätte ich eines gegeben. Das Gameplay ist hier wirklich kein Kaufgrund, aber insgesamt hat mir das Spiel schon Spaß gemacht und auf geringeren Schwierigkeitsgraden lässt es sich auch recht gut spielen. Auch den Humor und die Gesangseinlagen fand ich erfrischend und die drei mitgelieferten Bards Tale Teile sind sehr gut, wenn man gridbasierte Dungeoncrawler mit Runden-Kampfsystem mag, weshalb ich eine Kaufempfehlung unter Vorbehalt ausspreche.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091451306', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1320, 'last_played': 1679783187}
review:
[critique tirée de mon SensCritique]
J'ai adoré joué à Zenith qui proposait un héros qui se foutait royalement des ficelles scénaristiques et jouait littéralement avec les codes et les clichés de Fantasy et, plus généralement, des histoires d'aventures et de chevaliers. Donc, quand j'ai découvert que The Bard's Tale allait être du même gabarit, j'étais plus qu'aux anges. Alors, qu'ai-je pensé de ce jeu ?

Nous incarnons le Barde qui pérégrine de villages en villages en quête d'argent et de jolies jeunes femmes quand, arrivé dans un énième bourg lugubre, il fait la connaissance du... scénario, littéralement (quand je vous dis que c'est du génie), qui lui indique que si il va dans la forêt, il devrait se retrouver embarquer dans une histoire de princesse à sauver et de sorcier à détruire.

Donc, concernant l'intrigue dans sa matière la plus noble, c'est du vu et revu. De ce fait, ce n'est pas tant l'intrigue en soi qui est intéressante, mais plutôt la manière que les protagonistes et le narrateur usent pour parodier l'aventure. Et pour cela, quelques situations cocasses non dénudées d'humour (typiquement : le butin que l'on peut trouver dans un loup que l'on vient de tuer, les quêtes qui sont désignées par un curseur sur la carte, les pièges et embuscades apparentes ou, encore mieux, les fameux Élus - meilleur running gag du jeu), des discussions protagoniste-narrateur mais surtout un énorme retournement de situation concernant la conclusion de notre quête qui nous prouve que les scénaristes ont quand même bien bossé leurs clichés. Un cocktail d'auto-dérision et d'éléments parodiques qui fonctionne à merveille !

Pour ce qui est des personnages, notre Barde est attachant dans sa manière d'être et de penser en héros solitaire devant combattre pour sauver, ou condamner, le monde. Car c'est un point que l'on souligne dès le début de l'aventure, c'est un héros solitaire - plutôt contre son gré. A quoi on va ajouter une fonction sympathique et intéressante concernant la construction de notre héros : ce dernier va en effet récupérer tout au long de son aventure des partitions qui, une fois qu'il les aura jouées, fera apparaître un compagnon (une quinzaine disponible, tous ayant leur spécificité propre ; de l'archère à distance au soldat en armure lourde en passant par la danseuse à moitié à poil qui va désarçonner l'ennemi à la vieille sorcière qui soigne). Et c'est vraiment intéressant, le fait d'accentuer la solitude de notre héros avec la multiple présence de personnes non réelles - techniquement, ce sont des illusions - tout en se focalisant sur les piques du narrateur se moquant des incapacités de notre héros à réussir quelque chose avec quelqu'un. Et cette fonction primordiale est presque tout le temps... aux fraises ! Alors oui, c'est une bonne idée, ça offre de la créativité et de l'inventivité dans la manière d'aborder les différents chapitres et affrontements mais dans la pratique, nos alliés sont soit complètement stupides soit totalement faibles, ce qui peut donner des séquences d'affrontement, dans un premier temps, amusantes mais qui peuvent rapidement exaspérer... Néanmoins, on saluera cette fonction et approche du jeu.
Ce sont donc des interactions croustillantes que l'on nous propose pour cette aventure qui saura briller par cet aspect.

A l'instar de Zenith, nous sommes évidemment face à un RPG, ce qui signifie des attributs et compétences à maximiser, du matériel à récupérer et il faut qu'on en parle dès maintenant mais quel est ce principe vraiment pas ouf consistant à vendre automatiquement tes armes quand tu en reçoit une plus puissante lors de la quête principale ? Concrètement, j'aimerais avoir la possibilité de décider par moi-même quand je dois/veux vendre mon arsenal et si je dois effectivement le changer, je ne souhaite pas que l'on m'impose ce genre de choix ! Alors, certes, on peut acheter du matériel dans les grandes villes, mais on va surtout être en permanence en train d'économiser pour acheter de vieilles cartes qui ouvriront des zones sur la carte du monde pour chopper de l'équipement unique et des amulettes augmentant définitivement nos statistiques. Et quand ce n'est pas pour quelques cartes, c'est pour dépenser nos deniers dans les tavernes en boissons, qui offrent des bonus non négligeables et surtout, à durée vraiment optimale ! En plus de cela, il y aura quelques petites quêtes secondaires mais trop peu à mon goût pour être véritablement appréciées...

Pour le bestiaire, nous sommes obligés de parler des combats. En effet, nous avons un bestiaire plutôt étoffé suivant la région où l'on se trouve et ce dernier va une grande partie de notre temps de jeu vouloir nous pourrir la vie. Je m'explique : en dehors des différents tableaux/chapitres, nous circulons sur une carte qui fait drôlement penser à celle que l'on a dans le jeu Zenith : on voit le monde et nous, nous déplaçant dessus, mais on voit également les monstres se déplacer dessus et surtout, foncer sur nous dès le moment où on entre dans leur champ de vision, ce qui nous force à combattre des hordes aléatoire (en terme de nombre) d'ennemis. Des ennemis qui vont rapidement nous énerver sachant qui sont passionnés par l'ancestrale technique de la parade h24, et ça devient juste épuisant quand, au bout de notre quinzième frappe, la garde de l'ennemi ne flanche pas ; d'autant que l'ennemi peut esquiver/parer les tirs d'arbalètes et d'arcs. Autant dire qu'au bout d'un moment, on en vient à insulter leurs parents... Et les combats, on en a vraiment partout et à deux endroits en particulier où on peut dire que c'est un peu abusé : premièrement, durant les séquences en radeau. Les plateformes sont terriblement lentes et les ennemis nous enquiquinent régulièrement, sachant que si l'on vient à être défait, il faut recommencer l'intégralité de la ballade sur l'eau ! Deuxième point, et c'est plus une remarque qu'une critique négative : les tours. Durant notre périple, nous allons devoir vaincre trois gardiens nous attendant au sommet de trois tours. Chaque tour possède trois étages remplis de nombreux ennemis. Au sommet, le boss est à combattre et une fois vaincu, il faut redescendre les trois étages qui sont... de nouveaux remplis d'ennemis. Alors, pour la première tour, ça va encore. Mais au bout de la troisième tour, cela devient délicatement redondant et long... Surtout que ! Il y a une quatrième tour ! La dernière ! Dont le nombre d'étage correspondant au nombre de types de créatures que l'on a rencontré dans le jeu, soit une petite vingtaine. Alors certes, c'est une manière originale d'approcher la fin du jeu, mais quitte à faire, j'aurais aimé moins d'étages à cette fichue tour !
Donc, en clair, le système de combat n'est pas forcément le point fort du jeu et c'est dommage parce qu'on passe clairement son temps à se battre. Heureusement que l'auto-dérision nous permet d'oublier un instant que ledit système est quelque peu claqué au sol pour nous accrocher.

Concernant les graphismes, pour un jeu de 2005, force est de constater que ce n'est pas vilain, même si la vue de dessus nous empêche de voir le moindre relief sous un bon prisme. Mais dans l'ensemble, la patte graphique n'est clairement pas dérangeante.

Pour ce qui est des musiques, on arrive à une pépite. Déjà, les ambiances sont sympathiques, les quelques mélodies entraînantes mais surtout ! profession de barde oblige, tout au long de notre aventure, nous allons avoir le droit à quelques chansons pas piquées des hannetons ! Mention spéciale à ce propos aux chants consacrés aux Élus qui sont à chaque fois bienvenues !

The Bard's Tale fait donc parti de ces jeux clairement rafraîchissants, qui se moque des conventions et des codes instaurés pour raconter les histoires d'aventure et réussit parfaitement sa parodie en proposant des séquences burlesques, inattendues et diablement efficaces. On regrettera cependant le système de combat qui est très clairement un frein à notre joyeuse et atypique aventure...

author: {'steamid': '76561198117293086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1526, 'last_played': 1684795054}
review: Wow, barely a day of play & I managed to finish the first play through. Put it down for awhile, but now I have an itch to play again. It was so good when a dear friend on here recommended it to me, sadly that friend has gone quiet for years now so idk if they're still around. But thank you Foxo, it's a wonderful game & I'll always think of you when I play it. ~

author: {'steamid': '76561198871750617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1668, 'last_played': 1680619758}
review: This game wont wow you with gameplay or graphics, but what you get is an experiance like non other game that I've played. The mechanics are very outdated, of course the original game is from 2004 so its normal, but thats not where the game shines. The writing is top level and very very funny. I've never laughed so much in a game. The voice actors are amazing in their delivery especialy the main character and the narator. The game never takes itself seriously and that makes you want to move further with the plot to see what happens and what other funny situation the bard gets himself in. Its basically a joke with the whole RPG Save the world type of games and I loved it 15 years ago when I played it for the first time and I loved it now. If you dont expect alot in terms of gameplay and graphics and just want to play something unique, fresh,fun and something that you can just kick back to, drink a beer and sing along to, then this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019180861', 'num_games_owned': 893, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2915, 'last_played': 1680488517}
review:
Get the windowed mod, which will help solve some frame rate issues. The game will be stuck to the upper left corner of the screen so depending on the chosen resolution, it may not cover the entire screen.

Other than that, the songs are great, especially the beer song, although the many, many versions of Bad Luck To Be You got annoying.

Fairly tongue-in-cheek story, making fun of some RPG tropes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032589399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 269, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1547983043}
review: The Bard's Tale ARPG: Remastered and Resnarkled - це оновлена версія класичної гри, що вийшла багато років тому. Гра пропонує гравцям унікальний гумор, захоплюючі пригоди та чудовий геймплей. Головний герой - бард, який протистоїть темряві та злу, що охопило країну. Гра має неймовірно деталізовані локації, різноманітних ворогів та безліч загадок. Бої в грі використовують елементи хак-енд-слешу та стратегії. На жаль, гра не бездоганна - деякі бої можуть бути трохи незручними, а також гра містить деякі помилки та баги. Проте, якщо ви любите ігри з глибоким сюжетом та чудовим геймплеєм, The Bard's Tale ARPG: Remastered and Resnarkled є грою, яку варто спробувати.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204445600', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1679592167}
review: Хотел бы я похвалить пародийность и высмеивание жанра РПГ, но смешно было бы, если бы эта игра сама по себе была качественной, а не хуже тех самых игр, которые она высмеивает. Этот ремастер ощущается так, будто бы был сделан для мобильной платформы. А то что вылили в Стим, это явно не ремастер - это будто бы обратный порт с мобилок. Я как раз играл на телефоне впервые и там эта игра ощущалась вполне себе годной относительно других мобильных игр. Но для ПК всё сделано не так: и управление местами неудобное, и геймплей рутинный, и сложность несбалансированная, и сохранения из-за сложности откидывают тебя минут на 20 назад. Юмор и графоний вызывают ностальгические ощущения, хоть и можно до них тоже докопаться. Озвучка хороша, причём и английская и русская. Также порадовал главный герой, напоминающий мне то Дюка Нюкема, то Чувака из Постала. Но этого недостаточно, чтобы хотеть продолжать играть в игру, которая настолько увлеклась пародийностью, что будто бы смеётся сама над собой...

author: {'steamid': '76561198123445346', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1670, 'last_played': 1638826470}
review:
Первое и самое главное: играть только с озвучкой Клюквина (1С) [i](ну, если господа издатели в стиме снова решат что вы достойны платить им дань)[/i]. Для отечественных локализаторов краткого периода 2000~2007 вообще характерно, что они для игры стараются больше, чем оригинальные актёры, и это очередной того столп; англичане тут не то чтобы рядом не стояли — на киломилю не подойдут. Песни спели да на выход.

Приставочность эпохи [strike]верхнего палеолита[/strike] второй плойки тут не то что налицо, она обволакивает и стекает по всем действующим лицам, включая игрока. Кривой вид сверху на проплешины монстров, мотательный интерфейс, сохранения где скажет разработчик, игровой процесс не терпящий существенных изменений от крысиного подвала до башни тёмного властелина, прохождение при этом линейнее схемы казанского метрополитена. Тем не менее, по сравнению с оригинальной версией играть можно даже без привкуса кактуса во рту [i](а с ароматом идентичным натуральному)[/i], а учитывая что люди в других обзорах жалуются на проблемы игры через джойстик, то справедливость достигнута.

Но это идеальный пример того, как сохраняются хорошие игры. Было ли раньше веселее 20 с гаком часов призывать своих чудиков под тип чудиков атакующих? Ни черта подобного, тогда Бард был столь же затянут и скуден на интересные подземелья. Но за свои грехи он платит туповатым, но плотным и ненапряжным юмором, который при этом тоже не постарел. Благодаря песням, склокам Барда с рассказчиком, клоунаде нпц и творящейся в каждой локации дичи он и запоминается, и вспоминается с равным удовольствием и тёплой улыбкой. 
Трудно вспомнить игры, где было бы столь же приятно достигать очередной сценки на движке, где сюжет действительно служил в игре не оправданием для, а наградой за. И только благодаря этому чувству диск/ярлык не отправляется в корзину с недолюбленными недоделками, а остаётся украшением коллекции, которое будет актуально покуда люди жадны, глупы и себялюбивы. И пока создают ролевые игры со своими бесконечными штампами, условностями и типажами.

З.Ы. не знаю уж, про что было продолжение (хотя и в курсе, что оно было продолжением скорее оригинальных бродилок из восьмидесятых), но мой интерес обрубил первый диалог, где [i]типа-[/i]нпс [i]типа-[/i]возмущался на тему [i]типа-[/i]иммигрантов. От безбашенной юморески длинною в игру до твиттерской агитки: вот и весь путь твой, inXile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971177676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1679065263}
review:
The Bard's TaleをテーマにしたPS2時代のアクションRPGリマスター版。

アクション要素は少なくどちらかと言えば昔のハクスラゲー。主人公はあまり強くないので魔法で仲間を召喚（最大同時４体まで）して戦う。召喚できる仲間の種類が意外に多く（16種類）、攻撃/防御/探索/精霊のカテゴリから選択でき、状況によって組み合わせを変えて有利にゲームを進めることができる。

武器の種類は多くなく、剣盾/両手剣/フレイル/二刀流/弓から選択できるが、新しい武器を入手すると古い武器は勝手に売却or廃棄されるという割り切った仕様になっている。武器依存の戦闘スキルはシールドバッシュや貫通アロー等それぞれにあるが、種類はかなり少ないのでやはりバトルは召喚魔法がメインとなる。ボスキャラを倒すと召喚可能になり、強力な全体魔法を使えるようになるが、強制アニメーションで毎回ゲームが止まるのでテンポが悪い。

最初の町で犬を仲間にすることができ、戦闘時に率先して壁になってくれる。弱いのですぐノックアウトされてしまうが、しばらくすると復活して健気に主人を守ろうとする。犬は召喚枠を使わないし、召喚魔法が制限されたエリアでも活動できるので心強い相棒である。この忠犬システムは非常に良くできており、主力にはならず強化もできないが、ただのコンパニオン枠でもなく、少しだけ役に立つかわいい存在として最後までいっしょにいてくれる。

ゲーム自体が古めかしく、描画処理が遅くなったり画面が狭かったりで遊びにくい、フォントが特殊で読みづらい等不満点は多いものの、犬がかわいいのでおすすめ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198224359452', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1673847367}
review: even better than i remember as a kid

author: {'steamid': '76561197988249826', 'num_games_owned': 754, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1756, 'last_played': 1678296148}
review:
Getting 100% was... a look into what PC gaming used to be before we had standards in game design, UI, balance, controls or quality of life

approximate amount of time to 100%: 20-30
Estimated achievement difficulty: 6/10 (1/10 with cheats)
Minimum number of playthroughs needed: 1 
Multiplayer achievements: No.
Missable achievements: Yes. Multiple (recommend guide)
Grinding Achievements: Yes. (Donate 20.000 gold in steps of ~ 500 after slowly farming it in combat)
DLC-Only achievements: No.
Time-gated achievements: No.
Speed-run achievements: No.
RNG-achievements: No.
Does difficulty affect achievements: Yes. But higher dficulties unlock lower ones as well.
Unobtainable/glitched achievements: No.

Notes:
- The controls would make you throw your controller out the window... that is IF the game had controller support :)
- The Cheats (with Left-Shift + arrow keys on PC) work and they do not block achievements. Use them if you want to mess with your enjoyment of the game ... or when you're frustrated with the shitty controls and game balance.
- No crashes, game's surprisingly stable.
- There are multiple points of no return. SAVE often (recommend in a different file at each save point).

In my subjective opinion the game has aged poorly. The humor is not as witty n'or funny as advertised, though it did make me giggle a few times, so i'll give it that.

So yeah, especially for that price [20$], I can't recommend it, even on sale. 
This is another clear case where you should watch a let's play to experience the aged puns and jokes instead of subjecting yourself to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198992638247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1456, 'last_played': 1683521350}
review: Easy controls and amusing dialogue

author: {'steamid': '76561198023098585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1677345070}
review:
The Bard's Tale - это легенда, в которую поиграть стоит каждому. Тут классный сюжет и весёлый искромётный юмор. Однако совершенно не рекомендую ремастер этой игры. Несмотря на то, что графику сделали более современной, разработчики запороли управление в игре. При игре на геймпаде персонаж периодически начинает постоянно куда-то бежать, а остановить его перемещение можно только лишь нажав клавишу "блок". Из-за этого не получится призывать помощников - они просто не появляются. Причём этот баг ломает ещё и кат-сцены, так как персонаж находится не в том месте, где должен находиться по задумке создателей игры - и выглядит это нелепо. 

Попробовал играть на клавиатуре и мыши - и вновь проблемы с управлением в определённых местах игры. В какие-то моменты персонаж просто перестаёт перемещаться, застревает - и приходится нажимать клавишу "блок". Это полностью портит впечатление от игры и мешает комфортному прохождению.

Судя по обсуждениям этой игры в Steam, люди жалуются на подобную проблему, как минимум, с 2018 года. То есть за 5 лет разработчик не удосужился исправить баг с управлением. Ради интереса запустил эту же игру через эмулятор для PS2 (у меня образ игры есть) и сравнил - там управление абсолютно нормальное. Как можно было испортить такую потрясающую игру и 5 лет игнорировать серьёзный баг, мешающий прохождению, я не понимаю. Разработчики, неужели нельзя было протестировать игру? Это какой-то позор!

author: {'steamid': '76561198443540479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5814, 'last_played': 1677314511}
review: adventure

author: {'steamid': '76561198001096742', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3468, 'last_played': 1676773174}
review:
I decided to play the ARPG of this game again after remembering playing it for the PS2. I love the story but the mechanics leaves a lot to be desired. 

The melee system isn't good, even for it's time.
The bow is pretty broken, you can kill things off screen and if the enemy is on the edge you can see them lag or not respond to being attacked.
Most of the summons are worthless.

The I frames of when you are using the crystals to heal are helpful but when you are mid action you cannot do anything else. For example, if you are attacking you can't summon anything or use the crystals and the same is true for using the crystals or summoning.

when you have your menus open, aside from the character sheet or main menu, and you have a timed even, the clock still counts down.

The story is stupid and enjoyable, I would love to see this remastered rather than ported. 7/10 would play it at least once. As for the older games that comes with this, no clue. didn't bother playing them as that was before my time and I don't want to learn them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3221, 'num_reviews': 1484, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1670342060}
review:
The Bard's Tale ARPG: Remastered and Resnarkled, 1985 yılında piyasaya sürülen orijinal The Bard's Tale oyununun bir yeniden yapımıdır. Oyun, inovatif oynanış mekanikleri, unutulmaz müzikleri ve eğlenceli hikayesi ile dikkat çekiyor.

The Bard's Tale ARPG: Remastered and Resnarkled, aksiyon odaklı bir rol yapma oyunudur. Oyuncular, Bard adlı kahramanı kontrol ederler ve hikaye boyunca farklı yerleri keşfederler. Oyunda, hem birinci şahıs hem de üçüncü şahıs kamera açıları kullanılır. Oyuncular, düşmanlarla savaşır, bulmacaları çözer ve farklı karakterlerle etkileşimde bulunur.

Oyun, Remastered sürümü ile güncellenmiş grafikleri sunuyor. Orijinal oyunun 8 bit piksel sanatı, bu sürümde modern bir dokunuşla yeniden tasarlandı. Ayrıca, oyunun müzikleri de yeniden kaydedildi ve yüksek kaliteli ses efektleri eklenerek daha zengin bir deneyim sunuldu.

The Bard's Tale ARPG: Remastered and Resnarkled, oyunculara birçok farklı seçenek sunuyor. Oyuncular, karakterlerinin sınıfını, yeteneklerini ve ekipmanlarını özelleştirebilirler. Ayrıca, oyunun hikayesi, oyuncuların verdiği kararlara bağlı olarak farklı yönlere doğru ilerleyebilir.

Oyunun tek dezavantajı, bazı yerlerde aşırı zorluğu olabilir. Oyuncular, zorlu bulmacaları ve düşmanları aşmak için stratejik düşünmek zorundadırlar. Ancak, bu zorluklar aynı zamanda oyunun keyifli ve tatmin edici bir deneyim sunmasına da katkıda bulunuyor.

Sonuç olarak, The Bard's Tale ARPG: Remastered and Resnarkled, orijinal oyunun hayranlarına ve yeni oyunculara eğlenceli bir deneyim sunuyor. Oyunun güncellenmiş grafikleri, unutulmaz müzikleri ve zorlu bulmacaları, oyunculara uzun süreli bir oynanış sunuyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041635200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7529, 'last_played': 1676075706}
review:
The Pros 

1) The Naration especially the narrator,the humor,the dialogues are all 10/10 especially considering for the time it was released the early 2000s,the golden age of RPGs.

2) The bards tastes according to him are in the order as follows women,wine and songs.The MC is definitely a man of culture,hell his entire occupation if around culture.Also i love how the dude gets roasted and trolled by everyone especially the narrator.Also there are songs that are sung by the drunks which are suprisingly good and pleasant to hear and also sung well (Good quality songs).These songs also iterate the consequences of the bards decisions and choices as well as more info on the type person he is.Yes he gets roasted in these songs too.

3) The game mechanics are also cool and original.This is the only game i seen where everything you loot is automatically converted to silver coins (game currency).Also if you find equipment in game which are superior to what is present in shops then they are removed from the store.Example you found armor superior to what the town store sells,thus when you visit then the armor category is completey removed.Also the bard can be MEAN or NICE to people in conversations via a MEAN-NICE game mechanic.Eg - you select MEAN option to a girl,then the girl retaliates by giving the bard a kick in his nuts.Man it was painful and hilarious to watch at same time.It has summon or magic songs which summon your summons from another world or dimension like the Knight,the Bodyguard,the rogue,the enchantress,the heroine etc.

4)The story while seemingly cliche on the surface is not what it seems by the end.The ending turns the cliche over its head.I will say that the story kept me interested as it was stacked up with point 1).Its serviceable and good on its own (please don't compare this with other games like the witcher as its an unfair and one sided massacre).Also nothing stands between the bard and his quest to get laids by the woman he pursues.The bard is a man of FOCUS,COMMITMENT and SHEER WILL.No man or creature can stop him,no matter their numbers they all fall to the bards sword,flail,claymore or bow.

The Cons - 
 
1) Lack of a good combat system,repetitive combat,lack of enough enemy variety and no good music played while your adventuring or lack there of result in a long and repetitive lack lustre run of the mill combat through out the game.

2) The game is locked at 30 FPS.Also it has a severe FPS drop going as far as to 1-2 FPS from 30 FPS.I encountered this in the beginning right after the opening cinematic cutscene.This is unacceptable as this is supposed to be a remaster of a 2004 game and this is not even fixed by the devs.Thankfully there is a fix by the community posted in the steam guides for this game which resolves it and locks it at 60 FPS permanently and rarely drops below 60 FPS.The difference is day and night.

3) Speaking of remaster,this is marketed as a remaster but is not a complete remaster more like a partial remaster with a partial controller support.You can't play this game with a xbox controller completely.SO BEWARE.

4)The grind is totally on another level.You get 50 XP per enemy kill which increases to around 75-85 XP via the only game collectable token which grants +10% experience points.This stacks with quest XP rewards.You need around 350,000 XP to reach the max level of 21.Yes the number of levels is only 20 as you start at lvl 1 and you get 11 talents total which you gain a talent at odd levels.So character build variety is limited to 2 - melee or ranged.Also the highest difficulty OLD SCHOOL restricts to 1 save points per area.You enter a new area you have a save spoint and no other is found until the next area.So if you die then you reload the save and have to kill all enemies again.WTF moment here.A very poor game design choice and the worst in this game.This prolongs the grind even more.This is a one trick pony game with no replayability.

Disclaimer -  I recieved this game for FREE in my steam library via the steam game giveaways that steam sometimes does.Also if you use xp cheats to circumvent the horrible grind then,i can't blame you.I finished this game on OLD school difficulty (max difficulty level),with a max level 21 bard with ranged build and 100%the game with all tokens,songs,weapons and armor as well as 100% the steam achievements.I will say this that i will not play this game ever again for a long time as i have been scarred by its grind and need to recover in real life.The ball is in your court now.If you can bear all weakness,then i recommend this game.If not,then its not a recommend for a you.I wish steam implemented a mixed review rating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058459688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1249, 'last_played': 1675634999}
review:
[h1]Gameplay: 4/10[/h1]
[h1]Graphics & Sound: 6/10[/h1]
[h1]Narration: 7/10[/h1]

✔️ Fun narration.
✔️ Original game mechanics.
✔️ Nice anglo-saxon folklore mood.

❌ Long and repetitive areas with tons of useless combat.
❌ The gameplay is generally pretty clunky.
❌ Little to no ambient music.

I think the game would be pretty nice if it had something like 1/10th of the combat and exploration content it actually has. Sadly, it is mostly comprised of fighting a reduced set of enemies for long periods of time, with pretty basic and unthrilling battle mechanics. The story is pretty fun, but it might be a better call to just watch a playthrough online if you don't have the patience for 15 hours of combat without any interest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023828096', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1675609644}
review:
Super remaster d'un classique du cRPG absurde et irrévérencieux.
La première quête consiste de vous, un barbe cherchant gîte et couvert et sans le sous de qui est.
POur ce sortir de ça, le Barbe envoute un rat et l'envoi dans un bar, créant ainsi un panique vous parmettant d'arriver à ses fins et même de s'accopiné avec la serveuse si votre skill de langue est a la hauteur de votre fourberie. 11/10
PS : ça a plutot mal veilli, soyez prévenu

review: Bard's Tale is about as classic of an RPG as you could possibly ask for (the first one did come out in the 80s after all...) and it's alot of great fun for what it is. The Dialogue and Cut Scenes are 10/10 Crude humor, the gameplay is largely just hack and slash adventure with a couple of sort of puzzles here and there. Boss fights will often keep you on your toes by introducing unique mechanics etc. Definitely recommend playing it but just be aware that the game is very old and it shows in UI and Controls

author: {'steamid': '76561198272908267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1363, 'last_played': 1543532378}
review:
While the gameplay itself is fairly average APRG fair, the comedic writing and satirical nature makes it incredibly fun. Our Bardic hero, voiced by Cary Elwes (Wesley from the Princess Bride) is a lovely scumbag and is quite entertaining to see him connive, quip and overall be a selfish antihero most RPG heroes in gaming would end up being anyway robbing everyone blind. The Narrator is also fun voiced by Tony Jay (Claude Frollo from the Disney's Hunchback of Notre Dame) and the banter between the Bard and Narrator adds to the silliness. The dialogue choice between really really snarky and more diplomatic adds to the fun, sometimes the diplomatic answers are even funnier like when the Bard runs into an old flame, pretending he 1. Remembers her and 2. Still cares.

I played a summoner build as there are quite a few interesting summons to use. Including an old man WHO THROWS HIMSELF ONTO SPIKE TRAPS AND YOU WALK OVER HIM TO AVOID DAMAGE. It's one of the dumbest thing I've seen and I love it. As the name would imply, there are also plenty of fun songs which I still remember some years later. It's definitely worth a look. By the way be sure to recruit the dog, he's a good boy and some parts of the game have anti summon zones so he can be a great help.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131379614', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1171, 'last_played': 1671965930}
review:
Gdybym grał w tę grę wtedy, kiedy wyszła, moja ocena pewnie byłaby inna. Niemniej oceniam ją teraz i na teraz nie jestem w stanie jej polecić, a o to przy ocenie pyta mnie Steam...

Przede wszystkim trzeba zaznaczyć, że gra zestarzała się bardzo źle. I nie mówię tutaj o grafice, bo nadal potrafię grać w gry takie jak Fallout 2, gdzie grafika jest znacznie gorsza, a jednak mnie nie odrzuca. Problemem tutaj są przede wszystkim mechaniki, bardzo drewniane sterowanie i konstrukcja samej gry.

Sama rozgrywka jest do bólu liniowa i nie pozostawiająca graczowi prawie w ogóle wolnej woli. Ot idziesz od punktu do punktu, przebijając się przez HORDY tych samych przeciwników i bezmyślnie klikając lewy przycisk myszy. Całą ta rozwałka i przemieszczanie się wytyczonymi przez twórców trasami z rzadka przerywana jest rozmowami między narratorem, a głównym bohaterem lub między bohaterem, a NPC. Gra sili się tutaj na podejście humorystyczne, ale i humor się w grze zestarzał fatalnie. W założeniu miała ona wyśmiewać standardowe mechaniki klasycznych RPG i przebijać czwartą ścianę, ale jednocześnie będąc absolutną hipokryzją, wykorzystując te standardowe mechaniki do sztucznego przedłużania gry liniowością i wspomnianą wcześniej rozwałką...

Nasze wybory fabularne sprowadzają się głównie do tego czy jesteśmy mili czy sarkastyczny. Dodatkowo możemy wykonywać misje poboczne, albo nie. I to w zasadzie tyle wolności.

Ważnym elementem gry, o którym trzeba wspomnieć są piosenki. Ok, wspomniałem. Poważnie, na nic więcej to nie zasługuje. Po prostu są, mają być śmieszne, ale w mojej ocenie już nie są. Może były w momencie premiery.

I teraz coś co mnie najbardziej w grze wkurzało - drewniane sterowanie i brak balansu. Moja postać nagminnie się zacinała w walce i przy strzelaniu. Nie wiem czy wynika to z grania na klawiaturze i myszy, gdzie gra ewidentnie stworzona jest pod kontrolery, ale ciągle spotykałem się z sytuacją, gdzie podczas walki moja postać zwyczajnie nie zadawała ciosów lub nie napinała łuku mimo wielokrotnego klikania. Dodatkowo po odblokowaniu trybów specjalnych Bard wielokrotnie blokował się w „ładowaniu” specjalnego ataku zamiast zwyczajnie zaatakować zwykłym ciosem. Właśnie te sytuacje były najczęstszymi powodami moich zgonów w grze, bo sama gra do najtrudniejszych nie należy, szczególnie jak odkryje się potęgę łuku. Otóż jedyna warta uwagi broń to właśnie łuk. Dlaczego? Bo można nim zabijać przeciwników, którzy znajdują się poza ekranem i nas nawet nie widzą. Odkąd zacząłem używać łuku, moja walka stała się banalnie prosta, choć okropnie nużąca. Ot patrzę na czerwone kropki na minimapie i strzelam. A że w grze istnieje mechanizm korekcji strzałów - tak zwany autoaim - to nawet nie musiałem być dokładny. Rzadko musiałem wchodzić w walkę bezpośrednią.

Ostatni zarzut - „build” postaci. W zasadzie nie ma dużego znaczenia w co pakujecie swoje punkciki, nie mają one jakiegoś szalonego wpływu na przebieg gry. Możecie równie dobrze pakować automatem wszystko po kolei.

Podsumowując - na dzisiejsze czasy gra jest słaba, nieśmieszna, irytująca i w wielu przypadkach niegrywalna.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960284805', 'num_games_owned': 1080, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1670728991}
review:
The audacity of saying this game has been remastered, when it's in a complete shambles in terms of inputs and UI.

The Windows version has no idea what a modern controller looks like and just shows numeric prompts for all the buttons, like something from the early 1990s. Do you know what Button 10 is on an Xbox controller? Of course not, as nothing else uses that, and there are too many numbers to keep track of what's what. But "10" is the prompt you'll see in the game.

The game does not recognise the analog triggers on an Xbox One controller, so you cannot map them to anything.

But the game also requires more buttons than are left without those triggers as inputs! You'll run out of buttons trying to assign them all, and have to combine two and then hope they're never needed at the same time.

Also, quite infuriatingly, the camera's left/right axis is reversed to what almost every other game uses, and there is no option to flip it. You will constantly start rotating in the wrong direction and then correct yourself.

Also seems to either have framepacing issues or a strange walk animation that makes you feel like there are framepacing issues when walking around normally.

That's with the WIndows version running on Windows. I also thought this might be a good game to use on the Steam Deck, and that runs the native Linux port of the game. Unfortunately, this is even worse. You cannot rebind the controls and, although you might be able to work around this with Steam Input, it has a bug where if you touch the left stick while un-summoning a creature then you will be stuck moving forward forever, unable to stop, while the un-summon never completes but also blocks any attempt to change weapons or summon another creature. You have to exit and restart the game to fix this, and you can accidentally trigger it so easily that I just gave up.

The PC ports seem, both Windows and Linux, seem to be a complete write-offs at this point, which is a shame as the game is probably worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043993290', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 2554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2554, 'last_played': 1670322741}
review:
Essentially a re-imagining of the old Bard’s Tale games, the new title follows The Bard — no name, just the Bard — who wanders around a fantasy land full of goblins and fairies, swindling people out of money and occasionally defeating monsters. On one particularly violent adventure, The Bard hears of the captivity of a beautiful princess, Caleigh. At first, he figures rescuing her isn’t worth the trouble — that is, until he hears how rich and sexually experimental she is. His head filled with dreams of financial security and daily fellatio, The Bard sets out to destroy the three evil Guardians who hold Caleigh imprisoned.

If that plot sounded almost mind-numbingly stereotypical, good. That’s the point. Narratively speaking, The Bard’s Tale serves as sarcastic iconoclasm for the fantasy-RPG set: it seeks to present, and then destroy, every irritating RPG cliche we as gamers take for granted.

Why do we fight enemies to within an inch of their life, and then watch them run away in a noninteractive cut scene when we have every reason to follow and slaughter them? Why do wild animals inexplicably drop money and items after death? Why are princesses automatically good, and bald sorcerors automatically bad?

By way of example, let’s say the Bard walks through a dense forest and spots a standoff between a diminutive, evil-looking goblin and a young, adventurous, heroic-looking farm boy. The boy declares himself as the Chosen One, the prophesied hero who will rid the land of evil and bring balance to the f–

The Chosen One stops speaking, because the goblin has just shot an arrow straight through his forehead and killed him.

That’s the sort of thing you’ll frequently see in The Bard’s Tale: designers Brian Fargo and Matthew Findley have a serious love-hate relationship with the RPG genre, and seem to take a lot of pleasure in alternately celebrating and criticizing its conventions.

They also, it would seem, take a comparable amount of pleasure in staging musical numbers. All told, The Bard’s Tale has about half a dozen full-blown songs, including “Beer, Beer, Beer” and “Bad Luck Ogun (The Chosen One Song),” and — by far my favorite, and perhaps one of the best moments in video game cutscene history — a You Got Served-style dance off between zombies and skeletons. Were there a YouTube video of this particular scene available, I’d post that, and nothing else, to give you an idea of The Bard’s Tale‘s sense of humor.

Other than the musical numbers and the satirical look at RPGs in general, the game’s best moments come out of dialogue between the Bard (voiced by Cary “As You Wish” Elwes) and the Narrator (Tony “Megabyte” Jay). While both actors occasionally deliver their lines as if they’ve no idea of their context (at one point, Elwes, instead of irritatedly exclaiming, “Now I’M doing it!,”  delivers the line as a declarative: “NOW I’m doing it.”), they generally imbue the game with a hell of a lot of personality and charm. 

When you start out the game, most of your time will be taken up by summoning monsters and fighting. Then, later, you’ll be able to fight a bit, and then summon some monsters. After that, there’s fighting and summoning, and then a little fighting and summoning, with a final side of summoning and fighting.

Then you’ll summon monsters and fight people. 

The Bard’s Tale is an action-RPG, heavy emphasis on the action. You’ll level up and upgrade some stats, yeah, but 95% of the game simply revolves around going from place to place, summoning monsters to help you fight, and personally engaging other enemies in melee and/or ranged combat. The result is a game which, thanks to the top-down perspective and simplified inventory system (there isn’t one), feels a bit like Diablo mixed with Gauntlet…only not quite as fun as that comparison would make it sound.

The first four or five hours of The Bard’s Tale are insanely fun; you gleefully hack and slash through monsters while fighting to get to the next big comic setpiece or sarcastic monologue. After the six hour mark, however, The Bard’s Tale begins to lose some steam. After a while, the player eventually realizes that there is literally nothing more to the game outside of combat and treasure collection and the game really begins to feel like an endurance trial. “How far am I willing to go just for the sake of funny cut scenes and dialogue?” the player will inevitably ask themselves. 

Though maybe I’m being too harsh. While The Bard’s Tale is irritatingly heavy on combat, it also allows for a slightly-interactive dialogue system. In any given conversation, the Bard can choose to be “nice” or “snarky.” The game refreshingly chooses not to prioritize one type of response over the other: acting like a dick will often get you just as far as being a gentleman — though you’ll probably have more fun speaking like a douchebag.

Should you get it? Maybe. It’s only $19.99 by itself, and it includes all three of the original Bard’s Tale games with the bundle; if you’re really into old-school PC RPGs, then that addition alone might warrant a purchase. Otherwise, just ignore it altogether — I sure like the game and I respect its intention to destroy RPG story conventions, but it can certainly get a little goddamn tedious.

Verdict: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030745785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1668824850}
review:
Unfortunately, the controls on this are too broken.  They work for *a while*, then something goes wrong and the character will just either start walking randomly in a direction.  Or just refuse to move, and get stuck in one spot (even on totally open ground).

It might be ok if this just happened once a day or so.  Unfortunately, it seems to happen every 10 or 15 mins.  Which is a shame, as I have fond memories of this game from years ago on another platform.

review:
The Good:
- Actual funny dialogue and interactions
- The songs featured in certain moments are hilarious
- The Bard is a jerk

The Bad:
- Controls are clunky, doesn't even support xinput button prompts
- Some bugs are annoying af and can ruin your save (save often)

The Ugly:

II got it for "free" bc I bought Wasteland 2 but while I learned to enjoy this, I don't recommend to buy it as a standalone game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120079272', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 2023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2023, 'last_played': 1664043757}
review:
First of all: the comedy of this game, for my taste, is top notch; especially all the songs are so funny, and the scottish accent adds a lot to the mix. Secondly, I've always enjoyed games where you can summon allies, and this one is surprisingly good on this matter.
A warning to linux users: the native version is plagued by unbearable bugs, instead I was able to play it with proton (check protondb for more details; thanks so much to user valiant43e, your report helped me with proton configuration!!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198116125637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1709, 'last_played': 1661654465}
review: A classic that never gets old, The Bard's Tale has one of the best antiheroes that I've seen. In a magical medieval atmosphere, you play the adventures of a misogynist bon vivant that can get only a little better when you choose to be nice with others, which is not always the best choice in a miserable world filled with mischievous characters. Even the narrator is tired of your rotten personality, being ironic every other sentence he reads. You can play with common weapons, such as swords, axes and bows - the best option in terms of damage, in my opinion, but the other weapons have cooler versions by the end of the game. Anyway, weapons do not matter that much when you are a bard and can play tunes to summon up to 16 characters with different abilities to fight alongside you. The songs and general sound effects are also impeccable, because Tommy Tallarico! In conclusion: great story, great mechanics, great songs, and a great b4st4rd to play with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198979044375', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1734, 'last_played': 1655410277}

author: {'steamid': '76561198148676717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 541, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1659733420}
review:
When this first came out it must have been revolutionary. Though I am old enough to have been around for the game, I don't remember if I played it then. By today's standards it is a bit clunky: less than stellar graphics, weird controls,  limited map, limited exploration, no crafting, basic combat, lame loot.

So why am I approving this game? Uniqueness and great voice acting. As the title suggests, you are a bard. When they say bard, they really mean bard. Your songs have magic affects. I have played thousands of games in my 54 years of life and never played as a musical bard who actually plays tunes. How is that for unique? 

The other stand-out is the voice acting. Both the Bard and Narrator are great. Especially the narrator. His sarcastic tongue-in-cheek approach  brings humor and fun to the game. Much more fun than the actual game play. The banter between the Bard and Narrator can't be matched anywhere in gaming. 

Is this enough of a reason to buy the game? Not at the normal price of $20. While I was actually playing the game is was hoping for a cut scene so that I could listen to the banter between the Bard and Narrator. That is a bit of a problem from a playing stand point. Playing the game was not really fun. It was just a bit tedious and boring. 



conclusion:

get this during one of the Steam sales. You will be more mesmerized by the voice acting than the game play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985262092', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1467137269}

author: {'steamid': '76561198388666827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1656454770}
review:
Pretty disappointed by that title. Took a quick look into it through a youtuber, that i really like, doing a walkthrough. 
The game being on sale i decided to do a playthrough myself. 
After a bit more then two hours im basically done with it, its hillariously bad.
The entire story/lore or however you wanna call it consists only out of memes and bad jokes, that are sometimes funny but mostly cringy. And it just feels very boring after a while.
Same to the worldbuilding/exploration/characterbuilding/equipment, all of these aspects are totally lacking depth. Adding the mind boggling combat system on top of that just makes the entire game a very unenjoyable experience.

Cant recommend it.
