author: {'steamid': '76561197987116285', 'num_games_owned': 1869, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1654614267}
review:
Le gameplay est sympa et bien pensé, mais ne fait pas tout.
Je ne sais pas si c'est un bug, mais le jeu semble ralenti, les déplacements sont lents, et le son se décale notamment avec les notes jouées qui apparaissent à l'écran............................................
Avec ça, l'humour relou, ben justement, c'est relou, faut aimer. Le problème c'est que là c'est une succession de gags et commentaires burlesques qui au-delà de rendre les situations débiles, ce qui serait drôle de par le décalage avec la réalité, rend surtout beaucoup trop débiles les personnages et le monde narré....  Trop d'humour tue l'humour, et c'est bien dommage.
Si malgré tout c'est votre kiff, attendez les soldes, car avec les graphismes datés et non upgradés, ça fait mal au cul de payer plein pot !

author: {'steamid': '76561198032729422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 3166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3160, 'last_played': 1668862872}
review:
SHORT REVIEW
The Bards Tale ARPG:  A quest for Coin and Cleavage is a RPG adventure game with a top down view that was typical for the time.  Don't buy this game directly, consider buying the Wasteland 2: Director's Cut - Digital Deluxe Edition which comes with this game bundled with it for free.

PLOT:  The plot is okay but not great but that doesn't matter.  Its a satire for the RPG trope as opposed to a serious game and it is the humour which really carries it.

GAMEPLAY:  Very basic, click to attack, space to block.  Only real decision is which summoned allies to use in a particular situation.

DIFFICULTY:  I played on the “Normal” setting (out of Easy, Normal & Olde School) and found that to be a bit on the easy side at times.  The difficulty is a “one shot” choice made at the very beginning of the game and you can't change it part way through.  It's probably worth playing on “Olde School” in my opinion, “Normal” was relatively easy and I hardly used the Artefact Summons at all.  “Olde School” would also allow for 100% trophy completion as the difficulty achievement at the end of the game back fits the lower difficulties.

GRAPHICS & SOUND:  Graphics are okay and more than adequate for the game but are nothing special.  The Sound is where this game excels and the voice acting (and backchat) between the story narrator and the bard are excellent.

REPLAY VALUE:  Virtually none.  The plot is linear although there are a couple of optional areas.

ISSUES AND BUGS:  There is a known issue with this game which results in it running very slowly (the whole game feels like you are running through treacle).  I think its something to do with it defaulting to the motherboard GPU and ignoring your graphics card.  It also completely locked the system once during shut down requiring a hard reset of the system.

ACHIEVEMENTS AND TRADING CARDS:  Integration with the Steam platform, Steam achievements and trading cards for those interested.  (I believe the achievements were added at a later date which may explain the very low completion rates.)

VALUE FOR MONEY:  Difficult to say.  Bought alone I'd say it is overpriced even allowing for the fact the original Bard's Tale Trilogy is also included and you should wait for a hefty discount in a sale at the minimum.  By far the best way to get this game is to buy the Wasteland 2: Director's Cut - Digital Deluxe Edition which comes with this game bundled with it for free.

LONG REVIEW
The Bard's Tale is a great casual RPG that definitely doesn't take itself too seriously and pokes fun at many of the standard  RPG tropes that are out there.  Its is old now (even the remastered version) and hasn't aged too well with a top down third person view most of the time, the graphics aren't great and the controls are pretty bad.  What makes it enjoyable are the bawdy humour in the dialogue and the lyrics to the songs.

The “hero” of the game is the Bard although “lowlife scum” would probably be better description.  The Bard can have various humorous interactions with the NPC's and also backchat with the narrator of the tale who seems to hate the Bard which adds to the fun.  The language might not be suitable for young children although its pretty tame but I suspect the political correctness brigade can probably find something to get offended by

In terms of setting its a fantasy setting but with Scottish accents and Irish place names thrown into the mix with a non too flattering depiction of the French at one point to boot.  The singing Trow do remind me of Oompa Loompa's although the various versions of “It's Bad Luck to be You” are pretty entertaining.

I noticed that only 18% of people have beaten the first area and I think this is why. The game runs perfectly after these steps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202660412', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1827, 'last_played': 1654100059}
review:
one of my absolute favorite games. The story is the highlight of this game, it's sarcastic, funny and clever. As a parody on the typical "chosen one" quest, with great songs that'll make you laugh.

I love that it doesn't have an inventory system as it allows you to focus on combat, story and exploration. you still have menus that list your skills, tokens, songs and equipment, but you just have no say in those lists. if you buy a stronger weapon of that type, the old one instantly gets turned to money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970370382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1641162153}
review:
The Bard's Tales is funny, but this version has a lot of bugs in it. One, it crashes randomly. Two, it gets slower the more you play it. That seems also related to the numbers of NPC on the screen. The slow part gets you kill because your animation is  so slow, the enemies have time to hit you.

Sad because I have played this game on a very older machine when it was release, but that version is pretty unplayable . (request a refund)

author: {'steamid': '76561198826225619', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1640850662}
review:
Starts really fun; Midway feel like a boring chore once faced with infinite monsters that don't give exp. Partialy, due to leveling/upgrading which is either broken or just plain **** that just doesn't do anything. Also, upgrades feel like a scam rather than a reward. Furthermore, there is a huge stat allocation problem & maxing stats change nothing which made me not even care about finishing the game. Finally, finished game under 20h & did enjoy the end. Overall, a mediocre experience.

Remastered in this case just means  upscaled/stretched visuals. Everything else just a mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137855251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 30656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30436, 'last_played': 1658315369}
review:
Играл в нее в детстве и долго вспоминал как называется. Помню, что спас в подвале девушку и что со мной бегала какая-то крыса. 

Нашел в стиме и сразу купил. Жаль русскую озвучку надо самим шаманить.

Выполняем сюжетные задания, перемещаемся по глобальной карте из локации в локацию, немного фармим и играем на балалайке. Себе на помощь можно призывать разных существ: от крысы и грозового паука до круглой бабки лекаря. Герой набирает опыт и ему можно качать характеристики и изучать новые навыки.

Атмосфера в игре приятная. Можно в городе позалипать в забор и потыкать курицу.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344729793', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1529227864}
review:
For those who would like a score:
8.5 out of 10.
The writing, voice acting and the music make this a worthy purchase in my opinion.
Gameplay is enjoyable if a bit repetitive.
Some small graphical and audio glitches here and there.
I had a wonderful time playing it.

I like the old games more. You lean forward you'll see the look of old games are abstract and fuzzy. Gives the illusion of something photorealistic being shown on a computer that can't handle it. Like a very old movie where details are hidden by the primitive recording but you can tell those details are there. Guess you can just call it using your imagination. All new games do is clear up that confusion and so they end up looking more bland and basic than the old, not fully realized games. 

My friend  had Bards Tale 1,2 and I ended up getting 3. But we used a program called "PC Tools" to edit the program. We found that the characters were coded in Hexadecimal and gave all the stats FF. When Omar hit first for ***** damage we LOVED IT TO DEATH lol. Thats not all, we also figured out how to make ALL the items available. Not that we needed them because we coded all the levels hit points and everything else with FF!!! Was monumentally awesome... Could only do that by switching out floppys, no hard drive back then and we abused that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016805567', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1526, 'last_played': 1638102825}
review: While there was one issue with the game controls on Linux (which was solved thanks to the community) the overall experience is simply FUN. The dialogues in the game made me realize why the games several years ago were so fun to play. There were jokes! Man.... I'm going to miss this level of humor with the current titles. Play the game just for the sake of dialogues. 10/10 I will definitely come back to this title again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056221880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1662074599}
review:
Game is nice gameplay-wise and humor is amazing. 
Some pieces of advise :
- Try to get a shield as soon as possible (in the house on a tree in chapter 2). With an appropriate skill, you will be able to stun enemies. It's an indispensible skill if you are a melee fighter.
- Avoid buying stuff at shops except for maps. When you have an opportunity to buy equipment in shops, you will usually have an opportunity to get similar or better equipment very soon. 
- Buying maps opens up new areas full of traps and enemies. They are quite fun, but even the very 1st one is very hard as it's full of traps. You will get a trapper minion that will disable those traps for you later.

Now, for Linux users : 
DO NOT play native Linux version. It is utter trash. Controls are buggy and can lock your character into a loop forcing you to quit the game. This bug touches all animations in the game including your allies and enemies. For example, dog cannot dig up anything because of it and frequently your minions get stuck. Ah,and native Linux version of this game frequently crashes.
If you want to play on Linux, just play Windows version of this game using Proton (Properties -> Compatibility and choose a version of Proton that works for you. You might need to specify launch options : PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command% )

I definitely recommend this game if you are looking for a funny action RPG. Somehow, main character really reminds me of Deadpool movie.
However, if you are on Linux, for the love of everything that is sacred, use Proton and don't bother with native Linux version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010423636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1639501904}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028164711', 'num_games_owned': 1092, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1639291793}
review:
----21.12.12 엔딩봄---
21년 11월 17일 현 시간까지는 appmanifest_41900 에서 "language" "english"에서 english를 koreana로 바꿔 한국어 나오게 하는게 가능은 함 단 리마스터 이전처럼 바로는 안됨

크게 방법은 3가지 정도인데 (참고로 난 2번을 시도해서 성공 했고 도전과재나 카드 잘 됨)

1,영문 언어팩 한글 언어팩 이름을 서로 바꾸기(이 경우 appmanifest_41900 안 바꿔도 됨)
2, appmanifest_41900 를 읽기 전용으로 만들고 영어에서 코리아로 바꾼 다음 스팀 오프라인으로 바꿔서 게임을 한번 실행 하고 한국어 잘 나오는거 확인 하고 이후 부터 평범하게 즐기기
3.버전을 예전버전으로 하기(버전을 예전으로 돌리는 방법은 쉬우니 따로 검색...뭐 스팀이 지원 하는 버전이 있어야 해당 하지만)

위 방법대로 해야 하는 이유가 리마스터 버전부터인지 몰라도 게임을 실행 할때마다 게임 설정을 채크함...그래서 스팀 바드테일 스팀 설정 언어 보면 당연 한국어는 없고 기본지원 
언어들만 있는데 appmanifest_41900에서 아무리 바꿔도 스팀 설정하고 비교 후
appmanifest_41900 파일에 있는 내용을 스팀 설정에 있는 언어 설정으로 다시 불러옴 이걸 막을 방법은 없는듯 하고 우회 해서 해야 하는데 대충 내가 볼때 위 3가지 방법이 성공 할거임 그 중 2번은 내가 성공 했으니 확실함

1번 당연히 언어팩 이름을 바꿔 영어를 한국어팩을 불러오게 되니 아무런 설정을 안 바꿔도 나옴 물론 appmanifest_41900 설정을 바꿀 이유도 없고 그냥 바꿔도 위 설명에 있듯이 의미 없는 행동임(해본건 아니지만 거의99% 한국어 출력에 문제 없을듯)
2번 방법은 한번 오프라인으로 실행하면 그 이후 평범하게 온라인으로 스팀을 사용해도 신기하게도 다시 언어가 바뀌거나  하지는 않음(내가 성공함)
3번방법은 뭐...이게임이 워낙 오래된 게임이고 얼마나 과거의 버전인지 몰라도 큰 차이는 없을듯(과거 방식대로 한국어 설정)
1,2번 둘다 다소 귀찮지만 어떻게 하겠는가 이래야 한국어가 나오는데 이정도로 감사 하도록 하자(3번은 개인적으로 비추)

아 게임 이야기도 하긴 해야지...
개인적으로 게임은 그냥 저냥 할만함 돌려까는 대사나 유머가 꾀 좋은 게임인데 게임성은 좀 떨어지긴 함 
세일때 구매 추천 폭 넓은 어휘나 서양식 유머를 배워 볼 수 있음(사실 이 마저도 별거 없긴 함...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198328395204', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1608304490}
review:
Beer, Beer, Beer, tiddly beer, beer, beer

A long time ago way back in history
When all there was to drink, was nothing but cups of tea.
Along came a man by the name of Charlie Mopps,
And he invented a wonderful drink and he made it out of hops.

Hey!

He must have been an admiral, a sultan, or a king.
And to his praises we shall always sing.
Look at what he's done for us, he's filled us up with cheer.
Lord Bless Charlies Mopps the man who invented
Beer, Beer, Beer, tiddly beer, beer, beer

The Drunken Rat, the Aiken Drum, the Trowles Pub as well,
One thing you can be sure of, it's Charlie's beer they sell
So all ye lads and lasses at eleven o'clock ye stop.
For five short seconds, remember Charlie Mopps.

One,
Two,
Three,
Four,
Five...

Hey!

He must have been an admiral, a sultan, or a king.
And to his praises we shall always sing.
Look at what he's done for us, he's filled us up with cheer.
Lord Bless Charlie Mopps the man who invented
Beer, Beer, Beer, tiddly beer, beer, beer

A barrel of malt, a bushel of hops, you stir it around with a stick.
The kind of lubrication to make your engines tick.
forty pints of wallop a day will keep away the quacks.
Its only eight pence ha-penny, and one and six in tax.

One,
Two,
Three,
Four,
Five...

Hey!

He must have been an admiral, a sultan, or a king.
And to his praises we shall always sing.
Look at what he's done for us, he's filled us up with cheer.
Lord Bless Charlie Mopps the man who invented
Beer, Beer, Beer, tiddly beer, beer, beer, tiddly beer, beer, beer.

The Lord bless Charlie Mopps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045254517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 2925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2925, 'last_played': 1634012525}
review:
I don't think you would like this game if you're looking for an RPG game with decent combat and mechanics. But it's a great game to play if you're playing just to enjoy its dumb yet self-aware story. The voice acting and the humorous dialogues are definitely the highlights of this game. Kept me entertained till the end. I say pick it up when it's on sale. For those who just wants to play for the story, I say don't play the Olde School difficulty because it is pretty brutal. 

~OH, IT'S BAD LUCK TO BE YOOUUUUU~

author: {'steamid': '76561198007740185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1294, 'last_played': 1519426632}
review:
Псевдо- и якобы- "ремастер", весьма условный. Что-то нелучше чем в оригинале, что-то даже хуже.

 Сама игра конечно классика в плане сюжета и идей, но увы в плане геймплея слабоватая уже в те времена.
Ностальгирующим будет хорошо, желающим приобщится будет тяжело. Особенно ньюфагам.


Да конечно за оригинальную озвучку можно многое простить, рассказчик вообще сам Тони Джей, известный рускоязычной аудитории по голосу Древнего Бога из Soul Reaver и всем остальным - по диснеевским мультикам где он озвучивал злодеев.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031737033', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 2904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2904, 'last_played': 1509290094}
review: A neat rpg with party management elements that sees you filling the shoes of the Bard, a crass rogue/con-artist who's only in it for the money and the women, which all men of the world can sympathize with. review: This is a satirical masterpiece due to scripting and songwriting. The actual story isn't really what you play this game for but those gem moments in the game that have you keeled over in laughter. Sometimes it is beneficial to be the true bard (a total ass) and sometimes it helps to force him to play a good guy (with commentary). The narrator is the best character outside of the dog. A very enjoyable game for those who don't need games to be serious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129258007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1707918555}
review: I knew about Bard's Table way before this version was even conceived, but my problem is this version.  There are just too many glitches!  There is a mainline quest where you get a bow and shoot some birds.  At this point the Bard is stuck in space, although he is still able to rotate, and is unable to fire the bow.  Upon googling steam forums to see if anyone else had the same issue, I found tons of players experiencing the same.  This bug has been around for years, but the developers look like they have moved on.  I am unable to progress any further in the game because of this.  Really frustrating.  One plays Bard's Tale to experience the story, so the experience is like buying a novel and finding out that half the book is missing.  I'd not have spent money on this game if I knew about this beforehand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153645784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1328, 'last_played': 1628863690}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015088068', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1706673722}
review: I first played this game many years ago and hated it.  I recently thought why not give it another chance, it can't be that bad.  Turns out it isn't as bad as I remember, but the humor (not humour) is very dumb and the hero comes across as a total jackass.  Though I guess that's the point.  In any case it's worth it because it also contains the original 3 Bard's Tale games, which I loved playing on my C64 back in the '80s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036581382', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 2186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2186, 'last_played': 1627227394}
review:
I know, I know this game is old and all but many are very much good and playable even today. However this one...Sadly I must say it aged very poorly.

Its strongest bits seem to be the songs and overall humor. The former indeed is amazing and memorable but the latter...well...I personally found it too cliche and mediocre to really enjoy it. The dubbing didn't convince me either...huh, actually I speak of that stuff while the game is actually an action RPG, so what about that part?

This is where the aging bit comes in. The gameplay is...stiff, not sure how else call it. It seems to be a diablo-like: got slighly angled view from the top, dungeon and -like maps, groups of enemies and only kind of lots of loot because everything that drops is immediately converted into currency so we don't grind anything aside EXP.
Combat is very janky, slow and extremely repetitive. Doesn't matter that we have sword, dual wield, flail and 2h sword to choose from because it all boils down to samely ever blocky animations. If you played STR build once then you will not see any variety when trying new weapon type. You can try a bow but this will be literally just standing and shooting while facetanking everything that charges at you.
Interestingly we get large amount of summonable creatures and re-summoning them will surely be about 40% of your time spent on because in my experience regardless on respective stat investment they are always kind of meh so you can't rely only on them (special summons even have unskippable cutscene each time)...must I mention their AI isn't the brightest one and that they get stuck on objects? Commands we can give them don't always help.

So overall gameplay is very boring and quickly repetitive, also mostly easy and abusable but considering the stiffness of the systems making things more beefy could turn it into a tragedy. There is like nothing to say about game's story - it's a very strange take on rescuing a princess with not so willing protagonist overfilled with humor that is up to the individual to tell is it good or not. The only thing sticking out are the songs which you can just look up on YT.
It's also a bag of easy achievements if you can stomach the bore and some fps issues but I think there are better things to do.

Overall if you never played it before I don't recommend trying it. If you want to try it just because you heard some of the songs (like I did)...getting the context for them wasn't worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986364386', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1801, 'last_played': 1625575693}
review:
RPG de acción al estilo de Baldurs Gate Dark alliance o Champions of Norrath, tiene mucho humor, cachondeo y hace sátira hacia los juegos de rol. Originalmente salió en 2004, y esta es una versión "Remasterizada", adaptada a las resoluciones actuales.

Como su nombre indica manejaremos a un bardo con el cual gracias a la magia y a las canciones que consigamos a lo largo del juego, podremos invocar acompañantes para que nos ayuden. También tendremos diferentes armas como arco, hachas, espadas a dos manos etc...

El juego está bien en general, no es un juegazo, pero está divertido, también hay que tener en cuenta que como dije, es un juego de 2004 y se puede hacer un poco duro, el combate (al menos con teclado y ratón) es un poco regulero. 

Eso si, he sufrido algún que otro crasheo y problemas de rendimiento (al llevar 2 horas seguidas jugando, el sonido empieza a petardear y sufría bajadas de FPS) estos últimos se arreglaban cerrando y volviendo a abrir otra vez el juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 869, 'playtime_forever': 1306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1306, 'last_played': 1619221610}
review:
[h1]Der Rockstar der Taverne [/h1]

Lasst mich euch ein Gedicht schreiben: Wie der Drake leibt, so er auch Gedichte schreibt. 
Und damit sind wir dann auf meinem Niveau angekommen. Jetzt aber zum Review.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Spielerisch ist „The Bard`s Tale“ ein Action-RPG, wie man es vielleicht kennt. Aus der Top-Down Perspektive prügeln und schießen wir uns durch kleine Gruppen von Feinden. Das funktioniert auch trotz des Alters noch sehr gut, wobei ich es mit einem Controller entspannter fand. Da fand ich wiederum die Menüführung etwas knifflig. Abseits vom klassischen Kämpfen können wir Magie wirken. Allerdings werfen wir in „The Bard`s Tale“ keine Feuerbälle, sondern können verschiedene Verbündete beschwören, die sich mit uns dann ins Gefecht stürzen. Passt ja eigentlich auch eher zum Stil eines Barden, dass er durch seinen Charme *hust* Leute überzeugen kann, für sich zu kämpfen.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2466578029
Ansonsten erwarten einen im Spiel eher kleinere Areale und abseits von ein paar Nebenquests, eine eher lineare Storyline. Mit inbegriffen sind in dieser Version übrigens auch die drei originalen “The Bards Tale”-Titel aus den 80ern, die sich als altmodisches Text-RPG spielen.

[b]Story[/b]
Unser Held, einfach nur “der Barde” genannt, ist eigentlich gar kein richtiger Held. Ihn interessieren eigentlich nur drei Dinge: Macht, Geld und Frauen. Naja, und vielleicht auch ein wenig seine Laute. So begibt sich unser Held nach einer peinlichen Einführung auf der Suche nach neuen Liedern und stößt im weiteren Verlauf auf eine Prinzessin, die gerettet werden muss. Ein echter Klassiker also? Nun, die Dialoge sind sehr witzig geschrieben und unser armer Held muss sich immer mit fragwürdigen Problemen herumschlagen, in die er sich selber meistens vorher manövriert hat. Besonders schön ist auch die Tatsache, dass ein Erzähler die Geschichte noch übergeordnet erzählt und der Barde diese Erzählungen und Bemerkungen nicht immer so witzig findet. Für gelegentliche Parodie bietet sich natürlich auch gelegentlich mal Platz.
[quote]
Barde: Können wir die Alliterationen überspringen und gleich zum Kampf kommen?
Feind: Wie ihr wollt, mein frevelhafter fölpischer Feind
Barde: Es wird mir eine Freude sein, euch zu töten! [/quote]

[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
Klar, die Grafik ist alt. Doch das Remaster der Version sorgt dafür, dass man es sich zumindest anschauen kann. Bei diesen Hack `n` Slays, bei denen man von oben darauf schaut, stört zumindest mich auch die ältere Grafik eher weniger.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2466575183
Das Spiel heißt nicht umsonst „The Bards Tale“ und dementsprechend gibt es viele melodische Musikstücke im Hintergrund als auch richtige Songs, die wirklich gut sind und zum Lachen bringen. Die deutsche Vertonung ist auch in Ordnung und eine Stimme kam mir direkt bekannt vor. Ich habe sogar extra im Internet gesucht und bin zunächst nicht fündig geworden, aber es stimmt: Der Barde wird tatsächlich von [url=https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oliver_Kalkofe]Oliver Kalkofe[/url] gesprochen. Perfekte Besetzung! Allerdings habe ich das Gefühl, dass in der deutschen Fassung die Stimmen nicht gut überarbeitet wurden und irgendwie Soundeffekte in Gesprächen fehlen, was man im Vergleich zur originalen Fassung klar merkt. 

[b]Fazit[/b]
Von „The Bard`s Tale“ gibt es bereits einen wesentlich moderneren [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1091980/The_Bards_Tale_IV_Directors_Cut/]Nachfolger[/url]. Ich habe den Nachfolger nicht gespielt, aber er scheint etwas grundsätzlich Anderes zu sein. Dieser Teil ist zwar durchaus schon in die Jahre gekommen, aber wer einfach mal ein gutes RPG haben will, dass mit einer lustigen, eher oberflächlichen Geschichte daherkommt, dem kann ich den Titel auch heute noch empfehlen!


Ich singe ja wegen gerichtlichen Auflagen nur noch unter der Dusche. Meine Reviews darf ich aber öffentlich zeigen. Für mehr davon kannst du mal [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool] meiner Steamgruppe[/url] vorbeischauen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128646914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2036, 'last_played': 1619231815}
review:
游戏关键词：上帝视角、游吟诗人、老式角色扮演、召唤、吐槽恶搞、InXile
优点：非常有意思的剧情，游戏中对话穷尽吐槽和恶搞——主角遇到boss就一副我知道你要跟我说什么的，吐槽主角的画外音，吐槽救公主类游戏里“chosen one”的设定；到处都是滑稽的人——天不怕地不怕却怕老鼠的女斯巴达、一言不合就斗舞的“僵舞天团”、总以为自己是“chosen one”路人，酒馆里醉汉、经常唱吐槽“it‘s bad luck to be you”的三个哥布林……
游戏中不少的对话都有选择（只有两个），但是对进程影响并不会太大，只有登上最后的高塔才会有影响，不同的选择会开启不同结局。
作为一款05年的游戏，画面确实还不错。
缺点：
但是游戏实在太老了，很多地方实在是不够人性化，玩下去需要有一定的耐心。
1.人物动作太过僵硬了，跑图实在难受；
2.很多关卡都只是将相同的地形和敌人配置堆叠到一起，游玩过程十分枯燥；
3.战斗上也体验也不是很好，因为近战容易被格挡，多以对付多个敌人会比较棘手（多数情况下都是用箭蓄力射，让召唤物扛伤害），而弓箭使用起来也十分不顺手，有时候点了攻击，人物根本只会杵在原地，比较尴尬（不知是不是bug）；
因此并不推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198054105264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1619015055}
review:
непонимаю почему столько восторженных отзывов на этот мусор

1) история может для того года и являлась чем то прорывным, стебным и кому то она греет душу, но испытанием времени этот сказ не прошел... все пресно и скучно...а юмор на уровне "сосед за 50ть вышел во двор побухать и рассказать бородатый анекдот".. песенки веселят... НО субтитры сделаны отвратительно и спешат, образуется рассинхрон и все впечатление портится
2) игра поддерживает геймпад (с него и играл), НО через жопу...место привычных бокса или пс раскладки, в игре 1.2.3... и тд...+интерфейс тоже кривой.. 
3) техническое состояние.. это проблемы со звуком которые начинают возникать при игре больше 2х часов непрерывно, он начинает хрипеть .... а финальные заставки вообще несмотрибельны из-за заикания звука
4) кривые хитбоксы, да, их я тоже упомяну, тк это будет бесить на ряду с другими "нюансами"
5) отвратительные уровни... которые представляют собой коридор....в котором много жирных мобов
6) сверх затянутость игры..
7) Е.БУЧИЕ БАШНИ

review:
this game series has a history and culture that I totally know nothing about nor care for. so I am going to make life simple and describe the game as I always understood it:

you and your friends are playing a role playing game and you are the bard. the DM is a psychopath and you have to sleaze you way out of responsibility. this game is best played drunk with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336244271', 'num_games_owned': 5144, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1276, 'last_played': 1617026568}
review:
Лирическое отступление:
Слово "БАРД", лично для меня, изгажено всякими КСПшниками и вызывает некоторый спазм лицевых мышц, уныние, суицидальные мысли и желание автору-исполнителю сделать "испанский воротник"...

Что тут у нас?

У нас тут:
3 шт The Bard’s Tale [1985 / 1986 / 1988]
1 шт The Bard’s Tale [2004]

И так:
3 старые The Bard’s Tale будут пользительны игравшим в их в конце 80-х. [не играв тогда, сейчас вряд ли получится, лично я не смог]
Переиздания всякого старья всячески одобряю [хоть в данном случАе я не смог настроить экран в 4:3 - родной, сермяжный формат]

The Bard’s Tale [2004] есть пародия, обладающая всеми плюсАми и минусАми всего к чему приклал руку [или что ён там кладёт на свои игры] Брайан Фарго 
[Лучше и вкрадчивей всего всё это дело охарактеризовал И. Мендельсон, относительно Wasteland 2, как "бутерброд с слюнями и соплями автора" [мой вольный пересказ мизансцены]...
Собсно, в игроделии, сам И. Мендельсон пошёл по тому же пути...]:
- Халтура [довольно не глубокие шутки по поводу жанра рпг в общем и частных деталей]
- Гринд [тянут время и это в общем то не шибко смешно: пойди в башню, чисти этажи вверх, потом чисти вниз, босс, потом следующая башня - да, да шутка удалась, но пожалуйста, ХВАТИТ!]
- Юмор [циничный, сексисткий, имеет место быть - тут и любимая Брайаном крыса и харизматичный уродец напарник, а-ля Скотчмо - старая ведьма!] 
В общем [и частном] часами дрoчитьcя ради довольно предсказуемой шутки, по нынешним временам - не очень, но для 2005 года возможно было и очень даже ничего.

Рекомендовать могу только поклонникам 3-х первых игр про Барда [тут имеется их переиздание] и поклонникам ролевых игр, за процессом не видящих результата [пародия очень едкая и разочарование в жанре гарантированно] 
тк The Bard’s Tale [от 2004 года] есть горькая аллегория сути любой и каждой РПГ!


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
UPD:
Игра хорошая а издатели нет!

всех нас и правых и левых и милитаристов и пацифистов и русских и совсем не русских - всех записали в одну категорию
тем самым объединив нас таких разных
и наглядно показали как "запад" к нам относится

review: I love this game, and was looking forward to replaying it after years since I played the PS2 version. But I can't recommend the Steam port. It's not great. Combat with the mouse feels clunky and unresponsive at times and the controller support is horrendous. BUT for some inexplicable reason, the Microsoft Store port of the game is actually very functional, and has native Xbox Controller support, pre-mapped and with proper button prompts. If you're thinking of playing this game, do, but don't buy it here. Get the Microsoft Store version.

review:
Is the gameplay fresh? No. 
Is the camera view frustrating most of the time? Yes
Can the cutscenes drag on a bit as your companions fall into place? Yes
Do I care about any of that as I fall in love with the humour, the bard and the many NPC's you meet along the way? Nooooooo
The comedy, replayability and the twists are, for me, worth all the frustrating parts of this otherwise great game. 
Whether you like this game or not, the only thing I will say, is "Oooh Its bad luck to be you"

review: This ain't your daddy's Bard's Tale. This is a polished port of a PS2/X-Box game similar to Baldur's Gate Dark Alliance. I have no idea how they got this to be a Bard's tale game,maybe just so it would sell,because this is miles different than the original games. It's a fun game,good British humor,featuring Cary Elwes(The Princess Bride,Robin Hood Men in Tights,Saw) as the titular Bard. This version comes with the original Bard's Tale Trilogy,so it's a good deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286792266', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 7615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1664486956}
review:
Play in what could have been the world of the would be dread pirate Roberts, voiced by Cary Elwes himself, in this raunchy comedy of a game.

Comes with the additional classic bonus games:

There is also a Google Play version available for tablet and mobile play with the additional Bard's Tale classics available for $2.99 for play on the go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201381471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1701382701}
review: It's got terrible voice acting (with some exceptions), the worst pacing I've ever seen, and the mechanics aren't very well balanced. And somehow, I still love this game to bits,. It does not offer quality, so your ability to enjoy it will depend on your tolerance for sub-par gamedesign, but it's just good enough that it is possible to genuinely get invested and enjoy it if your standards aren't that high. The story is both a cynical parody of adventure rpg's, and a loving parody of its own cynicism in a way that I haven't seen done elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126727520', 'num_games_owned': 3203, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 3021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3021, 'last_played': 1610102916}
review:
I was a MASSIVE fan of the 1st game of the series back in 1986, but my family's pc at the time couldn't get it to run, so i use to play at my friends house.  This was the very 1st RPG i've ever played and i went into an obsession with the RPG party creation concept at the time, which began my love-affair of RPG games.

This game's narration is wonderful and funny, poking fun of traditional RPG games.
But the gameplay is super boring, and nothing special.
It really pi$$ed me off that one part of the game has it's 1st shop selling treasure maps, but they are sooo expensive that nobody can buy them early game.  So late game i was rich af with nothing left to purchase, so i made my way allll the way back to the 1st town store and it's closed, preventing me to buy any of the treasure maps.
I also missed seeing the little green 'Trowle' (goblin) on the world map that gives you more quests, so i missed those.  Just keep your eye out for it so you as a player don't miss him.
Even without the upgrades, i blew past the game to the end with ease.  
One thing i did early game was cheese it buy using a bow to fight with by shooting the enemies off the screen before i can visually see them, which made the game much easier but even more boring.
This would have made for a decent game for the gaming era of 1991-1993, but for 2003 standards its boring, and for 2020's standards i would only recommend this game to die-hard RPG fans & completionists. 

2/5 Stars
'It's Okay'

author: {'steamid': '76561198051315190', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1657478449}
review:
How I wish I could give this a thumbs up, because I loved this game, if only for the humor and the songs, [b]but[/b]... I've yet to finish it. In the last 10 years or so, I was unable to finish this game on several computers, because there is always something else that breaks. Call me unlucky.

Nvidia laptop, was unplayable halfway in because there was storm/rain in a town that reduced my frames to 1-2 because of shader problems. 

Tried it again on the next desktop with radeon gpu, couldn't even leave the starting inn, because that blue sparkle effect in which a creature/person appears also reduced my frames to 0, another kind of shader problem. 

Now I wanted to try again, yet another desktop, but now I am running Linux and the Linux version is borked. It's impossible to rebind keys and I got stuck in one of the first cutscenes. With proton, the game gets stuck on an endless loading screen before it even starts. 

I now have bought this game three times and I can't even finish it once. 
I don't even know why I am still trying. The combat was bad, the interface was bad, the graphics were bad. You really have to be into older games if you want to try this one. But I loved its music and the narration and the silliness, despite all its flaws. 

If you want to try your luck with this game, make sure to test if it actually works before your refund window is up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800015553', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1609196846}
review:
This game's pretty funny and has all the charm of an early 2000's PS2 game. If you're looking to pick up this game for anything other than nostalgia I wouldn't really recommend it because the combat is nothing to boast about and is pretty short to boot. The story is a parody of high fantasy RPGs and thus never really takes itself seriously. Personally I think the bard's meta relationship with the narrator makes up for the horrendous dungeons and waves of boring enemies the game throws at you.

 As you might've already noticed the game isn't really a proper remaster besides the work done to the original bard trilogy. The PS2 title is simply a port that doesn't enhance the visuals or mechanics in any noticeable fashion. This is great if you're into the grungy PS2 aesthetic but terrible if you expect anything else. Personally I am of the former. Like any game that's ever come out in the history of forever, The Bard's Tale comes packed with some minute but noticeable bugs. For example, some of the achievements were either activated early or not activated at all. Furthermore, the audio from the narrator and bard seemed to cut off anytime you paused the game or went into any menu which is slightly frustrating if you're trying to experience this game's main appeal :P.

 Additionally I experience some minor slowdowns and frame drops that seemed to happen during combat. Not sure why this is but it's definitely not something on my end since my computer is more than capable of handling a 16 year old PS2 title with a lackluster paint-job. There was only one crash I experienced towards the end of the game and to top it all off the final boss straight up refused to attack me and I was granted a free win. I honestly am glad for this since I was probably underleveled and underpowered from just running away from all danger and threats that came my way since the combat took too long. As for the original bard's tale trilogy, I can't exactly speak on that since I don't think I have the patience for games as old as they are but if you're just looking for a game that'll give you a good ol belly laugh then I'd say pick it up just for the PS2 title. You can almost never go wrong with grimy PS2 games : >.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968658555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1608664528}
review:
The Good
- The humour is a bit tongue-in-cheek and 4th-grader-like, but it -is- funny.
- It literally takes the piss out of the whole RPG genre, including itself, and that's nice for a change.
- Pretty interesting summons system.
- Great songs.
- No bugs.

The Bad
- The plot is garbage, a hacked-together excuse to keep you going from a location to another.
- Combat is horrendous. It's honestly one of the worst combat implementations I've seen in a (supposedly) AAA game. It's just not fun and often infuriating because it's clunky and unrefined. Feels like the combat of an Early Access alpha H&S JARPG.
- Game world and game scope are real small.
- The VO acting feels a bit "tryhard", quite often.
- The snarky/nice conversation options seem like the remains of a half-baked system they still wanted to force into the game.
- Skills/tunes/stats progression also feel way too basic and sometimes having little effect over gameplay.
- Random difficulty spikes due to getting ganked and stunlocked by 250 enemies while cornered.
- Gear progression is so barebone your dog will try to gnaw at it.

The Ugly
- The game look really poor, even by 2004 standards.
- The camera is a joke, it has a very limited adjustable zoom and that's it. Feels uncomfortable either way.
- The whole UI, from the menu to the screen elements to the buttons to the map, everything is REALLY poorly designed and delivered.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988234533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1605911354}
review: I first played this game way back in the 90s and loved it!  Decided to start playing some of my library of games from the heyday of RPGs and this is still timelessly awesome  --- the dialogue alone is so hilarious that it's a joy to play!  And, for me, who loves to play for the adventure and the role-playing and has never been a master at combat, the simplicity of the cheat system is incredible, doesn't require editing or even use of the console.   If you want money to spend and don't want to mess with healing and dying, that's a big perk.  Primarily, however, I'd play it just for the sheer hilarity and joy of the dialogue and the story!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028475107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1660, 'last_played': 1605048474}
review:
Spin-off bazujący na starej serii turowych gier fabularnych o tym samym tytule. Wyróżnia się od swoich pierwowzorów dobrym humorem satyrycznym, jednakże oferuje bardzo uproszczoną rozgrywkę hack'n'slasha.

Opowieść tytułowej postaci ma swój początek w tawernie, w której bezimienny Bard dzielnie zwalcza zagrożenie szczurów w piwnicy w celu pozyskania pieniędzy, posiłku, miejsca do spania oraz względów dam. Podczas tego chwalebnego zadania otrzymuje pomoc od pewnego dziadka, zapoczątkowując tym samym misję uratowania księżniczki i świata.

Główna siła omawianego tytułu leży w luźnym podejściu do dialogów. Wielokrotnie w trakcie podróży Bard kłóci się z narratorem swojej opowieści, bądź strzela ostre docinki skierowane do różnych postaci oraz stereotypów gier fabularnych (np. wyśmiewając "wybrańców"). Przedstawiony humor definitywnie przypadł mi do gustu, jednakże dostrzegłem nadmiar znęcania się przez wszystkich nad protagonistą. Bard wychodzi przez to na kompletnego niedojdę, marnując szansę na zrobienia z niego czarującego łotrzyka. Od strony rozgrywki, na pochwałę zasługują przywoływani towarzysze pomagający w walce - nadaje to bitwom warstwy taktycznej. Również spodobały mi się znajdźki zwiększające statystyki i poszukiwanie ich.

Początkowe dobre wrażenie niestety szybko mija po przejściu kilku pierwszych rozdziałów, gdyż ilość ciekawych dialogów zaczyna ustępować powtarzalności segmentów eksploracyjnych. Liniowe plansze o podobnym wyglądzie nie imponują pod żadnym aspektem - nie posiadają ciekawych elementów rozgrywki (zazwyczaj wprowadzane nowości bywają bardziej upierdliwe, niż przyjemne), ani wciągającej atmosfery (co czyni wzorowanie się na celtyckiej kulturze trochę zmarnowane). Bard ma w walce możliwość przyzywania sojuszników pieśniami, jak również korzystania z łuku, bądź broni białej. Wachlarz umiejętności bojowych jest jednak mały, gdyż oferuje jedynie stosowanie potężnych ataków, bądź kontrowanie ciosów. Na domiar złego, wrogowie nagminnie blokują normalne uderzenia, co czyni bitwy niepotrzebnie mozolnymi. Pozyskiwane lepsze uzbrojenie oraz łupy potworów automatycznie zamieniane są w pieniądze, co usuwa proces zarządzania ekwipunkiem. Poza wymienionymi wadami, wiele mniejszych problemów uprzykrzyło mi zabawę. Kamera posiada okropny kąt nachylenia, poziom trudności skacze i opada z rozdziału na rozdział, częste ekrany wczytywania nudzą, drzwi nie mają sensu (po otworzeniu zmieniają kierunek), powracające nagminnie potwory eliminują satysfakcję z zabijania, a lokacje posiadające pułapki wydają się mieć na celu jedynie zdenerwowanie gracza i zmarnowanie jego czasu.

Strona dźwiękowa The Bard's Tale jest zadziwiająco uboga. Cały soundtrack składa się jedynie z motywu menu oraz rzadkich piosenek, więc podczas eksploracji poziomów i miast uszy atakowane są przez powtarzalne odgłosy tła o często irytującym dźwięku. Na wyróżnienie zasługują odgłosy przywołańców, które nawet po ściszeniu doprowadzają do bólu głowy. Pochwalić jednak muszę świetną robotę aktorską protagonisty oraz narratora, jak również wspaniałe piosenki stosujące "podskakującą kulkę", gdyż wielokrotnie zachęciły do wspólnego śpiewu. Strona graficzna również posiada problemy i zalety. Przerywniki filmowe często zawierają pauzy, które sugerowałyby nadejście żartów, ale takowe nie pojawiają się. Obrazy wczytywania przypadły mi do gustu. Reszta krajobrazów i modeli jest w porządku.

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 797, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1604258049}
review:
[h1] Information / Review English [/h1]

The Bard's Tale is an Action role-playing game developed by inXile Entertainment.

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

Just looking at the mechanics of the game it quickly becomes clear: The Bard's Tale has nothing to do with the C64 classic of the same name, but is an action role-playing game that is strongly reminiscent of titles like Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance and Champions of Norrath. You cut your way through enemy-infested levels with the bard from a bird's eye view in order to free an attractive princess who is held captive in a tower by the villain Fionnoach. The operation is simple: you first select your weapons via practical ring menus and then attack opponents such as wolves or the goblin-like trow in real time with your sword or bow. The magic system also works via ring menus: you can use spells such as "healing" or play a song on your magic lute to conjure up a companion. Defeated enemies not only leave silver pieces behind, which you spend on new equipment in villages, but also bring you experience points: As you level up, you increase the hero's basic stats and learn new talents.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ dark story
+ Humor
+ Good / bad conversation system
+ unpredictable course of history
+ Original music with vocals
+ interactive city & rural population
+ Achievements and trading cards

[h1] Contra [/h1]

- kept too simple
- bad translations

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

The Bard's Tale offers you a humorous adventure that lives mainly through its dialogues.


[h1] Information / Review Deutsch [/h1]

The Bard's Tale ist ein Action-Rollenspiel, welches von inXile Entertainment entwickelt wurde. 

[h1] Gameplay / Geschichte  [/h1]

Schon bei Betrachtung der Spielmechanik wird schnell klar: The Bard's Tale hat nichts mit dem gleichnamigen C64-Klassiker zu tun, sondern ist ein Action-Rollenspiel, das stark an Titel wie Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance und Champions of Norrath erinnert. Ihr schnetzelt euch mit dem Barden aus der Vogelperspektive durch gegnerverseuchte Levels, um eine attraktive Prinzessin zu befreien, die vom Schurken Fionnoach in einem Turm gefangen gehalten wird. Die Bedienung ist simpel: Ihr wählt zuerst eure Waffen über praktische Ringmenüs aus und attackiert dann in Echtzeit mit Schwert oder Bogen Gegner wie Wölfe oder die Goblin-ähnlichen Trow. Das Magie-System funktioniert ebenfalls über Ring-Menüs: Damit setzt ihr Zaubersprüche wie »Heilung« ein oder spielt ein Lied auf eurer magischen Laute, um einen Gefährten zu beschwören. Besiegte Feinde hinterlassen nicht nur Silberstücke, die ihr in Dörfern für neue Ausrüstung ausgebt, sondern bringen auch Erfahrungspunkte: Bei einem Stufenanstieg erhöht ihr dann die Grundwerte des Helden und erlernt neue Talente.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ düstere Geschichte
+ Humor
+ Gut/Böse Konversationssystem
+ unverhersagbaren Verlauf der Geschichte
+ Originalmusik mit Gesang
+ interaktive Stadt & Landbevölkerung
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- zu einfach gehalten
- schlechte Übersetzungen

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

The Bard's Tale bietet dir ein humorvolles Abenteuer, welches vor allem durch seine Dialoge lebt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087897795', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1604166799}
review:
Некогда любимая мной игра-шутка Bard's Tale была хороша. А вот ремастер нам был брошен, как недоеденная кость собаке. Подтянули нам немного текстурки и... ВСЕ! 
Если честно такой ремастер должен идти в топку: а обновить немного видеовставки в более высоком разрешении, а поддержка современных xInput геймпадов? Неужели мы до сих пор должны искать костыли для того, чтоб поиграть с геймпадом? Но альянс клава-мышь работает отлично.
Деньги не пахнут? Даже шрифты остаются такими же ломанными как и в оригинале. 
Если бы дело касалось мобильной версии - этого бы хватило, но для десктопов, на мой взгляд, этого уже мало.
Хотя, конечно, может игроки помоложе, которые захотят ознакомиться с этой игрой и не будут столь строги.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023137125', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 1806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1806, 'last_played': 1604091785}
review:
+Decent humor
+Somewhat open world with some side quests and abilities that wont be found without exploration

~Graphics are on par with a game from 2005
~Story is dumb but the humor makes fun of the cliches multiple times
~Has a leveling system but its small and boring

-God awful combat. Its so stale, slow and clunky. Even just moving around is painful.

As someone who went into this with no nostalgia, its a pretty bad game. Its clearly centered around the combat and humor and the combat is just terrible. Couldn't even finish the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198797494375', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1511, 'last_played': 1603986214}
review:
클래식 게임인 1, 2, 3을 합쳐서 리마스터 한 버전입니다
(검색해보니 각각 출시년도가 85년, 86, 88년도네요 ㄷㄷ)

공식 한글화 되어 있으며, 다른 분들 평가처럼 파일을 수정하는 방법이 통하지 않아서
아래와 같이 올드 빌드를 플레이 했습니다.
(이러면 도전과제는 안되지만 트레이딩 카드는 줍니다)

1. 라이브러리에서 게임 우클릭 → 속성 → 베타 탭
2. 아래 코드 입력하는 곳에 "TheBardsTaleUnsnarkled" 입력 후 코드 확인 클릭
→ 바로 위 드롭 다운에서 oldbuild 선택
3. 약간의 파일을 다운 받게 되고 라이브러리에서 게임을 실행
→  "Graphics Settings"에서 해상도와 언어 변경

게임의 유머코드는 옛날 미국 B급 영화 수준이고, 간간히 발리우드 감성의 노래도 나옵니다.
총 3가지 엔딩이 있으며, 마지막 분기점에서 저장이 가능하니 3개 다 보시길 추천합니다.

확실히 조작감이 안 좋고 걷는 모션이 어색합니다만, 짜증날 정도는 아니고 할 만 합니다.
옛날 패키지 RPG를 한다는 느낌으로 하면 좋을 것 같네요. 
엔딩은 봤으니 추천은 하나 할인할 때 구매하시길.

author: {'steamid': '76561198422844123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1670892199}
review:
Wunderbare Atmosphäre!

Sehr schönes Hack and slay mit einem gut aufgelegten Barden der hier von Oliver Kalkofen gesprochen wird.
Alle Dialoge sind sehr gut vertont und man hat Enscheidungsfreiheit. Das ganze Spiel ist einfach liebevoll gestaltet und es macht Spass durch die Landschaften und Dörfer zu streifen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091427600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 4447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2455, 'last_played': 1692186667}
review: A brilliant and hilarious game.  It will keep you laughing, which will distract from some of the previous gen issues that the game was made for.  Definitely worth your time and money

author: {'steamid': '76561198047792994', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1219, 'last_played': 1602898612}
review:
Enjoyable for the jokes, self-awareness, parody of fantasy tropes and celtic spin on fantasy. If only there were more such tongue-in-cheek games.

However, self-awareness only gets you so far and the game has not aged well. Controls are clunky, combat rather simple, environments linear and there isn't all that much to do. Halfway through the game I felt I have seen all it has to give, and the remaining 10 hours proved me right.

All in all, recommended only as a curio for those interested in video game history, not recommended as a game per se.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999841719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1673719484}
review: Unfortunately this is just too buggy to be played on Linux.  I don't have a unique setup, I'm just running  Ubuntu (20.04).  But as well as crashing frequently, I've run into the movement controls not working, not able to use a weapon (the bow), and cut scenes just hanging.  Looking at the discussions, it seems I'm not alone.  It's a shame, as there could be a fun parody of an RPG in here somewhere, but it's just too frustrating trying to play it on Linux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063878029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 6095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6095, 'last_played': 1600418514}
review: Very entertaining game that excels in sarcastic humor, dialogues and music. The sound is great, especially the character and narrator voices. And it has songs to sing along! Character development is meager, choose sword or bow and then max it out. Riddles are non existing and you always know what to do next. Anyway, the story is very worth playing and the action battle system and command system work still fine for such an old title. Diddly-doo!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993318807', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1694102127}
review: It's a functioning port. If you want to play The Bard's Tale legally, this is a great way to do that. For what it is, this is a fun game. A jaunty action RPG with crude humor and a surprisingly charming sense of humor. For the most part though, this game is a relic that has aged poorly, even if it was one of the better hack and slash games on xbox.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127122634', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1600156165}
review:
It focuses on the old rule of Old but gold. The key mapping isn't the best (it was originally a console game after all), but when remapped, worked perfectly on my external xbox controller.

I see a lot of people complaining about crashes, I had none. I also didn't fiddle with anything other than the key mappings so it may be that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126683918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1713, 'last_played': 1599048017}
review: Fun shortish game with good humour. The musical interludes aren't tideous which I expected them to be and I especially like the 'bad luck to be you' song.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186530370', 'num_games_owned': 2630, 'num_reviews': 570, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1600385805}
review:
The phrase Laugh Out Loud (LOL) is just way overused in today's culture. To be honest, though, most things really don't make us LOL, we just use it to mean that something was kind of funny.
This game, however, literally made me laugh out loud, in fact I gawfed, snorted, chuckled, giggled, and basically made a lot of other noised out loud while playing. No other game that I have ever played was as funny as this game. Using Carey Ewles (who, unlike other actors, does have an English accent) was a stroke of genius. He adds a level of comedy that no other game can match.
As for the game itself, it is actually a lot of fun. It doesn't do anything new or fancy to the genre (although unlocking and summoning which helper you need for each obstacle you face is a neat idea), but it does what it does really well.
If you are looking for the next Dungeon Siege / Baldur's Gate, than this might not be what you want. BUT, if you want a really fun game that sticks to the basic tenants of the RPG genre, plus you want to be thoroughly entertained - than you owe it to yourself to give this game a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128377225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1596471284}
review:
Это тот самый случай, когда «графика не важно». 
Искрометный саркастический сценарий, неплохая русская озвучка, отличные персонажи-в целом только это позволит вам позалипать в нее даже в 20к20. 
Конечно, тут устаревшие механики, не очень удобная боевка и в плане геймдизайна есть вещи, которые не надо никогда делать(респаун врагов и дибильная система сохранения). 
К счастью, плюсы перевешивают минусы, игра достойна внимания всех любителей рпг и хороших сценариев в стиле Пратчетта, если вы вдруг почему-то пропустили ее раньше.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034075083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1690259126}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026116000', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1549692699}
review:
I mostly played this on my phone vis the mobile version but the PC version on Steam is pretty much the same, only better lol.

It's a great game for what it is, lots of comedic value with just enough elements of the old original version mixed with a ton of new elements from the modern era that make this both nostalgic and freshly reinvented. 

I recommend the game for some fun solid casual play. Great for some good laughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997993547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1736, 'last_played': 1589914659}

author: {'steamid': '76561198149396436', 'num_games_owned': 981, 'num_reviews': 408, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1595268374}
review:
Очень не рекомендую.
Если это ремастер, то почему игра выглядит как серый кусок goвна из начала 00-х?
Это и есть серый кусок goвна из нулевых. Это игра goвно копия самой себя. Потрясающе. Ремастер только запускает эту горе игру на новых системах, с чем  фанаты, если таковые вообще есть, запустили бы без проблем сами. Ничего из технических проблем игры или проблем геймплея поправлено не было, следовательно добавлено тоже ничего не было. Это такой же тупой и скучный слэшэр где главный герой битард 80 лвл, раз в пару часов  может смешно пошутить. Потому что шутки тупые. 
А теперь о самой игре. Не знаю, что там перестёбывать в 2004 году было в жанре рпг если современный жанр  ролёвок тогда был ещё не шибко богат. Разве что выходцы из безмозглых ММО могли посидеть погыгыкать над тупорылым чувством юмора барда. Плохая боевая система, плохая система магии и просто убитое управление. 
УПРАВЛЕНИЕ УБИТОЕ.
Сам процесс выноса монстров больше похож на выведение хрена с огорода, надоедает быстро и хочется просто всё это залить кислотой. 
Игра безнадёжно устарела, но тот факт, что сегодня всё равно интересно проходить КОТОР, FABLE, инфинити классику говорит что и в те времена когда мог 7 раз и девки давали похождения барда были в лучшем случае проходняком. 
А сейчас The Bard's Tale govноRemaster  - Мусор.
Лучше идите и хлопните по зaдницe свою девушку, если она есть или погладьте котейку.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980796094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1595059957}
review:
What a shame.
I have fond memories of the Bard's Tale series. This one had a lot of fun with the setting, made fun of various fantasy clichees, showed the angle of the non-hero, and was all around humorous. But my good did that age poorly.
Not quite to the point of unplayable, but close. Definitely not worth its money anymore.

Follow my curator at https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28337205-Fair-Minded-Witness/

review: The Bard's Tale czy jak kto woli Opowieści Barda w wersji Remastered to bardzo zacnie odświeżona wersja gry z 2005 roku. author: {'steamid': '76561198047422594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1594058751}
review: The Bard's Tale trilogy brings back some great nostalgia for me from when I was growing up, and the humorous follow-on "bard's Tale Remastered and Resnarked" is an entertaining update on the classic.  Anyone who likes these games should also try "The Bard's Tale 4, Director's Cut" for a nice combination of the two that brings back the original turn-based action while letting characters wander around in a minimally "open world"-like environment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028749362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1591645267}
review:
It seems more than the half the budget for this game was spent on the music and voice acting as those are the only really good things here.

This game seems to have been released for PC after the console versions, and it definitely looks like a port. Horrendous controls, graphics that look about 4 or 5 years out of date (even for 2005), and a clunky combat system with little depth. You can use a controller but all the buttons are shown onscreen as either '1', '2', '3' or '4' instead of 'X', 'Y', 'A' or 'D', making things very confusing, so it's probably easier just to go with keyboard, which is almost as bad.

Everything is dumbed down - the game auto equips the best gear you come across, and everything is converted to coins automatically. Combat consists of simply running up to enemies and clicking on them until they are dead, with  a clunky timed block ability you can use when they swing at you. For some reason, after the starting village (Houton) and the nearby forest (Fairyhaunt woods), the game's difficulty suddenly seems to spike, and you find yourself battling crowds of enemies that take loads of punishment, while you are forced to keep running away after a few hits. You do have the ability to summon various creatures to aid you in combat, but initially you can only summon 1 creature at a time and they go down pretty quickly.

On the plus side, there is a lot of really funny dialogue, and Tony Jay and Cary Elwes are great as the voices of the narrator and bard respectively. The music and tavern songs are also really good and the "beer song" alone may be worth just buying the game for (though at a steep discount).

This is the kind of the game that, with a serious remaster (and overhaul of the combat system), could actually be quite good. As it is, I can't really recommend it. It's probably less stressful to watch the gameplay videos on Youtube if you want to enjoy the music and voice acting. Rating = 4/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220351435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1592239465}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070923312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1593265364}
review:
Yes! I recommend the Bard's Tale. The Bard's Tale, which is now remastered and properly includes all 3 Bard's Tale games (of the 2004 series of course), is a very nice, chipper piece of fantasy art. It looks good, even for a 2004/2005 game (I wouldn't say it is even a stretch to say it feels 2007), and either way, its artstyle, writing and gameplay hold up EXTREMELY WELL TODAY.

The gameplay doesn't feel very dated like I'd get from MOST games and FPSes of that era, as RPGs/Action RPGs tend to be, it just tends to be nearly timeless whether it was made 5 years ago or well, 250 years ago.

The plot, you essentially play as a kind of dickhead idiot surrounded by a world full of, OTHER idiot dickheads! In this ruthless world, honesty and politeness are rarely appreciated qualities and your fighting skill and cunning nature decide your merit moreso than any intellect, or trade.

I just really love this game. Well worth asking price, AND I'd recommend getting the Bard's tale 4, to have the entire franchise in your collection!! Thanks, see ya

author: {'steamid': '76561198101349413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1639, 'last_played': 1565616256}
review: The only group of players I can't recommend this game to are those looking for deep, rich and serious storytelling in their RPGs. This is an extremely silly take on all the common RPG tropes, which continues to make fun of itself even without ever breaking the fourth wall - well, with exception to literally the funniest part of the whole game. Tremendous replay value. If you need a good laugh, this is well worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078367743', 'num_games_owned': 1417, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1583263536}
review: A dramatic, heartbreaking, humorous and truly epic RPG full of twists, women, banter and music based on an old school classic that I've never played because it's like twice my age. Buy it if you want to roleplay as a rather unsuccessfull bard with the biggest ego mankind has ever witnessed or if you want to get bullied by the narrator of your own story. No kinkshaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004204403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1841, 'last_played': 1586389666}
review:
[b]HA DELL'INCREDIBILE!!![/b] 
Il gioco più irriverente e sarcastico che abbia mai visto! E per essere una sorta di hack'n'slash/rpg ciò lo rende dannatamente originale!! 

Finito con personaggio di 21° livello (max) in poco più di 30 ore a difficoltà normale. E' un gioco di ruolo piuttosto lineare, ma dalla trama davvero insolita per via dell'enfasi posta sul ruolo del protagonista, il classico piacione, menefreghista, caxxone, opportunista, sbruffone, che nelle interazioni coi PNG può decidere se avere un comportamento accondiscendente oppure insolente, generando conseguenze differenti, con tanto di finali multipli.

Mondo di gioco in 3D con visuale dall'alto, nel quale ci si sposta con telecamera libera a 360°, diversi stili di combattimento legati alle armi utilizzate, impegnative boss fight e interessante scelta di poteri tutti legati al proprio strumento musicale. 

Fantastici i testi delle canzoni che si incontreranno man mano che si avanza nel corso delle proprie (dis)avventure e geniali i relativi balletti idioti che si sposano benissimo con lo spirito generale di The Bard's Tale! Il gioco è disseminato di piccole chicche per gli amanti del fantasy, diversi segreti ed eastereggs, frequenti buchi della quarta parete e congeniale voce narrante che non sopporta il protagonista stesso, insultandolo. 

La miglior storia d'amore (carnale) mai raccontata in un videogioco grazie a dei testi che fanno morire dal ridere, buona anche la traduzione con sottotitoli in Italiano, anche se io mi son goduto di più seguire il parlato in inglese. 

Nota finale, il cane fantasma che sarà il vostro miglior compagno d'avventura e una totale irriverenza nei contenuti che costituiscono la caratteristica principale del titolo dall'inizio alla fine. Incredibile che non esista niente di simile nel panorama ludico; [b]anche se datato, vale assolutamente la pena di essere giocato tutto d'un fiato![/b] 

[i]"Oh, it's bad luck to be you.
Don't think for just a second it's not true
When your life has run amuck
You'll see that you're the (sch)muck.
Oh, it's bad luck to be
Really bad luck to be
Nobody could disagree.
It's a freaking guarantee.
Oh, it's bad luck to be you.
Diddly doo!!"[/i]

EDIT: il titolo comprende come extra addizionale addirittura tutti i 3 capitoli originali degli anni '85-'88 rilasciati per MS-DOS, Commodore 64, Amiga, etc .. alla "Eye of the Beholder", ma ancora più acerbi (per chi è abbastanza anziano da sapere di cosa parlo ahahahaah). Fantastici se si vuole respirare il gioco di ruolo videoludico vecchia, vecchia, vecchissima scuola!! Hanno talmente tanto fatto breccia nei miei ricordi, che ne ho comprata la trilogia rimasterizzata nel 2018 ed è fatta benissimo - un capolavoro attualissimo a trentanni di distanza!!! (lead marketing, ottimo lavoro!) ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003026615', 'num_games_owned': 1273, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1584266527}
review:
Horrible controls. Absolutely horrible. I've seen better mobile ports on Steam with better controls than this. It may have been a classic, it may have been amazing, but when you 'remaster' something to the PC, it should've been updated on controls to work with modern day gaming. Between handling the controls and fighting with the camera made me want to rip out my hair. If this was ported from the console era, it surely needs to go back. I know inXile makes great titles (e.g. Wasteland series), but this I couldn't get passed the controls/camera.

Use a controller one might say? I didn't know cRPGs were required to use a controller! That's like asking Neverwinter Nights, Divinity Series, Baldur’s Gate, old school Fallout, etc. to be used with controller support. *throws up face* No, thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198842564776', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3153, 'last_played': 1581508341}
review:
《新冰城传奇》(The Bard's Tale)是一款颇具颠覆意味的角色扮演游戏，画面相当精致，音效由好莱坞专业配音演员负责。在游戏中，玩家将扮演一位狂妄自大的游吟诗人，在欧洲中世纪的奇幻大陆展开冒险旅程。你将召唤魔物加入战斗，获取大量战利品。和原系列一样，游戏中角色和NPC的互动十分有趣，玩家可以自主选择不同的态度来对待不同的NPC。


游戏采取了一个俯视角的控制方式，在操作方面，借鉴了Gameloft的地牢猎手系列，左手控制人物的移动和方向，右手控制攻击和触发剧情。与其他欧美传统“龙与地下城”作品中玩家可以控制多个角色进行组合攻击不同。游戏中你只能操纵Bard一人，在游戏的探索过程中，设计师不仅将游戏中的一些角色互动转移到NPC上，让NPC跟你之间的互动来决定任务剧情的发展。游戏中的人物配音非常丰富，随着剧情的发展，游戏的主角Bard会抬头朝你讥讽或者来几句幽默的话。没错，我说的是朝你，游戏里的这个长发男子犹如在你掌中那个“盒子”真实存在般的朝你大嚷大叫，或者对进行串场的旁边来句”Shut up！”游戏中充满着苏格兰民谣风格的配乐，以及大量的歌曲，比如在游戏酒馆里，跟NPC对话时会触发一段关于啤酒的欢快合唱。游戏中人物之间的对话关系会有多个确定选项，从而决定游戏的剧情发展，以及你跟NPC之间的关系。


游戏中你可以杀死怪物或者动物获得奖励，也可以在房屋和地下城中翻箱倒柜或者打开宝箱获取奖励物品。买卖你背包中的杂物，跟NPC交易获得更好的装备。游戏中除了挥舞着宝剑去战斗外，还可以利用Bard手中的琴，它具有神奇的召唤能力，在战斗中你可以召唤出老鼠，蜘蛛等等大自然的精灵来辅助战斗。当然在游戏中Bard也会用召唤技能来做一些恶作剧，比如吓唬一下酒馆的女招待。


游戏的背景画面方面改进不大，尤其是在场景和地形方面的，当你进入茂密的丛林里时，色彩斑斓的地貌会让你眼花。当然这只是游戏中的一些瑕疵。游戏在人物的制作方面很精细，从人物的外貌特色，战斗动作，招式表现等等，并且作为游戏中被猎杀的那些NPC，也有细节方面的表现。比如狼会仰天长啸互换伙伴来围攻等等。游戏魔法特效表现非常惊艳，当施法成功时，游戏画面中梦幻般的特效非常抢眼。

author: {'steamid': '76561198022298610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1494, 'last_played': 1581725813}
review: Great game, or atleast the story is. In short this game is a parody of fantasy RPG, combat sucks,  and you can cheese most of the fights with your bow. But the writing, the humor and the songs is where this game shines, and for that it's worth a play. When at the start of the game princess asks him to rescue her and sends him into  a tower , to which the Bard replyes "to A tower or The tower"...... genius... Buy this on a sale and enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992823439', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1406, 'last_played': 1542383122}
review:
タイプとしてはアクションPRGで、自分と3人の召喚キャラで冒険するゲーム。
召喚キャラの種類は結構ありそれぞれ特徴があるので、状況に応じた使い分けが重要になってきます。
ただいかんせん古いゲームで操作性が悪く、どこがリマスターやねん、と思ってしまいます。
ゲーム性はいまいちですが、一番の売りはブラックなユーモアでしょうね。
しかしそれも古臭く、陳腐ささえ感じます。
Brian FargoやInXileつながりで買いましたが期待外れでした。

全実績難易度：難しい～

author: {'steamid': '76561197993023804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 524, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1676178393}
review:
In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#89 out of 500+)... it's time for The Bard's Tale.

I'd say it hasn't aged well, but honestly The Bard's Tale wasn't all that impressive back when it launched, either. It's gaudy, tacky, cheesey and silly -- all of which has a certain appeal I won't even try to deny. But it's also clunky and clumsy in that tiresome way only early-era Playstation 2 games could be. And this "remaster" doesn't exactly improve things much.

If you've spent much time in CRPG circles, you've very likely heard someone wax nostalgic for "The Bard's Tale: once or twice. This, uh, isn't the game they were talking about.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993377731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1581910280}
review:
I played the hell out of the Bard's Tale back in the day, so I was excited to see this "remaster," but sadly, they never fixed the camera controls. You're forced to have inverted camera rotation with no option to change it, which is simply inexcusable at this point. The ONLY way to get the camera rotating non-inverted is to use a third-party remapping app, like "JoytoKey," but then you don't get smooth camera control.

The devs have basically abandoned the game at this point. If you like inverted camera rotation, then have at it. I personally can't stand it, and the fact that they didn't even include an OPTION to change it forces me to thumbs down this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082689223', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1581146319}
review:
This is one of those games you need to experience.  Not to play because it's good (But it is) not to laugh at because it's funny (But it is) and not to compare it to others in the series (It's apparently quite different)

First and foremost the game is smartly written.  Every dialogue has a good chance of invoking a chuckle, and there's enough flexibility and risk/reward in the snarky/sincere system that the replay value is pretty strong as well.  Rewards can be added to, detracted from, or outright lost entirely if you're snarky to the wrong person, but likewise can being too passive grate on someone to the point of them showing you the door.  It's a really clever system that means you're never really going to know what happens next until you try it!

The combat is fine.  It's manageable.  It does it's job.  It's by no means great (and you can honestly get through most of it spamming melee attack and blocking everytime you are blocked to avoid counter attacks) but theres a nice feeling of excitement whenever you find a new summon to try out and there's enough of them in the game to keep it varied.  That says nothing of bow, flail, dual and two handed combat, so you have alot of options for yourself as well, but you can play pretty much any other adventure game for solo combat, your bardic spells should be focused on here.

As I said the writing is solid and on point, and the way the two main voice actors (Carey Elwes and the late great Tony Jay) play off each other is fantastic.  I'm also pretty sure one of the Bobds played Griswald in Diablo 1 but I'll be damned if I can confirm that.  But the voice acting overall is pretty solid, if a little silly with the thicker accents sometimes.

Alot of people have been complaining lately about a recent patched that butchered the controls, but I played before the patch as well as after and didn't have any large complaints.  Controllers work now without external aid, though it takes a bit of finicky touches to get them set properly for the combat but overall I have no complaints.

Overall I'd say this is worth your time if you like your adventures funny.  If you want something serious and grounded you won't find it here, but this game knows what it wants to be and does it in a way that doesn't come off as annoyingly self aware and obnoxious.

Maybe just wait for a sale.  It's a bit pricey otherwise.
