review:
One of my absolute favorite games from the PS2 era.  It's an RPG, but it pokes fun at the RPG genre as a whole and it is quite entertaining while doing it.  This game should be played by any RPG fans.  The Remaster also has achievements for you to gain.

This game is an easy 100% as it isn't very difficult and the story only lasts about 20 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160615439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1594270988}
review: The new Bard's tale was an instant let down.  The story was unappealing and the main character unlikeable.  And now the original trilogy (And why I bought it) is unplayable.  Avoid this game, don't waste your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049508609', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2471, 'last_played': 1581019522}
review: This game is played not for the smooth or satisfying gameplay, but for it's quests and the characters. Basically, the game makes fun at all classic fantasy rpgs by letting you be "the bard" a snarky, sarcastic and negative creature, only interested in his personal gain (money, women, etc). This makes for some pretty hilarious settings, in which you threaten npcs to death to give you what you want, have a companion dog to dig things up for you and much more. It does have quite an interesting system where you summon companions to fight for you. I liked that the game is inspired by Scotland. Plenty of Scots place names will pass by. Included is the original Bards Tale from the 80's including its sequels, if you're nerdy like me you'll appreciate that.  Have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198345808911', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1695947519}
review:
Hei bobl hei, Sseth yma.

Bard's Tale is an excellent game, set in a medieval Britain, more particularly, Ireland and Scotland. It's a real gem that has gone relatively under the radar over the last decade and a half. You play as the Bard, a bard. "What is a bard?" some of you might be asking. Well, unless you are some sort of scholar or played the game set in medieval Norway, I will tell you.

A bard, according to Wikipedia is a quote, "In medieval Gaelic and British culture, a bard was a professional story teller, verse-maker, music composer, oral historian and genealogist, employed by a patron (such as a monarch or noble), to commemorate one or more of the patron's ancestors and to praise the patron's own activities."

This however does not represent the Bard at all, no instead I believe the Bard is a character from the medieval epic, The Hobbit, written by Geoffrey of Monmouth or something English like that. Regardless, our Bard is a very human character, he has the same wants and needs as us. That includes, money, alcohol, and cleavage. Truly a protagonist we can put our hearts too.

Unfortunately for our Bard, he is dragged along, unwittingly by a group of Scotsmen led by William Wallace, dedicated to freeing the princess Caleigh, who is held by a cult of hooded men led by a local Skinhead, so you know they are the bad guys. Why do you do this? Because you, the Bard, are the Chosen One, selected to free the princess and slay her captors, and receive all the treasures you could want. Of course this pleases the bard immensely and despite his misgivings about the whole quest goes along with it. You won't complete this quest alone though, for along your journey you are equipped with all sorts of spells and a dog, who with a certain trait can be an effective and immortal meat shield that the AI targets.

"What about the spells?" You might be asking, well let me tell you. They are very important to the game as you won't get far without them. Seriously, you will always have at least one slot filled with a healer, because when she actually heals you you will be grateful. Besides that healing hag, you get a variety of other spells that summon warriors, archers, and a creepy old man who hunts and throws himself at every trap you encounter, whether they like it or not.

Gameplay. Combat might look simple but you will need to practice when to block, attack, and run away and resummon your healer who decides it is her best interest to run into the horde of enemies in front of you. The dialogue and humor is actually pretty good and works wonders in building this games charm, the musical segments are also very well done. A lot of tedious parts feel made almost specifically to mock the tropes in role-playing games, and by the several Bobds it is amazing.

Much of the game is taken up by getting to and from an objective on the route to Caliegh, including three towers which host a boss who's magic keeps her sealed. Yes, you go through three towers to free her, and the third one isn't even the last tower you fight through. You also meet about 3 dozen chosen ones along your way, all young boys led astray by some Instagram model persuading them to use their McDonald's paycheck on access to her private Snapchat account. Honestly I can't be bothered counting how many there were. Ultimately however you begin asking yourself, after fighting through hundreds of goblins, undead Skyrim characters, real life Danes, druids, and other enemies from Celtic and Norse folklore, if Caleigh is really worth it. Is she really going to give our Bard all he desires? Is she really worth the pain and suffering you are inadvertantly cause? What is with these undead appearing everywhere? Is she really even that hot? Why does everyone sound like an Anglo instead whatever nonsense those people speak in Wales? And most importantly, are the Skinhead and his faction the good guys?

I will leave it up to you to answer and solve those mysteries on your own, because I have some criticisms to share. Much like in real life Britain, everything is expensive as shit. Much unlike Britain, you can get a knife and more without needing to ask the Queen for permission. Why? Because Eric Blair is not born yet and neither is Big Brother. To remedy this money issue I recommend barrel breaking. Why? Because in Houton there is a barrel making shop. If you break the mans barrels he will request you break other people's barrels to increase demand. This is very illegal but very profitable. Once you unlock Kirkwall as a location and capture a certain man you previously set free, follow along the first part of the Kirkwall questline until you get the firefly spell. Now go to one of the store rooms in the back of the town and proceed to break the barrels there. Leave and go to Houton. This should net you 500 gold, unless my game was bugged and it only worked for me. Wash, rinse, and repeat as much as you want before progressing to a certain point when a certain demon appears. Also stay out of Hafn's tomb once you help him get to Valhalla.The devs made sure draugr would infinitely spawn and trust me, it isn't fun.

Final score. I give this game a Barrel racketeering over the absolute unit of David Morgan-Hewitt. Very fun, and very enjoyable. The music while sparse is atmospheric and incredible to listen to, the game remains challenging overtime, and is very liberal with save points.

I'd like to give a warm thank you to the Merchant's Guild for their continued support and funding of these reviews against all odds, so that one day the world will be a better place. Gus an ath thuras, soraidh slàn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025823574', 'num_games_owned': 3336, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 2317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2317, 'last_played': 1577219822}
review:
Finished The Bard's Tale in about 23 in-game hours. And I really should have stopped with it about 20 ago, I think I developed Stockholm Syndrome, and some tendency to self-harm in the form of wanting to finish the game. It became kind of charming in the last 2-3 hours, but previously it was just incredibly dull, repetitive and unfunny.

The combat's depth is close to zero. Block, get parry ability, 3-click combofight. There is no inventory, everything worse than equipped gets instantly sold. There are barely any quests. There are no choices, no real worldbuilding, but there are literal THOUSANDS of enemies that respawn when you leave the map (lovely when main story requires you to get through the monster-ridden fields 3-4 times.) Also monsters doesn't give that much xp, and levelups aren't too useful.

There are no skills, only summons that can (and will) be killed as they run into traps. They barely can be controlled, and while your summoning-mana recharges you can't do much. Not the only thing that feels like padding.. throughout the game I'm fairly sure I spent 3-4 hours waiting for unskippable cutscenes, for the 10-second healing animation to get finished, for getting healed by my crane every 8ish seconds, for my mana to recharge, or just running back and forth through fields that had tons of enemies or literally nothing for screens-long. 
The maps are overly large and generally barren, there are just quest-related points of interests, enemies and two types of (the same) chest: traditional chest or a tree*trunk* with loot in it. (techncially a chest too, with wordplay. Harr-harr)

The humour is... eh? The Bard is unfunny and obnoxious, and he is written in a "witty" way that he keeps responding unfunny things after every single NPC line just to mock how traditional RPGs are. But the game is EXACTLY like those games, just spending time trying to make fun out of them, while being mechanically a lot worse than those.
 At a point they made a joke about a viking telling basically his life story instead of answering a simple question, and the Bard kept saying "Go on. Please continue. How thrilling" and such without a single second break, for like two minutes. The cutscene was unskippable, and instead of just making fun of the story I couldn't understand anything of it and had to put up with the Bard being just an annoying prick - again.
Basically - this is the proto-"it's just a satire" game where they do the exact same thing, being worse on the go than what they tried to make the joke about. While the game had some nice gags (finding a red cloak from wolves, swimming trunks from octopus folks) 90% of the humour source was referential, not original.

Played a game to the end because of a friendly group-event where it got picked for me as a game I own and need to finish. I think this was a good lesson that if something is meh after 3-4 hours, I should just remove it from my account and go off to play something that deserves my time.  (The trilogy packed with the game may worth though, but I don't really think I can put up with the game again before a few months pass)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998943168', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 5401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5401, 'last_played': 1527342521}
review:
Another old game that I should have reviewed when I finished the game some time ago.

This game is about a bard who has only 2 rules:
Rule 1: Seek riches and women for 'love' (not in any order)
Rule 2: Avoid dangers at all cost, unless it involves Rule 1 

So, off you go in an adventure helping people (but mostly for a pretty damsel with big .....) regardless of the dangers. You will come across dry humours, catchy tunes, vile creatures, weird on-going stuff etc. 

Although the bard can fight in melee/range, his main weapon comes from his musical instrument. His songs can conjure up various entities with different abilities, to fight along side him. Use them wisely. Okay, not going to reveal too much here.

Like any old game, graphics is really outdated but I still recommend this game for its story, songs and humour. If you like these and laugh at dirty jokes, why not give it a try!

"... beer beer beer tiddly beer beer ..."

Rating: 90%

author: {'steamid': '76561198011119127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1576602065}
review:
The Story is narrated by one and only Tony Jay (RIP 2006) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Jay
Voice acting is top notch and the game could be just about anything as long as the writing and voice delivery is at such a level. Plenty of innuendo jokes and adult humour that can slip past unnoticed for younger audience (the best kind of adult humour).

Game mechanics themselves can be clunky at times (nearly top down camera with small angle of view), luckily the whole hotkey mechanic is in the reach of WASD controls and is comfortable even when you have to perform multiple actions in seconds, once you memorise the key combinations that is.

This game is a work of art, definitely worth not only in your collection, but a playthrough or two as there are multiple endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983915759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1574920888}
review:
I don't even know how this game wound up in my Library because I would have never purchased this game. After playing the game for the initial 10 minutes, you get the gist of this game. You start out with the tutorial with a Narrator that speaks up too often, while the main character breaks the fourth wall and gives the Narrator a ton of attitude. Right from the start, you understand quite quickly that every character is either a pervert or stupid, but most especially the main character. 

You get a shiny new sword in the first few minutes of the game, but the game doesn't tell you how to pull it out of it's sheath. So it does you no good. You can summon creatures with a guitar. Yay....

Then you eventually get to wander around the town where you find a fat woman who's having sex with her own son... He's her "chosen one" or something... 

This game is horrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043002927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1289, 'last_played': 1554108961}
review:
A fun, relatively linear rpg with heavy focus on funny, witty dialogue.
Definitely recommendable just for that alone.
The combat is either melee or ranged, with support of various summons,
and does take some time to get used to, and it certainly isn't easy.
Still, a fun little game, if you to play a quick rpg.
Not necessarily all that light-hearted though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067031352', 'num_games_owned': 3017, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1509433424}
review:
Великолепная и уморительная история о похождениях барда.
Вся игра состоит из несложной шинковки полчищ нечисти, приправленной морем стёба над жанровыми клише и тоннами шуток в духе комедий Мэла Брукса!
Истинное удовольствие, от авторов Fallout, для всех, кто перетерпит позавчерашнюю графику и не самую удобную камеру на свете. 
Зато игру легко освоить и в неё, действительно, захочется продолжать играть. 
Музыкальное и звуковое оформление приятное, весёлое и не отвлекает, а декорации отрисованы весьма неплохо и задают нужную атмосферу.
Ценителям и знатокам - веселье гарантировано!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041971048', 'num_games_owned': 1493, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1569767818}
review:
I really wanted to like this game.
The writing is hilarious and all the voice acting is fantastic.
But the level design and combat are just terrible, which would've been tolerable if I could run past mobs. But the amount of mobs they throw at you is ridiculous! You're expected to fight so many boring mobs between each story segment. An area that would normally have, like, 5 mobs in a normal game would have a 100 mobs in this game. it's just unbelievably tedious. 
I had to stop 5 hours into it. I tried looking for mods that would make this bearable, sadly with no results.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040393326', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1515, 'last_played': 1358582400}
review:
This was sufficiently non-memorable that I can't remember anything about this game other than it being utterly unremarkable and having a series of songs mocking Chosen Ones.  For a comedy game, I can't remember a single joke from it; for a role-playing game and dungeon crawler, I can't remember a single character or interesting enemy type or location; for games in general, I don't remember a single distinctive or novel mechanic.   I'd say that the "Yakuza" series (or, at least the ones that have made their way to the PC platform -- i.e. 0 and the "Kiwami" remakes of the first two games) has better and more interesting writing, and those games are *brawlers*.

For an RPG, a genre where writing quality matters more than in, say, a multiplayer-focused shooter, these all suggest staying away.  I'd rather steer you towards something with more memorable flavor.  There's "Age of Decadence" if you want rather hardcore difficulty combined with a *lot* of writing and emphasis on roleplay (e.g. actually playing to your character's strengths; for instance, do not expect to be able to build a grifter character and have him power his way through combat, where even a combat-focused character will quickly discover that he's only human, not some unbeatable superhuman); for something far more welcoming, there's games like "Fallout: New Vegas" or "Dragon Age:  Origins".

author: {'steamid': '76561197970705552', 'num_games_owned': 2213, 'num_reviews': 2100, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1592942171}
review:
The godfather of the modern post-apocalyptic cRPG. Brian Fargo <3

“Along with Bard's Tale, Wasteland was one of the games that made me want to make games. I was privileged that Brian gave me the opportunity to work on Fallout, and I have missed those games. Getting to play Wasteland 2 is like getting to return to your past and finding out that it is still as fun as you remember.”
Feargus Urquhart/CEO Obsidian & Lead Designer Fallout 2

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1366, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1567267712}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein sehr Humorvolles Action RPG

[h1] Story [/h1] Wir spielen den "Barden" und kommen in ein Dorf an, um in der Örtlichen Schänke etwas zu Essen und zu Trinken. Schnell treffen wir einen Mann der uns als Auserwählten ansieht, um eine Prinzessin namens "Caleigh" zu befreien.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Es gibt 14 Kapitel. Wir kämpfen uns durch Horden von Gegnern und leveln unseren Charakter typischerweise mit Fähigkeitspunkten auf. Bei jedem zweiten Level up können wir außerdem auch noch einen neuen Skill auswählen. Loot gibt es an sich nicht, sondern die Gegenstände die Feinde fallen lassen werden automatisch beim aufheben verkauft. Wir können verschiedene Lieder lernen um Kreaturen zu beschwören die uns im Kampf helfen. Die Stärke des Spiels ist die Story und der Geniale Humor. Immer wieder geraten der Geschichten Erzähler und der Barde aneinander, was wirklich für Lacher sorgt. Auch die Lieder die man im Spiel hört sind wirklich sehr gut & Lustig. Diese Version von "The Bard´s Tale" beinhaltet auch noch die Original Trilogy der Reihe

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 51 Erfolge. Die meisten Erfolge bekommt man während des durchspielens automatisch  wenn man denn alles fleißig erkundet (alle Kapitel beenden, alle Lieder lernen, 20 Artefakte finden). Ein paar sind etwas kniffliger aber durchaus machbar wie z.B. das Spiel auf den Höchsten Schwierigkeitsgrad abschliessen & 20.000 Silber in der Kirche spenden.

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Sehr Gute Story
+ Hervorragende Lieder
+ Grafik Absolut in Ordnung
+ Sehr Humorvoll (besonders die Dialoge zwischen dem Erzähler & dem Barden)
+ Sympathischer Hauptcharakter
+ Gutes Voice Acting
+ Deutsche Syncro (Englisch gibt es natürlich auch)
+ Klassiker
+ Mehrere Enden
+ Original Trilogy mit enthalten
+ XBox 360 Controller Support
+ Achievements
+ Sammelkarten

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein sehr Humorvoller Klassiker und eines der wohl Lustigsten Spiele überhaupt. Die Story, Die Songs & Die Dialoge sind einfach nur Fantastisch und es macht Spaß von Anfang bis zum Ende. Eines Meiner Absoluten Lieblings Spiele. Ich kann es wirklich nur jedem Empfehlen

author: {'steamid': '76561198156060583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1421294814}
review:
I loved this game when it first came out and played it constantly.  The remastered version is visually better than the original, while keeping the same feel and atmosphere as it originally had. The Trow songs still keep me cracking up and sometimes I'll turn the game back on just to hear them.

While I do highly recommend the game, I've really stopped liking overhead games where you can't see your surroundings, preferring RPG's with 360 degrees of vision. But the story is really good and the humor is pure slapstick that promises to keep you laughing throughout the whole thing. After a few hundred times playing it though, I think I'm pretty much done with it personally. Even with the upgrade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091371280', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1566652787}

author: {'steamid': '76561198108044597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1649158843}
review: So glad to see a fond memory of my childhood on the original XBox has been immortalised in the Steam annals. It's a wonderful RPG with great dialogue, a comfortable challenge for combat, a relatively stock-standard story, but told from a refreshing perspective (akin to Shrek's take on the fairy tale genre). Only as grindy as you want it to be, and is a solid 12-15 hours of fun. Not much replay value, but you'll come back to it every few years or so and still enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081477001', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1563635564}
review:
I played this game thrice back in the mid-2000s and I remembered it being not super-engaging yet pleasantly stylized and humorous, so I got it on Steam to see if I remembered correctly. No.

[i]The Bard's Tale (2004)[/i] did not age well. 

Yes, it does have this Celtic-mythology inspired style about everything, but it is obscured by the atrociously picked camera angle. It resurfaces in cut-scenes which are well-voiced, but nothing too special and are few and far between. 

Yes, [i]The Bard's Tale[/i] does have this snarky attitude towards DnD tropes as well as early computer RPG tropes - but the approach is one-sided and boring. It feels like you're doing DnD with a newcomer hell-bent on playing the role of a chaotic neutral character: sarcastic, avaricious and generally non-caring. Lirerally NOTHING the protagonist says is outside that description. The humor is... On the nose. It's the humor of a gamemaster trying to toy with you - no more, no less. Some may find it appealing, but I find it boring. And, what do you know, [i]The Bard's Tale[/i] still remains one of the widely-acknowledged pinnacles of humor in gaming! Yes, the standards in this industry are THAT low.

And the combat. I remembered it being poor, and it is. Just play with the bow on the easy difficulty if you choose to pick this game - it'll save you quite a bit of time otherwise spent in dragged-out skirmishes between parts more worthy of your attention. The companion summoning system is diverse and interesting, but not particulaly tactical. Mana regenerates slowly, so you cannot juggle your companions around to fit the combat situation.

The songs are the only thing indesputably good here. But they are very rare a treat.

The overall impression is as follows: [i]The Bard's Tale[/i] feels like it was made to cater to that aforementioned type of DnD players. The rest of us should probably leave it be.

PS
Unless you're here for [i]Ye Olde Bard's Tale[/i] series from the eighties in which case this reveiw is of no use to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996581189', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1516, 'last_played': 1651852258}
review:
Decent RPG to play, bit old school in it's style. What really sets this apart from others is the fantastic voice over and main character. The lines are cheesy but funny as they know they are a complete cliche.

Also the songs within the game are well done suiting the parody tone of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198807608769', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1667513557}
review: I played this game on the PS2 and now playing this on the PC it really bring me back the great narrator and the funny story keep its age with me. The sing along are great talking about the gameplay unfolding in this world makes it stay alive and there is lots of dark humor. In the end this game keep that special feeling with me its a great game worth the try

author: {'steamid': '76561198061772730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1560073332}
review: I had this for the PS2 back in the day and bought it again here as I had had good memories of the game. It's still a good game and I enjoy the witty dialogue, my only complaint would be the controller controls being weird but after rebinding them to something that felt "right" it was perfect. Definitely worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014210144', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1561829417}
review: This game must have been great 15 years ago. It's dated in every conceivable way. There's titty jokes, wiener jokes, bad controls, predictable events. I'm sure there are folks nostalgic for this type of experience, but it's absolutely too old fashioned and slow (so many unskippable cutscenes!!) for me. Unless you're extremely patient or you already love this game and miss it, or you've recently sustained a tough blow to the head rendering you unable to keep up with the fast paced worlds of lego games, let this one die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073164948', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2723, 'last_played': 1561556186}
review:
Где-то году в 2005-м, может 2006-м, я приобрел пиратский диск с несколькими играми, среди которых была вот эта. Тогда, двенадцать лет назад, я её с удовольствием прошел, а теперь у меня есть и лицензионнный диск и даже копия в Steam.

Сюжет: 
Бард - любитель песен, выпивки и женщин (не обязательно в таком порядке). Он путешествует по миру в поисках таверны, где можно напиться, грудастых вдовушек, которых можно соблазнить, и сокровищ, которые можно забрать себе. Однажды, Бард встречает странных, явно поехавших товарищей, назвавших его Избранным, тем самым героем, что спасет прекрасную принцессу из заточения в высокой башне и справится с наступающим Большим Пэ. Бард, соблазнившись богатством и упругими формами принцессы, отправляется в путешествие, неся на своем пути боль и страдания, ничуть не тяготясь бременем спасения мира или тенями убитых им людей, но мечтая о том, как выглядит принцесса без одежды. 

Игровой процесс: 
Это RPG, а значит можно прокачивать героя, покупать у торговцев лучшее оружие и броню, собирать с монстров выпавший лут и иногда делать выбор в диалогах по типу "мило пообщаться/жестко нахамить". А по факту эта игра абсолютно линейна, и решения, принятые игроком в процессе игры, никак не влияют на её концовку, важен только финальный выбор.
Бард умеет играть на музыкальных инструментах, призывая музыкой разных помощников: крысу, ведьму-лекаря, огненного голема, рыцаря, взломщика ловушек и т.д. 

Плюсы: 
+ История Барда - это книга, которую читает закадровый голос. И Бард с рассказчиком периодически ругаются друг с другом, разрушая четвертую стену. 
+ Самым крутыми помощником оказалась бессмертный пёс и крыса, которая после прокачки становится той еще тварью. 
+ Бессмертный пёс однажды всё-таки умирает, а потом возвращается с того света в виде пса-призрака. 
+ Можно призвать скелет цератопса, охваченный огнем. 
+ В субтитрах к песням реализовано караоке - желтый прыгающий шарик, помогающий подпевать. 
+ Есть "Обязательный уровень лавы". 
+ Кроми обычных зомбаков есть зомби животные: коровы, овцы, куры. Есть даже босс, состоящий из кучи потрохов, выброшенных мясником. 
+ Понять, что героя знатно так используют можно уже в начале игры, когда Избранным оказывается чуть ли не каждый второй. 
+ В самом конце, когда нужно принять чью-то сторону - добра или зла, можно вообще всех послать и уйти бухать с ожившими мертвецами. 

Минусы: 
- Не очень удобная камера. 
- В локализации субтитры песен бегут вперед, поэтому караоке в русской версии спеть не получится. 

Цитата: «Никогда не доверяй женщине» - скажет Бард, когда узнает истинную сущность принцессы (сразу, а не через десять лет после свадьбы) 

Мораль: Если от тебя требуют сделать трудный выбор и принять решение немедленно, смело иди и нажрись в баре с умертвиями. И да, никогда не доверяй женщине.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076756097', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1510920079}
review:
Es hat zwar spielerisch nichts mit den alten Bard´s Tale-Spielen zu tun (und auch nicht mit dem 4.Teil), als eigenständiges Spiel ist es ansonsten aber recht unterhaltsam. Im Prinzip ein lineares, witziges Action-RPG, da gibt es sicher besseres, aber für zwischendurch ganz nett.

PS: Die ersten 3 Teile sind dabei, wobei ich mir die nicht mehr angetan habe, das wäre mir heutzutage zu nervig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079678686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3172, 'last_played': 1690584227}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019782615', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1436, 'last_played': 1564903622}
review:
Let’s be honest, this is a remake of an old game. It’s no Fable, it’s no Witcher, it’s no Skyrim. But what this game does have its own charm. The nameless protagonist is simply referred to as 'the Bard' by villains and NPC's alike is great at making inappropriate quips should the need arise, the story is interesting, fun and I would like to see what happens next. This game definitely does not want to be taken seriously.

The downside is that it can be a bit of a slog or grind to get from Point A to point B at times. The combat and controls are a little clunky but these can be forgiven. It may not be for everyone, but its at least definitely worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226094820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1079, 'last_played': 1533137846}
review:
Ein ganz hervorragendes Spiel! 
Die Kämpfe können mitunter etwas frustrierend sein wenn das Balancing zwischen Gegner und Spieler scheinbar etwas weniger vorhanden ist, aber das war tatsächlich auch in den wenigsten Situationen der Fall.
Ansonsten kann ich hier nur eine Empfehlung aussprechen an die Leute, die ein Spiel mit leichter Story und und gutem Humor zu schätzen wissen. 
Für mich was es auch kein Titel, für den ich ewig lange gebraucht und hoch konzentriert eingetaucht bin, aber um für zwischendurch immer mal was zum Entspannen und Lachen/Schmunzeln zu haben, ist dieses Spiel top *Däumchen hoch*
Und noch was: Ohrwürmer definitiv vorprogrammiert!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972795804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1558815595}
review:
I would ike to say that this ia a great game, but just by launching it you will son notice that there are some obvious missing settings.
There NO display options, game is hardcoded to run in FULLSCREEN, works greats if you have a normal monitor, but if you have an extra wide screen, then this is very noticeably. There are hacks around to get this game to play in a window, or windows fullscreen.
It includes the orignial 3 games, on my superwide screen, it was stretched beyound comprehension, it simply looked bad to stretch a 4:3 game to 32:9 aspect. 

Ingame camera controlls, are virtually non existent, you can rotate the camera 360 degree, and have some zoom control, but you cannto adjust the angle.

So if you can overlook the above issuess, the humour in the game is enjoyable, sadly you only have two options to respond , be "nice" or be "bad", and soon you will encounter the next major issue, you have to restart the game constantly, as it SLOWS itself down alot when have it running over 1 hour... the gameplay and animations is not very fast to begin with, Iwould call it sluggish, but when the game slows down, you will notice how it turns into a slooooow mooootion game. it is hard to try and enjoy the humour when that happens.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977597227', 'num_games_owned': 1416, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1517409838}
review:
The Bard's Tale könnte ein gutes Rollenspiel sein. Es hat witzige Dialoge und dazu eine schöne Sprachausgabe. Begleitet wird es natürlich von netten Liedern (zum mitsingen).
Also bis hier alles fein.
Für mich wird der Spielspass stark gemindert durch die Steuerung mit WASD und der Todesstoß ist dann das Einfrieren oder Abstürzen des Spiels alle paar Stunden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026108348', 'num_games_owned': 699, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 2251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2251, 'last_played': 1556706478}
review:
Черт возьми! Классика во плоти!
Не играл в старого доброго барда - не пробовал по настоящему олдскульных европейских РПГ пропитанных циничным юмором!
 Быстро отложил денег с обеда, забыл про свою Доту и Андромеду, и пошел покупать этот шедевр игропорома! Щщщщщенок!
P.s. чуть ли не единственная игра в которой можно выбрать на столько правильную , жизненную концовку - идти бухать в бар, а эти, великие, пусть сами разбираются в своей бубуйне

author: {'steamid': '76561198024268889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1560615096}
review: Итак!!! Кому данный ПЕРЛ зайдёт!!!! Если рубились в Diablo 2 и Titan Quest по нескольку раз за разных персов!!!! Если есть терпелка двигаться по сюжету!!!! Игра с изюминкой - перс тут один, но реализация прокачки отличается (не сильно) от схожих игр!!!! Боёвка прикольная и да, люлей можно огрести запросто!!! Думайте головой - кого лупить мечами,кинжалами, а кого шинковать с лука!!!Прикольно реализован вызов помощников!!!! На фоне всяких клонов Диаблы - это самобытный продукт с юмором но с жёстким миром, с цинизмом, монстрятник свой оригинальный. Короче экшен в середневековом антураже!!! Смотрите обзоры в сети чё да как !!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049715895', 'num_games_owned': 1447, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 1655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1655, 'last_played': 1554151735}
review:
Это довольно забавная пародия на ролевые компьютерные игры минувших дней, не растерявшая своей актуальности. Если вам нравится и даже не нравятся некоторые ролевые элементы в ролевых играх из разряда принеси, подай, собирай, убивай и качай, то как минимум лёгкая улыбка вам обеспечена. Текстуры освежили, но видео ролики оставили низкого разрешения. В целом игра одноразовая, но тем кому она очень понравится, могут спустя долгое время вспомнить былое. 
И это первый дьяблойд и пока что единственный, который я осилил целиком.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049527900', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1553779053}
review:
A game with a lot of charm and comedic wit if the jokes resonate with you and about average to below gameplay if they don't.

I'l start with the gameplay first. In my opinion it can best be described as average at best. You attack, you can block and special charged attacks can be unlocked talents acquired at every couple of level-ups. The real difference between The Bard's tale and other games like it is the focus on summons.
The gameplay is build around the idea that you will be accompanied with a small group of summoned henchmen. All of them are specialized in one thing or another. You have your healer, tank, archer, melee dps and so on and so on. The act itself of summoning is only complicated in that you have to remember the key menu for each summon but when pressed your character starts it automatically. And as long as you have the required mana you can re-summon any one of them at any time.
Added to that fact is the realization that you have no control whatsoever over your summons and everything they do is more or less on auto pilot and you have in my opinion a quaint little title that doesn't really impress in gameplay but did try something a bit more unique in it's time.

The story itself is also not particularly interesting or thrilling as far as plot or lore goes. Again it does it's job and might even surprise you every now and again but it's not the main hook of the game.


The main draw is already obvious in the first dialogue you have with a npc and that is the way everything is presented is the hook. Comedy, satire, irony. In many ways the game feels like a comedic parody of a more typical hero goes to save the princess game. And if this is something that you can enjoy then I cannot recommend this more since I personally do like this type of comedy and jokes quite a lot.

If the jokes aren't funny to you or you don't like the atmosphere the title tries to establish then the gameplay will not be enough to hold your attention.

Edit: Also worth noting is how well this remaster runs on modern hardware and software. Something that many older games here on Steam fail and are still being sold with the hope that the community can somehow fix it themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209345391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1472845029}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008637035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1608717844}
review:
It's a quirky little game that doesn't take itself too seriously!

Let out a demon? Bards later will sing songs about how your character is a dimwit! It is definitely not politically correct, which makes it all the more funny!

Also in what other game can your character go cow tipping? 

While I haven't played much the Steam version I have played other versions to the very end, of which there are three endings (don't worry I won't give them away too much) just suffice it to say, you can side with the demoness, fight the demoness, or just walk away! How many games have an ending where you can just walk away leaving undead to walk the Earth? Two of those endings are rather funny, and disgusts the narrator!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043569762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1739, 'last_played': 1510027705}
review: I enjoyed the humor and playing around with the summon system. It doesn't feel particularly complex, but there is a decent amount to explore and the interactions are fun enough to warrant playing through again. Achievements didn't pop for the first half of my playthrough for some reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988376808', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1456, 'last_played': 1548320772}
review:
I remember when the game first released. I hadn't played any of the originals and despite the trailer being entertaining and the game getting positive reviews, I skipped it.

I'm not really sure why I skipped it, but I probably shouldnt have as deciding to play it on a whim I found it to be pretty damn awesome.

This isnt a modern game.
-there are no checkpoints, If you don't save often you will regret it at some point.
-there is no fast travel. If you climb a tower, you're climbing back down.
-the only tutorial in the game is skippable and only covers the basics.
- just about every bit of dialog and cutscenes are skippable.

The humor is great. the story is entertaining and the combat fun and varied. 

Graphically it is dated, but the style used holds up ok. 
The camera angle may initially put people off but it works well here. It bugged me for maybe my first walk through town

The controller button mapping is multiple levels of stupid though. 

It's sad to see a game this enjoyable have such a low achievement rate for things that can be completed in the first hour of gameplay, I hope this is due to the game originally not having them until the remaster and everyone just enjoyed this game previously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151637865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1699187790}
review:

review:
Very witty dialogue, intricate level design, humorous musical numbers, excellent example of 'actions have consequences'. Be wary of bogus collision errors, particularly when avoiding floor spikes - if you think you avoided it... you didn't.

A really great game, and one that can definitely be revisited, not just because of the quality of the game (it has multiple endings)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019270397', 'num_games_owned': 4149, 'num_reviews': 732, 'playtime_forever': 2540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2540, 'last_played': 1543079255}
review:
[h1] Points positifs : [/h1]

- Un jeu bourré d'humour !
- Des situations grotesques, des moments très drôles et beaucoup de dialogues absurdes !
- Le gameplay agréable
- Les graphismes sont acceptables
- L'univers ambiant du titre
- Les différentes fins possibles
- Le charisme de notre barde
- L'interaction du narrateur avec l'histoire
- Une bonne durée de vie
- L'ambiance musicale
- Le style RPG et la progression du héros...

[h1] Points négatifs : [/h1]

- ... Trop vite limitée dans les caractéristiques !
- La répétitivité de certaines scènes
- La lassitude qui s'installe au bout de quelques heures de jeu par le manque d'interactions
- Les combats peu intéressants...
- ... Surtout quand on joue un archer !

[h1] En conclusion... [/h1]

Malgré ses quelques défauts, The Bard's Tale est une vraie pépite pour moi. En effet, le titre est vraiment doté d'un humour à toutes épreuves et étant donné le faible nombre de jeux mettant l'accent sur le style humoristique, je ne peux que m'en réjouir ! C'est un humour parfois graveleux, un peu lourd, mais j'ai beaucoup ri car le jeu ne se prend pas au sérieux et cumule les aprioris et autres stéréotypes.

Pour ceux aimant le genre RPG, vous passerez certainement un bon moment même si The Bard's Tale finit par lasser par son manque d'interactions et de scènes toujours plus comiques. Le gameplay est bon mais les combats deviennent redondants au bout d'un moment (malgré l'originalité du système des différentes invocations !). Les graphismes du titre commencent à dater mais restent tout de même agréables. Je déconseille d'axer vos caractéristiques et vos compétences sur le style de l'archer, le vestiaire concernant les différents arcs n'est pas très étoffé et cela ajoute à la lassitude des combats...

Néanmoins, The Bard's Tale reste une vraie belle découverte que je ne peux que conseiller par son originalité et ses nombreuses qualités. Un jeu à découvrir ! >> 15/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198097630483', 'num_games_owned': 1117, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1543232195}
review:
Если не успел сделать оригинальный проект раньше, то сделай пародию на жанр, этим руководился создатель игры Брайан Фарго. Игра пародирует весь жанр, высмеивая все стереотипы, к которым мы привыкли за всё время, она даже построена на шотландских и бретонских сказаниях, а они не часто заглядывают на игровой огонек. Но какой бы не был сюжет и атмосфера, всё равно, всё портит геймплей, который как бы является данью классике, но очень быстро себя изживает, из-за низкого разнообразия ударов, которые как бы компенсируются призываемыми существами, но погоду не делают.
[h1] Порадовало	[/h1]
+ Интересный сюжет, очередной раз высмеивающий все стереотипы
+ Разнообразие противников и боссов
+ Разнообразие призываемых существ
[h1] Огорчило[/h1]
- Скучный геймплей с огромным количеством противников к концу игры
- Устаревшая графика, даже для того времени
- Медленный персонаж
- Странно расставленные чек-поинты, опять таки к концу игры
[h1] Сюжет	[/h1]
Очередная история про спасение принцессы, которая наградит персонажа за все его приключения, но игра переворачивает всё вверх тормашками, делая некоторые вещи немного странными, но удивление от этих вещей напрямую зависит от вашего опыта, если вы уже давно играете во всё подряд, то повествование будет для вас скучным и типичным для РПГ, которое не такое как все.
[h1] Геймплей	[/h1]
Ну тут и говорить нечего, типичная actionRPG с её плюсами и минусами, но только с единственной уникальностью, призывом существ на помощь главному герою, а так это очередная ударь/заблокируй/ударь опять, которая приелась еще в те времена.
[h1] Послесловие	[/h1]
Она создана для удовлетворения потребностей игроков в РПГ, которые могли изголодаться по приключениям, но если есть во что поиграть, то лучше пропустить Bard's Tale и не мучать себя бесконечным затыкиванием монстров.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003037363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1296, 'last_played': 1539034421}
review: The Bard's Tale is a hilarious game. It is full with silly jokes and catchy songs. Behind the humorous story there is a well designed adventure game. The progression is smooth it's not too fast it's not too slow and you are allways getting small upgrades to arsenal of 'songs'. The 'feel' of the game brought me some nostalgia of playing story driven games with easter eggs and things to do. In the game there is some traction between the main character and the narrator (awesome voice btw) that makes you feel that you are the villain and the narrator is the hero. Overall I think this awesome game with lots of humor is underrated and that's why I wrote a review so more people can enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006633570', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1597138741}
review:
A fun game!

The gameplay is simple, but there is nothing wrong with that - it is Dark Alliance-esque action adventure with limited roleplaying options - and it works fine as such. That said; on harder difficulties some of the fights can actually be quite challenging, and you have to make use of your various abilities to beat the odds.

The graphics have aged surprisingly well, and given a slight upgrade that they've been given the game passes very well for something that you could buy as a cheaply priced "arcade" title today.

Music is very good, featuring medieval/fantasy themed tunes, but also including real songs (or parodies of them), like the "Beer, Beer, Beer- Charlie Mops" drinking song. 

Voice acting is stellar, with the story's narrator being voiced by the late great Tony Jay, and our protagonist voiced by Cary Elwes (of Robin Hood: Men in Tights comedy fame).

If you can't appreciate the humour in this game then there's probably something wrong with you: it is absolutely golden, feeling like it pays homage to golden age of humour by legends like Mel Brooks. 

If you want a fun, simple action adventure game with good humour, then get this!

review:
ITA-ESP-ENG

Quando ho iniziato a giocarci, ancora non sapevo che sarebbe diventato uno dei miei giochi preferiti. E' stata proprio una splendida avventura. Adesso che l'ho finito, mi manca già.

Cuando comencé a jugar con él, todavía no sabía que se convertiría en uno de mis juegos favoritos. Fue simplemente una maravillosa aventura. Ahora que lo he terminado, ya me falta mucho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302208299', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 4728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1636586638}
review:
I'm not a huge fan of the game but it's alright.  It's 3D style animation but your stuck in largely top down view which I dislike... seriously if it's 3D that sort of defeats the purpose.  The story line isn't exactly the most compelling and isn't entirely linear.  While it can be fun a lot of times it just starts to feel monotonous.  The controls are not great so sometimes fights seem overly difficult because you can't control the character properly.  I absolutely HATE the little cutscene that occurs when you heal yourself using the crystals.  It takes way too much time and is totally unnecessary.  Totally pulls me out of the action and interrupts game play.  There's no real inventory, you can't really level skills much or anything so that's disappointing.  Mostly you can learn different songs to call other creatures to help you.  It's supposed to be humorous, with the bard being snarky.  I tend to revel in snarky and sarcastic humor but I didn't find most of this to be that funny.  The dialogue feels to contrived most of the time.  It's not quite an RPG.  On it's own the game is only so-so.

I bought this version because it supposedly includes the original games (1-3) which I've heard good things about but never had the opportunity to play but I cannot for the life of me figure out how to play them.  It asks me for the save data or something which I clearly don't have.  I'll have to look into it more when I have more time to see if I can figure it out.  So, not being able to play the original 3 games so far lowers my opinion of this overall purchase.  I probably would have purchased the trilogy as their own set (which is available) and not this one but it was a good deal at the time so I chose this one thinking "hey, 4 games!"  Afterwards, I discovered this isn't even really a sequel to the original trilogy apparently the developer only had rights to the name.  So I'm not sure it's worth it if your really just interested in the originals.  This one apparently doesn't really have a sequential place in the series anyways.

If you enjoyed the original trilogy in your youth and would like to replay them again for nostalgia... just buy the original trilogy as it's own separate pack.  Skip this one all together.  If you really like this style of game I guess give it a try it's not a bad game it just isn't a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11092, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1540302734}
review:
This is a remastered/remade version of the pre-PC classic The Bard's Tale game(s).  The package does include ported versions of the original games as well as the remake.  

The problem is the remake wasn't done very well.  Fixed resolution and capped at an unforgiveable 30fps, the gameplay is janky when it should be smooth.  Camera rotation controls are bizarrely inverted, and to add injury to insult, you can't rebind the controls.   You also can't adjust the video settings in any meaningful way so it's impossible to save this one. 

While this was a game I'd been aware of and wanted to get into, the inexplicable shortcomings mean this game fails to meet the minimum standards expected of any video game, even for 2005.    The $10 price tag for this mess is also intolerable.   People looking for a retro gaming experience might do better with Grimrock games, or just playing a more modern RPG adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202495820', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1538094565}
review:
Would not open on Windows 10 without crashing.
For some reason it works on LInux but the controls constantly freeze up and my character runs until he hits a wall, which doesn't help during boss battles.
Certain cutscenes break the game entirely... 
I like the ps2 game but this game is so buggy when it actually works.

EDIT: After much pain I did manage to get the game working. What you do is get a little patch from google to make it Windowed, and then install that. Go to the exe file and make it compatible for the OS it was made for, which I believe was 7.
Then open the game. If it doenst open properly or you spend several minutes waiting, close the game with the task manager and retry. 

Obviously that is not a fun "solution" but I never got a proper chance to play this when I was a kid, and the ps2 iso lags to hell so this is amazing in retrospect. I will change this to a "yes" but on linux this game is broken. Do not buy this if you are on Linux unless you are willing to take a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982795805', 'num_games_owned': 1284, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1531967800}
review:
A remake of the classic Bard's tale where they apparently forgot to check that it actually works with Windows 10. Just to get it to work you have to find the fan made patch, as without it you will either not be able to load the game at all or it will be moving in slow motion.

Then lets talk about the game, starting with it's so called humour. It is much more like the bad Lesuire Suit Larry games then Monkey Island, it didn't make me smile, let alone laugh, so I'm having a hard time figuring out what the other reviewers thought was so funny. 

Then there is it's combat. Slow, unresponsive and just tedious. Finally, we have it's loading screens. Every time you go in or out of a building or area it cuts to a loading screen for 2-5 seconds even when installed on a SSD. Not too bad in an adventure area but really frustrating in a village and you are trying to explore it for some of that elusive humour :P

In conclusion a dull, buggy and unfunny RPG that when you finally get it to work you'll wish you hadn't bothered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051604597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1353, 'last_played': 1531773456}
review: Siendo sincero no puedes evitar decir que el tiempo le pesa y lo hace mal pero hey, es que nunca fue hecho para jugar en Pc. El port esta decente lo que es interesante de este falso Rpg (ya que las decisiones que tomas realmente son muy limitadas asi como el crecimiento de tu personaje) es su idea original y su carisma sin igual. En todo el tiempo que llevo jugando nunca vi un juego con un humor tan cheesy en el sentido de que se toma a si mismo entre medio en serio y medio en broma. Una historia disfrutable aunque predecible y un protagonista entrañable. La musica te mete en contexto y es de lo mejor que tiene el juego, escucharla de nuevo luego de tantos años produce mucha nostalgia de la buena. La experiencia grata considerando lo simple de su sistema de combate. Para mi es una joya que paso sin pena ni gloria en la epoca del Ps2 y que marcó mi infancia por lo que me resulta muy dificil no ser parcial. Recomendado le doy un 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198077161722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1531342280}
review:
The humor is good, songs are good... But combat is just out of the question. Combat is atrociously terrible and plays way too big a part for this game, making it frustrating and honestly shit. 

I can define this combat system as "worst of all combat systems" in any game I've played for my entire life, and will probably never find something worse as this, it's the worst of the worst.

All in all; if you're going to witness the Bard's Tale story, either A: Play it on the easy difficulty as combat is just shat out like diarrhea, or B: See a Let's Play of this as it's completely damn annoying to play while fighting enemies due to these reasons:

1: Input lag is so frustrating for both melee and bow; click and hold for bow, at times the game doesn't recognize that you're doing it and at times the character will pull the arrow back on the bow but not fire. 
2: Movement too with right-click is obnoxiously bad, at times will move until you click right-click again.
3: Melee combat is terrible for the reason it's slower, more terrible and obnoxious to control where you swing the weapon, basically a terrible version of Dark Soul's sword fighting. 
4: Questionable summonings as A; minions don't block, B; dedicated block minions are useless, C; healer companion only heals, meaning there's a specific purpose for minions making it a "META-build" on minions, killing diversity of playstyle, which is to be frank; unoriginal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972222473', 'num_games_owned': 1347, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1531011796}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027331263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1530726653}
review:
This is not an opinion on the main game; i have tried it only for a couple of minutes and have no opinion yet.
This is about the three included classic games from the original series, which for me was the reason to buy the whole bundle.

TLDR: Get the classics from some abandonware site and use DosBox!

I bought the Bard's Tale for the classics, but it was not what I expected.

Bard's Tale 1 & 2 are for some strange reason Apple ][ GS images, not the MS Dos version.
Bard's Tale 3 is the older (!) Apple ][ version.
So, yes, the third game looks way worse than 1 & 2 if you buy this bundle. 

The classics start in fullscreen, and I could not find an easy way to make them run in a window.
Some guides explain that you have to download a modified dx9 dll. If you care for that type of risk go ahead.

The apple emulator seems slow and laggy (especially for BT 3, for some unknown reason).

Oh, and to top it all off - "V" to turn of the MIDI music DOES NOT WORK during character creation / or in the guild. 
Seems to be an Apple ][ GS version thing, it even states exactly that in the manual.

Drove me mad, that "Gedudel".

author: {'steamid': '76561197974770789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3102, 'last_played': 1529488949}
review:
I had bought this on sale because I wanted to try something different than what I normally play.. I've finished playing this all the way through and... Yep!  It's certainly different,,, Someone with a wicked sense of humor must have written all of the character dialogue for this game.. :)  I love the snarky 4th wall comments throughout the entire game.  Oh! I have to recommend using a PS3/PS4/Steam type of game controller to play this game though.  Even though you CAN use the  keyboard / mouse, it's much faster and easier to move and navigate the player item & spell menus than trying to remember a bunch of keyboard commands... I have to say that it was definately worth the $10 I spent for this. It's apparently on sale again...It's definately worth getting.  It was a lot of fun to play and it got very challenging at times.  I seriously had a great time playing this and I was kinda sad to get to the end of the story...
~A~

author: {'steamid': '76561198057219226', 'num_games_owned': 1368, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1562083961}
review:
The game seems to be quite funny, but unfortunately Linux-version seems to be also quite unplayable. Character starts running with no way of stopping and then I have to load save to experience that again and again with no hope of advancing in the game. Also the second story-related NPC got stuck in a corner and softlocked the game. To be honest, I got through that by skipping the animations by pressing esc but the incident tells quite much about the quality of this game.

The new remaster seems to be done with quite minimal effort. When the game started with very choppy early 2000s animation with abysmal resolution, I started really doubting I got the new version. However the character models seemed to be a bit more decent. After the first 10 minutes, I experienced another blast from the past in form of loading screens that occured every time I entered one of the 15 houses of the town. 

I might try if the game would be playable with Wine. In any case, I'm not recommending this game to any Linux owner or anyone who values this decade performance standards for their games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036097041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1898, 'last_played': 1528764224}

This game is hilarious. The songs will get stuck in your head in a good way. Carey Elwes voices the title character. Did I mention it's hilarious?

author: {'steamid': '76561197961801742', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 2077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2077, 'last_played': 1527147467}
review:
7/10: The Bard's Tale is a funny, sarcastic journey to free a "princess" that quickly develops into a series of unfortunate events surrounding the titular Bard. Summon allies, destroy your enemies, and reap your just rewards!

The Bard's Tale is an RPG that starts classically enough: the Bard enters town and heads to the bar for his first quest, obviously involving rats. After helping and ogling the hostess, the Bard meets a mysterious stranger that tells him he is the chosen one, to which even the Bard reacts skeptically. Even so the promise of wealth and a beautiful, grateful princess pique his interest, so he sets off on his quest to fetch magical instruments and ascend towers in order to free her. 

Combat is pretty run of the mill for a top-down RPG, featuring three forms of melee combat and bows for ranged. Your main tools are the various tunes you learn to summon allies, which do everything from occupying enemies in melee to healing to finding secret doors. While it's fun to have a full team destroying mobs, there isn't a lot of variance to the moves or enemy types so combat can get repetitive after 20 hours of play, especially once you pick one weapon type to focus on. Moreover, it is very easy to miss items and achievements in this game since many areas change irrevocably after you complete each tower. Make sure you finish everything you can find in area before ascending its tower!

The high point of the game though is the story and voice acting. Whether it's the narrator's mocking, the shopkeepers sales pitches, or the Bard's own brand of snark, the dialogue really brings out the absurdity of the entire endeavor. Particularly once the trow trio show up and start singing "It's Bad Luck to be You" like Oompa Loompa's escaped from Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory. 

The Bard's Tale is worth playing for anyone who enjoys a story full of cheeky characters and sarcasm, as long as they can handle early 2000's graphics and a simple combat system. Play it nice or play it snarky, just make sure you don't play yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995133552', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1201, 'last_played': 1526436549}
review:
This game is just straight up boring.

I gave it an honest chance. I even sunk so much time into it I decided to just finish it to get it off my mind altogether. There's so much I want to like about this game but it pretty much falls flat on all fronts.

First of all, I had to patch the game myself just to get it to run correctly. The game has a problem running on Windows 10 that wasn't patched where the game is slowed down by like 70%? It was a pretty easy fix though. For those who still want to buy and play the game, you can find the patch to run it correctly on PC it here:

https://community.pcgamingwiki.com/files/file/87-the-bards-tale-2005-windowed-mode/

All you have to do is drop the d3d9.dll file into the installation folder and it should fix it. Although I believe this creates a small problem entirely, where when small voice lines are said, a small snippit will replay after them. It was annoying, but not anything game-breaking.

Anyway, the humor is cheesy and at many points, kinda cringeworthy. At no point in the entirety if the game did I even laugh. And that's pretty bad considering the game banks itself on style over substance. Most of the game's humor is either crude or poorly executed. You'd have a better time playing a game that balances gameplay and humor better, like Psychonauts.

The gameplay itself is extremely boring. Level designs are uninteresting and recycled. Enemies and enemy types are reskinned and recycled. The RPG elements of the game are boiled down to their lowest common denomenators to a point where you can disregard half of the game's stats and slam all of The Bard's leveling into all of the stats to turn him into the bigger stick,

I think that's what it comes down to: who has the bigger stick. Most of the time I played through it, much of the game's difficulty revolved around who had the bigger stick, me or the couple of enemies on screen. It doesn't come down to party composition, or playing strategically.

The least I can say is that the voice acting performances by Cary Elwes as The Bard and Tony Jay as The Narrator respectively are pretty endearing and playful. They sound seasoned in their craft and can be pretty entertaining at times. In fact, it was probably why I kept playing in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026006693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1524913493}
review: The graphics are of tolerable quality, but the view is always from directly above.  Movement gets confusing because the direction is relative to the camera view, meaning you have difficulty adjusting the view to movement. The game gets stuck in its animations forcing you to reload. The text can be skipped if heard before, but otherwise you are forced to listen/read the whole thing wiht no possibility of skipping to the next line. They seem to have gone out of their way to not have learned anything from the plethora of past an present UI's for games. Then there is the story, which starts off with the "hero" being a loser and a thief. I've never lost interest in a game as quick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053361807', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1494, 'last_played': 1524688748}
review:
Эта замечательная игра вышла в 2005 году. Если бы я прошел её тогда, я бы долго подбирал слова, чтобы описать свой восторг. Но сейчас, в 2018, я могу написать очень просто - это Deadpool в мире игр.

Огромный заряд юмора, в том числе и чёрного, творящийся повсюду хаос и сюжетное безумие, заигрывания с четвертой стеной, целая куча клише, о которых знают сами герои. Невероятная игра. Одна из тех игр, от которых совершенно невозможно оторваться.

Пересказывать всё это нельзя - и спойлеры, и в пересказе будет не настолько интересно. Её можно только сравнивать - с Дэдпулом, с типовыми пародиями на фильмы ("Очень страшное кино"), или даже с книгами Пратчетта. И эта игра ухитрилась создать современную сюжетную модель больше десяти лет назад. Поклонникам РПГ обязательно нужно её пройти.

У неё немного старая графика, но после ремастеринга выглядит вполне достойно. Звуки можно сказать что приятные, но вообще во время битв я просто делал звук потише, потому что слишком уж он резкий. Слушать рекомендую только вставки с разговорами, а не фоновые звуки сражений. Голоса барда и рассказчика - прекрасны, слушайте только в оригинале, даже если где-то лежат "полные переводы".

К сожалению, у игры есть очень серьёзный минус, о котором нужно подробно написать.

Это игровой процесс. Игра восхитительна своим сюжетом, самим  рассказом и миром. Это творение гениального режиссера. Но играть в неё невыносимо совершенно.

В отрицательных отзывах всё написано честно и справедливо - боевка сделана ужасно, магия слишком долгая и унылая. От РПГ как такового практически ничего не осталось, выбора оружия тоже нет, худшее просто меняется на лучшее, амулеты автоматически укладываются в слоты.

В принципе мне даже это нравится - ведь и правда это не игра даже, а именно наджанровая пародия. Здесь не нужно настраивать карту героя и выбирать оружие, здесь главное - это наблюдения за приключениями барда и постмодернистскими отсылками в игровом мире. Но создателям нужно было быть до конца последовательными и боёвку тоже упростить. Этого не сделали.

В результате более-менее терпимо сражаться можно только на первом уровне. Потом враги становятся очень сильными и убивают тебя практически сразу. И игра начинает ВЫМАТЫВАТЬ. Учитывая, что сохранения консольные - т.е. сохраняться можно только в определенных местах - ситуация "идем заново бить тех же врагов" может полностью убить весь интерес прямо в первой главе.

К счастью, создатели это всё-таки учли. И поэтому игре есть восхитительный чит-код на неуязвимость. И под восхитительным я подразумеваю то, что это чит-код старой школы - он просто делает неуязвимость и всё. Не пытается давить на игрока, указывая в статусе, что он теперь "обманщик". Не отнимает достижения. Не портит квесты. Просто. Даёт. Неуязвимость.

Чуть не прослезился, увидев это на фоне античитингового идиотизма современных игр.

Поэтому смело включайте неуязвимость и играйте, используя сохранения только ради того, чтобы выбирать различные варианты в диалогах. И вы будете вознаграждены поистине великолепной историей. Из-за плохой боевки я поставил бы 8 из 10, но в сюжетном плане это, конечно, шедевр и для ознакомления усиленно рекомендуется.


--
Мои обзоры на [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/30807969/]странице куратора[/url] (на них можно подписаться)

author: {'steamid': '76561198119501998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2565, 'last_played': 1524687520}
review: Замечательная веселая игра. Шутки циничные и саркастические, а потому актуальны и по сей день. Ими и разбавляется диаблоподобная игра. Русификатор ставится нормально с руководства из стима. Разгонка при тормозне (у меня Бард медленно двигался) тоже из стимовского руководства - спасибо авторам. В общем отличная и не затянутая игрушка. Рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103909148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1525342735}
review:
Thoroughly loved it on the ps2on spotted it on sale for this on the ps4. Went to steam cos as per usual, its cheaper. 
This is still the same awesome game i remember and i stilllove every minute of it...
Well i did when i fixed the slo mo issue which effected me and a few others. 
If you have this issue, then do what it tells you here...
https://www.gog.com/forum/the_bards_tale/playing_the_game_in_a_borderless_window
Then, if its not the fitting the screen or if it overlaps into any additional monitors you have thrn right click on the game in your library and go into graphics settings and mess around with the resolution till it fits. Then the game plays like a dream.
Still worth the £6.99 i paid for this

author: {'steamid': '76561198003545953', 'num_games_owned': 3085, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1391, 'last_played': 1536978246}
review:
I think I've played enough of this that I can't not recommend it.  It's nothing special, but it's consistent, and easy to pick up and play.  A good time waster.  

That being said, the game definitely doesn't meet the expectations that it advertises.  It's not funny, in fact it's often cringy, and while the characters are mostly tollerable the dialogue certainly isn't clever.  The game play is literally the same thing over and over again, but I haven't really minded since the world has a fair bit going on and the plot moves quickly enough.  The voice acting is great, for whatever that's worth.  I've never played the console version, so I don't know how it compares, but this one has it's fair share of bugs.  Nothing super game breaking, except that one time the game broke on me but reloading fixed it, mostly the summons getting stuck or instantly dying.  Lots of times the presentation feels lacking, like when the goblins sing, or when a cut scene plays with zero background sounds.  It's awkward and feels like something was lost when brought over to Steam, but I don't know.

So lots of stuff going against this game, but really, it's certainly worth the 10 bux if your interested and don't mind mediocrity, and I'm still playing it 20+ hours later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064568395', 'num_games_owned': 9679, 'num_reviews': 963, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1383, 'last_played': 1520849728}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th][h1] My Playthrough [/h1][/th]
        [th][url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLTZKn1hLlcQMUrmyCvwmPvfOov0v00JiH] Youtube Playlist [/url][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][h1]The Review[/h1][/td]
        [td]The Bard's Tale is a great comedy but a bad RPG. This game is like RPG lite. Usual staples of rpgs like inventory, companions, and quests are all simplified. Their is not inventory system as you have only one item for each section. When ever you pick up a stronger item the weaker one is automatically sold. Not that much side quest and the ones they have are simple and straightforward. The companions are all summons so they can't permanently die. The saving grace of this game is the characters and writing. The story is the only good thing in the game. You will find yourself wanting to see the bard succeed because he is such a likeable character. For the price I recommend this game for people that want a funny game.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]
