author: {'steamid': '76561198202079747', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1510766123}
review:
"ЭЛЬ ЭЛЬ ЭЛЬ, СТАРЫЙ ДОБРЫЙ ЭЛЬ"

Давным-давно,давным-давно,в былые времена 
Из выпивки на всей земле была одна вода 
Пока не родился на свет парнишка Чарли Шмель, 
Который первым угадал зачем на свете хмель.
Пускай завидуют ему епископ с королём 
Ведь мы,собравшись за столом, хвалу ему поём. 
Пускай прославится в веках великий Чарли Шмель! 
Благослови его,Господь,он подарил нам хмель!

Ты загляни в любой трактир,хоть обойди весь свет, 
И всюду пиво подают-от Чарли нам привет. 
И вечером,когда трактир закроют,мы икнём 
И пять мгновений помолчим,и Чарли помянём!

Хмель,солод,бочка да вода-вот к радости ключи! 
Любой из нас всегда не против глотку промочить. 
Десяток кружек эля в день-и ты,как бык здоров, 
К тому же обойдёшься ты всю жизнь без докторов!

Пускай завидуют ему епископ с королём 
Ведь мы,собравшись за столом, хвалу ему поём. 
Пускай прославится в веках великий Чарли Шмель! 
Благослови его,Господь,он подарил нам хмель!

Эль,эль,эль,старый добрый эль!

 - Ох, спустя столько времени добавили ачивки и карточки, прямо рай какой то.
 - Игру брать рекомендую, даже не по скидону, поверьте, эта игра должна стоить больше, ибо в игре 2005 года вы больше нигде не найдете столько отборного, глупого и остроумного юмора как тут.
 - Отличная английская озвучка, классическая игра на лютне в тавернах и увлекательно-глупая история одного барда, который гонится за богатством и сиськами, что еще надо?
 - У игры уйма плюсов, да и какой вообще смысл оценивать этот шедевр?  - Это классика, черт возьми!
 - Минус все же есть - это управление, сделано оно очень бомбезно, ибо направление атак можно задавать только клавишами хотьбы, мышка просто для удара, что очень печалит...
 - Но все же, игру брать рекомендую, старичкам - не старичкам, детям, женщинам, всем кому хочется просто провести вечер в теплой компании озабоченного барда и автора, который рассказывает историю того же барда.
10 из 10 поющих алкашей в таверне!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000983694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2683, 'last_played': 1539335002}

author: {'steamid': '76561198236490498', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1399, 'last_played': 1599154467}
review: Старая, но проверенная годами игра. Не надоедает даже через сотню прохождий. Эпичные битвы вперемешку с отменным юмором и интересной боевой системой сильно поднимают настроение, а недавнее обновление с введением достижений только повторно зажгло интерес к ещё одному прохождению этой игры. The Bard's Tale - одна из тех игр, в которые хочется вернуться спустя несколько лет, пройти и забыть на год-два, а после снова вернуться в знакомые локации за порцией носталгии, эпика, да и просто приятного времяпрепровождения.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030360062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1403636860}
review: I had more fun replaying The Bard's Tale I. Its sucessor hasn't aged half as well. The jokes are okay, but gameplay is dull & awful.
developer_response:
Thanks for the feedback! We've always viewed the "new" Bard's Tale as more of a spin-off than a direct follow-up. The classic games are of course still very near and dear to us.

We're actually currently developing The Bard's Tale IV, which is a direct successor to the classic games. We hope you'll check it out when it releases!

review:
Before writing anything, I want to make clear I am an old gamer... 51 this year.  I love games.  All kinds of games, but especially RPGs.  And I don't dislike a game very easily.

I wanted to like Bard's Tale.  I really did.  I played the original RPG Bard's Tale games twenty odd years ago.  And I could not stand playing this game for more than 10 minutes.  I then deleted it from my system.  Really bad controls, very bad camera positioning, and did I mention the controls?  Bad.  Really, really bad.  Won't give this game a second chance bad.  

:p

Next game, please...

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1643043956}
review:
Tags: Isometric RPG - Topdown RPG

TLDR: Sword&Sorcery Lite. Tabletport has received some serious attention to the engine but still has quirky yet servicable control scheme.

Troubleshooting note: With the remastered edition, many old issues are gone. Still make sure to go to Graphic Settings from the launcher, or summon it by right clicking the Library Entry for this title and manually dialing in your resolution for best experience.

Disclaimer: Its a CCRPG, casualized for tablets. Thankfully the tap to interact interface mostly translates into a workable point&click topdown scheme that feels mostly robust and standard except for the odd reduction in run speed when cliking close to the protagonist. All on-screen tablet-like menus are now summoned through keyboard shortcuts.

"Q+E" Rotates camera
Hold Right Click to draw character towards location, furthest the point of click the faster you walk
Left Click to attack

"1+2+3+4" Each open a respective radial menu. Allowing holstering and swapping of equipped weapons. Use of magical songs. Use of cooldown powers for current attack. Use of the summon system.

Each radial menu once summoned must then be navigated into branches and sub-branches using "W+A+S+D"

The end result is that you will build muscle memory and quickly spam odd commands like 2WA to summon an electric spider or dismiss it as needed.  It is quirky to get used to but not altogether ineffective once learning curve has passed.

Camera control felt decent, with a good stable anchor point and smooth rotations. Itemization is streamlined with auto-selling of lesser weaponry and auto-selling of sellable loot at the point of looting in the wilderness. Clear upgrade paths do not offer choices as much as just clear +stats with the occasional additional effect for a magical item. 

Dialogue is excellent. Voice acting is excellent. Tone is both dark and humorous and I find it to be absolutely memorable and iconic. 

Game can become a bit of a slog in certain areas that are little more than large mazes filled with hostiles with few scripted hotspots to help the pacing along, multi layer dungeons. It is just not the same without the intricate skill/stat/perk, indepth dialogue trees and loot heaven that we have come to expect from most RPGS. Thats not even counting crafting system.

The visuals looked impressive compared to the original Ipad rendition and the audio was a little bare at times with lack of music but usually made up for by either environment effects of excellent voice acting, and even the occasional singing act.

Conclusion: If you are okay playing a watered down CCRPG that feels a bit like diablo at times. You will be rewarded with a flavorful protagonist, a jaded narrator, decent core mechanics, the chance to play with the game's thematic bardic magic and see how the devs weaved that into the plot in an elegant and satisfying manner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079719265', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 4360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2582, 'last_played': 1584677711}
review:
This games' final difficulty is called "Olde School Bard", I start this review with this remark since it's a telltale sign of it's structure and what it has to offer for those of you that are aquainted with older games. 

From the exposition you notice that the game is narrated by an outward voice that breaks the fourth wall many times along with the Bard himself. This making the whole show a hilarious tag-team of snarky coordination or dowright banter where the narrator roasts the Bard for his shortcomings, well deserved or not. 

The story is so simple and stereotypical, it only leaves space for greater improvisation, eventful encouters and great exploration structuring( though the game is a semi-open world game). The greatest feature of the game in the end is that old school feeling of exploring every nook and cranny, for it actually rewards you greatly and feeds into our older game experiences that we like to reminsce about.(the not so recent but new implementation of achievments does jumpstart the curiosity for such things)

I whole heartedly recommend this game and the older DOS games that come packaged in this amazing title. 

Toss a coin to your Bard bois!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050115830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1150, 'last_played': 1504921285}
review:
Bard's Tale это одна из тех игр которые начинают за здравие, а заканчивают за упокой. К сожалению у разработчиков не хватило умения или желания, что бы сделать всю игру такой веселой и интересной какой она была в начале. С каждой главой количество контента на квадратный метр и забавных шуток становится все меньше, а желания побыстрее со всем этим покончить все больше (уверен разработчки чувствовали тоже самое). В конечном итоге игра скатывается к серии бездумных арен со всеми прошлыми монстрами на последнем уровне и в этот момент ты понимаешь что разрабы просто сдались и махнули на игру рукой.
Эта игра была абсолютным проходняком, не стоящим внимания, уже во время своего выхода и прошедшие годы не сделали ее лучше. Единственная причина брать ее сейчас это познакомится с классическими Bard's Tale, которые идут вместе с игрой, ну или если вы хотите поностальгировать над игрой в которую вы играли в детстве (мой случай).
ЗЫ. Забыл добавить что песни здесь реально клевые, жаль их мало. Посмотрите в ютубе кто не видел.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025841721', 'num_games_owned': 1873, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1519684240}
review:
Bard's tale это старая, очень старая игра
Не в плане того, когда она вышла, а в плане того, как она прошла проверку временем
Сама суть игры по идее должна быть в том, что тебе дают антигероя и позволяют вертеть на половом органе всякие клише историй про избранных, которые должны спасти средневековый мир и всякое такое
Но нелинейности здесь практически нет
Геймплей вторичен до охуения просто, ещё и с бектрекингом
Есть система заклинаний являющаяся здесь основополагающей 
Бард в своих охуительных приключениях собирает всякие заклинания призыва всяких полезных наемников и разных зверушек
Чем круче инструмент, на котором он балакает, тем больше уродов он может позвать с собой
Уроды сделаны вполне нескучно, одни помогают в геймплейных ситуёвинах(ищут ловушки, освещают темноту), остальные же участвуют в битвах, либо с оружием(наёмник, лучница), либо элементально(электропаук, дух огня)
Ещё есть камни, которые позволяют пользоваться духами, один дают в начале, остальных за боссов(один дух является хилкой, остальные дают плюшки, которые были у самих боссов) 
Из Рпг элементов только вхуй неясная прокачка, которая не совсем ясно, меняет ли вообще что-то, и какой-то лут который ты можешь собирать сразу в карман, либо, если шмотка круче твоей, в руку
Сюжет как бы неплох, но сейчас уже вышло столько игр, где все шутки, которые есть здесь были рассказаны и показаны лучше, что смотреть на них здесь не вызывает хохотача, ибо "баян, видел"
Конечно, для 2005 года, когда стебных игор было как максимум немного, это все очень хорошо, но сейчас как-то не вкатило 
Короче постарела игра вообще нормально, так что играть в неё сейчас тяжело, ибо быстро становится скучно
6/10, не плохо, но и не хорошо
Никак в общем
P,S, играл не 3 часа, а часов 12 в оффлайне

author: {'steamid': '76561198021551538', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1502022780}
review:
Difficult to give either a good or bad review but lets try

The game itself has good moments, the songs, the comedic moments during dialogue and foul language certainly give an entertaining side to this game, the spells are useful, wide arrange of weapons and armor, Open world allowing you to visit a wide range of locations, and very entertaining people to meet.

However thats the only good things i can say about the game.

The game itself is not actually difficult its just very very boring, The combat system is flawed, the bows in this game take far too long to shoot 1 arrow and they don't do great damage per shot making ranged weapons pretty much obsolete.

Not all weapons can be used until you unlock the talent for that weapon meaning unless you use a valuable talent on a weapon talent then you will be stuck with crappy low damage weapons.

The quests are very boring and lack any real interest to them, the story is barely a story its just your typical save the princess and the world kind of story.


If your looking for a game that lacks any real story or combat but has entertaining characters, this could be for you, but there are so many more better RPG's out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025204475', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1772, 'last_played': 1418500828}
review:
Not an awful port, but not a great one either. However, the wit and humor of the game more than makes up for it. 
While it's a bit dated and combat is fairly boring, what really makes the game worth it is the dialogue.
Any game willing to make fun of itself and RPG tropes in general is okay in my book. 

I've youre not one of those people willing to 'put up' with lackluster gameplay for the sake of story, you may want to pass this up though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007813436', 'num_games_owned': 1276, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2411, 'last_played': 1499629211}
review:
This is an awesome game, with singing and dancing.
It's made by Brian Fargo, what more can you ask!

The only bad points I've found is the dash mechanic often triggers while fighting and gets stuck charging it up even though you're not holding on to the mouse.
Also, the more you approach the end-game, the less checkpoints there are.
On the two last boss fights, if you die, you'll have to replay about half an hour of gameplay.

The very last boss, has a tower with 12 floors with no saves. You'll spend 30 mins killing everything on each floors (super boring) so you better not fail the boss, or regret your choice of ending.
I personally couldn't really choose the ending I wanted because I didn't like the idea of having to start that tower all over again.  Really really bad design, I have to assume they did that to make the game appear longer or something.

To be honest, I was going to thumb down the game just because of that, but then I remembered that this is an old game and it was made by Brian Fargo and the singing.. it's just fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049797376', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1988, 'last_played': 1509708650}

author: {'steamid': '76561198163321774', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1509394854}
review:
Yes it DOES work on Windows 10. Even on Creator's update. 
Not a bad port despite people's false preachings here. Supports resolutions up to 1440p.
Does not slow down for me, runs 100% fine. 
Controller mapping is fine but it's an older game so it'll have numbers instead of A B X Y and PS shapes. 
Keyboard & mouse is better for this game by far anyway. 


There's a lot of people thumbing this down as a bad port that doesn't work, but I'm inclined to believe there must be something they're doing wrong because it works flawlessly for me. 

Played this game's original PC port way back, still as hilarious as I remember it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067599618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1571519836}
review:
An enjoyable game that I originally played on the PS2, The Bards Tale takes place in your general fantasy world filled with various monsters and spell casters. However, it isn't the world that grabs my attention the most, rather it's the characters and their dialogue that interests me the most; all the dialogue feels interesting and most of it is quite witty and laced with appropriate amount of satire.

The main source of this enjoyment comes from our titular character: The Bard. He's no hero or noble knight, but he's a joy to play as for his banter that even when you're trying to be nice sounds a little sarcastic. You can customize him in a fairly diverse system, allocating stats and skills that will allow you to use various weapons and fighting styles to defeat your enemies as well as songs that summon various companions meant for offense, defense, or utility.

The story is intentionally generic but never dull and the combat can be a bit difficult, but with enough time and a little bit of luck you can pull through. Overall this is a fun game for me and while it's no masterpiece, it's definitely a good game for fans of fantasy games who enjoy a bit of dry wit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025511152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2377, 'last_played': 1497874380}
review:
This game was great! It had lots of references to various things from other stories/movies and such. And it had a lot of good humor. Also I enjoyed the songs and the snarky wit of the Bard :)

Honestly if you are looking for an RPG game that pokes fun of RGP elements and lets you choose your ending this is the game for you. Hell just for the songs alone I recommend it!

The only two things I found frusterating was the rate of fire from the bow was pretty slow. So early on in the game the bow is harder to use as a result. Once you have the ability to summon more companions and tanks its a lot easier to use though.
The second thing was theres a part where you have to escort something and theres non stop respawns....That was a tad frustrating :/

Still I give this game a solid 11 out of 10 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198219220485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2524, 'last_played': 1626493306}
review: I originally got this game for the PS2 and when I found it on Steam I literally jumped on it. One of my cousin recommended that I check this game out and so I hunted it down, able to find it in another state. As for the Steam Version it like the Hard Copy and I love that. It is enjoyable that I can play it on the computer when I am away from from my PS2. The Bard's Tale has a rich story with the Bard as the Hero (or just the only person dumb enough to take on the quest) keeping with the personality of a Bard. They are more than just merry singers entertaining for a few coin, they are also the ones that end up becoming fodder most the time. If you like a good story line in a game, with characters that make you laugh or ask yourself what you just witnessed then this is the type of game for you. Your choices in the game make for an interesting story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998568769', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 818, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1492279789}
review: I suppose I can recommend this one, though it's not a particularly strong recommendation. It took me a while to get into the game, and I found this "kill the bugbear" sidequest at the very beginning basically impossible. However, soon afterwards you begin to acquire summons at a decent rate, and begin to specialize in a weapon type and take a few "feats" or "perks" to maximize your effectiveness (maybe increasing critical chance or giving a weapon an alternate attack). I did enjoy some of the humor (interacting with and understanding MacRath, a heavily-accented Scotsman, was the funniest part to me), and I was curious to see just which summons made the most effective counterpart to my playstyle and what lay around the next corner. However, it's an old game, and it shows. The graphics and gameplay are both not ideal - the resolution seems a little too low (I was often shooting at offscreen enemies with my bow), and there was an odd chugging and slowdown in certain places in the game. The game also crashed three times for me, though I was able to progress on my second attempt through the area. However, I did feel compelled to play and finish. if you'd like to try something a little older and off the beaten path with more unique humor than most, give it a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067797668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1488680905}
review:
После прохождения Wasteland 2 решил посмотреть чего там еще интересного разрабатывала студия InXile и вот собственно приобрел The Bard's Tale.

Если бы я играл в нее в 2005, то точно был бы в восторге. Хотя игра и представляет собой типичный для тех времен игровой концепт, тут присутствуют клевые заимствования из других популярных на тот момент игр, а также собственные неплохие идеи.  Например главный герой может и мечом помахать, а может призвать на помощь миниона или применить спец атаку побежденного ранее босса (Ничего не напоминает?)
Но самая главная особенность игры в ее сюжете и повествовании. Никто не любит главного героя, включая закадрогого рассказчика, с которым, кстати все время возникают остроумные перепалки. Вообще - остроумные моменты и диалоги это то, что может удержать вас за этой игрой. Также, создатели ловко простебались над многими игровыми клише, так что в принципе скучно не будет. Если конечно не бегать и не лупить мобов, это тут реализовано действительно убого ))

Вообщем - просто, качественно, с юмором

author: {'steamid': '76561198134795677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1488994686}
review: Love the Game just started recording it for youtube as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035185044', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1377148192}
review:
Maybe it's nostalgia talking but the original Bard's Tale was a masterpiece.  This modern version felt like it lacked soul.  The dialogue often fell flat and the gameplay felt pretty shallow.  Maybe its a product of comparing it to my memories of playing the original but this just didn't satisfy me.  

If you've never played the original maybe this will be fun for you.  I would suggest that the game actually needs to be approached with a goody along for the ride mindset.  If you are looking for a game in the RPG style without much complexity, which is full of mockery of the genre and some bawdy jokes, this  might be for you.  If you want an actually engaging RPG experience, you should probably pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067195264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1487152093}
review:
There are a few things I liked about this game:
[list]
[*]Some lines and scenarios are witty and well done
[*]Several summons to use, and it's fun to try them
[*]Controls are easy to pick up
[/list]
 
Unfortunately, one main thing made this game tedious to play through:
[b] Repetitiveness [/b]
[list]
[*]A lot of the time I ended up standing for a while sniping enemies since I would find myself quickly surrounded and dead if I didn't
[*]I tried running away from enemies and still racked up quite a long play time due to falling and dying so often, so I don't recommend that either.
[*]You are required to revisit several maps at least twice (This doesn't seem bad, but backtracking takes so long it becomes extremely tedious)

There are a few other things such as being unable to skip the long healing animation, bizarre sounds for monsters and repeated lines, but those issues pale in comparison to the problem of repetitiveness.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979151581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1615197471}
review:
I bought this game on disc when it first came out, haven't done much with the Steam version. Still, worth a recommendation. It used to be my favorite game due to the humor- its tone, its pervasiveness, its wryness. It's a sorta 4th-wall-breaking scenario except your protagonist badmouths the narrator rather than you... though there's an awareness that the narrator is narrating to the player. It was a great game when I'd had my fill of the fantasy genre and its tropes and wanted something to lampoon it while still simultaneously indulging in it. It explores the "anti-hero" theme to the utmost: no game has done it better. Call it a hidden gem.

Pro:
- Humor, as I said. I suppose it's not for everyone, but it still lends a heap of charm. "You're the Chosen One, Mr. Bar-!" "If you mention 'Chosen One' one more time I'll rip your tongue out!" The game comes with an "outtakes" section of pretend-muckups... funny stuff...
- Voice acting is great. They got the lead actor from "Princess Bride" to do The Bard (though it sounds more cocky than him IMO), but the supporting actors are ALL very fun to listen to- from the narrator to the various NPCs and monsters. The accents are sometimes a bit off, but they're all good and full of character.
- Lots of creative ideas went into the narrative and gameplay throughout most of the game (one con mentioned below) with a nice variety of enemies and scenarios.
- Fun progression system using both attributes and attribute-enhancing collectibles found throughout the game.
- Unique summoning skill using songs to bring ally combos. Nice way of making a bard class interesting.
- The music. It's (predictably enough) not the epic-sounding type. Instead the memorable ones are all lyric-based and often happen in moments where breaking into song is kinda funny. The beer song right at the beginning is good as well (and references later gameplay).
- Good length. It's not epic length, not a quick adventure, just where it ought to be with the journey fairly well-paced as the story unfolds.
- Fun twist ending.
- Customizable keybindings. Plenty of big name games don't offer this...

Con:
- Top-down view. This changes for cutscenes, but regular gameplay is from nearly directly overhead the Bard. It's not even isometric: you can be looking straight ahead at something but be unable to see it because, well, the camera is fixed where it is. (Now you know what it's like being the enemy in so many games where your vision is worse than the player's character...)
- Difficulty (combat). This is a mixed bag, but I'll put it down in the Cons because... meh. I found the learning curve very steep (may just be me) because the starting melee skills are pretty limited. But then you try a bow and can cheese nearly every fight by simply shooting from slightly out of visual range... so guaranteed victory at the cost of boredom. Dual-wielding is the most fun, but also pretty cheesy with its built-in blocking move, 2-handed weapons maybe the best balanced. The morning star brings in challenge and looks kinda cool, but it's "challenge" is from it being such a slog of a weapon with a delivery that too often is too slow to keep you from taking hits while swinging. So my issue here is... well, poor balancing, I suppose: too hard at first, then too easy, or alternatively stupidly hard. Not that there aren't some interesting boss battles though... except one end boss that is way too difficult...
- Repetitiveness. A bit after halfway through the game it looks like the devs lost inspiration (or time/resources) and skipped to the end sequence to invest the rest of what they had into. Thus the first half and end fifth of the game are very fun, but that end-middle feels a bit rushed. Not that you'll note it as much on a first playthrough, but still. The secret areas you've been saving up much of the game to buy maps for turn out to be very similar to one another with the same joke and undead monsters you've seen elsewhere. It seems more like they just lost budget for it rather than intentionally added filler, however.
- Save points. This was particularly annoying as I never like this game mechanism. Maybe you will. I've been spoiled by save-anywhere games... 
- Limited replayability. You may want to delve back in to try a different main weapon, but not likely. The collectibles you miss aren't game-breakingly important. It's a fairly linear game. Difficulty levels involve reduced save points (the most annoying "challenge") and noticeably fewer starting points to invest in your attributes. I admit though I played it once on the hardest difficulty anyway... It's a fun game with a humor you may miss when it's over...

author: {'steamid': '76561198010737305', 'num_games_owned': 1997, 'num_reviews': 346, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1486431526}
review:
Three great classic games, they may not have aged well for some, but I'm still having a lot of fun with them. Most importantly you get the newest Bard's Tale, voiced by none other than the magnificent Cary Elwes. It makes fun of almost EVERY single rpg trope you'ver ever seen. 

*Very Tiny Spoiler* (This happens in the first couple minutes)
Always the rat problem to take care of in RPGs, eh? Well our "Hero" summons rats with his Bard skills to come in and play the Hero, rescuing the big bosomed damsel in distress.

Gameplay is good, graphics are damn decent for a game of this age, dialogue and story is hilarious. Must buy, if you ask me. This game alone could sell for 10 bucks, here you get this and the original oldschool games for 5. Or just buy Wastelands 2 directors cut and you get it for free :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198042947750', 'num_games_owned': 1045, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1509649351}
review:
我很後悔為什麼到2017年才玩這款遊戲，如果時間回到從前，我一定會在遊戲剛上市就買實體盒裝版回家玩，以現在的標準來衡量，這款除了畫面較舊以外，其實各方面都可以說是一款高水準的遊戲，特別是拿他跟國產糞作相比，就會發現國產遊戲落後國外十年不只。

Steam由於沒有支援中文，所以我是另外下盜版玩的，實際遊戲時間大約13個小時左右，全地圖跑完+3結局+全支線跑完。

首先談談畫面吧，基本上跟Dungeon Siege II是差不多的，以現今的眼光來說有點糟，特別是硬體提升後有點模糊，但不至於看不清或不能玩，但以當年的眼光來說，畫面也有中上水平。

再來談談配樂，我認為這款遊戲最大的亮點就是配樂。我並非覺得配樂好聽才玩這款遊戲的，甚至在玩這款遊戲之前我壓根沒聽過配樂，我是看劇情介紹屬於"反諷"、"惡搞"類型才想買來體驗的。但當我進行遊戲3分鐘和醉漢談話後聽到第一首Beer，我瞬間被驚艷了，我已經很久沒有被某款遊戲感到驚艷了，包含黑魂、巫師等大作玩久了都會有期望越高，雖不至於失望，但遊戲本身無法帶給你更多驚喜的感覺，只會覺得：喔，如果沒這個你敢稱大作嗎？
這種理所當然的想法，使得遊戲漸漸無法帶給我驚喜感，而這款當初特價只花2美元的遊戲，我起初把他當作一個休閒遊戲，但隨著遊戲時間拉長，我發現配樂這方面一點都不馬虎，甚至我能說一句，光是配樂就值2美元了，除了Beer還有Vikings、Nuckelavee、Chosen One等等，每首歌曲都能感受到作者的用心，除了唱歌還能配合場景融入，NPC還要一邊跳舞等等，光是這點我就敢說2016沒有任何國產遊戲辦得到。

劇情方面，我原本認為這類反諷、惡搞的遊戲，劇情應該是純搞笑、耍白癡之類的，但這其實只是劇情的一部分而已，除了具備幽默感外，傳統奇幻元素也沒有隨便帶過，唯一的缺點可能是劇情短了點，不過這點可以諒解，畢竟要一直加入反諷元素的話會比做一個傳統的奇幻故事還要困難許多。

遊戲性方面，因為有多結局+對話選項多，因此耐玩度還OK，旦角色本身技能較少有點可惜，但招喚物非常多，這點是值得玩家研究的地方。而難度方面即使你選了簡單，也別想過得太輕鬆，當你把它當作休閒遊戲的時候你已經離死不遠了...

總結：

時至今日，這款遊戲仍然可以推薦給喜歡歐美奇幻ARPG的玩家
但我更想推薦給各個國產遊戲公司的設計師們，在設計一款遊戲之前可以先好好體驗一下這款十多年前的遊戲，看看別人做遊戲是花了多少時間和心血，才敢把遊戲上架賣個中等價位，反觀國產遊戲往往頂著"國產"的光環，肆意在遊戲名稱上強姦"地下城"，隨便弄點劇情叫做"RPG"，打個廣告宣傳某某團隊的大作，而玩家買來往往發現耐玩度不高，遊戲時數不長，只有幾張還算精美的CG免強收藏，安慰自己這是國產大作，而實際上卻是一坨屎的東西...

author: {'steamid': '76561197994528184', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1572201100}
review:
버그가 좀 잦아서 아쉽지만 그런 부분만 빼면 재밌는 고전 명작입니다.

유머러스한 게임 분위기가 장점이라서 가볍게 하고 싶은 분들에게 추천드리고
액션성이나 진지한 스토리 같은 점을 기대하신다면 비추천합니다.

리마스터 이후 간단한 수정을 해줘야 한국어가 나옵니다.

수정방법:
우선 설치후 바즈테일을 한번 켜줍니다.
메뉴가 영어로 나오는것을 확인 한 후 메뉴에서 나가기를 선택해서 바즈테일을 끕니다.
steam폴더->steamapps폴더->appmanifest_41900.acf 파일을 메모장으로 열고 english부분을 koreana로 바꿔서 저장하고 메모장을 닫은 후 스팀을 껐다가 다시 켜고 바즈테일을 키십시오.
수정 후 스팀을 한번 껐다가 다시 켜는게 중요합니다.
바즈테일 grpahic settings를 실행하면 수정이 풀리니 주의하세요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154365131', 'num_games_owned': 1220, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1718, 'last_played': 1479756436}
review:
This game's humor isn't for everyone, but I enjoyed it. The gameplay works as a basic ARPG style but is kind of novel in its party/summoning system. The enemies and dungeons get pretty repetitive but it doesn't take overly long to complete.

I'd definitely recommend it, but don't think it has too much replayability. Saving before the end will let you see all three endings or you can actually purchase the cutscenes from the priests in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961417729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1577839093}
review:
Got this because of the old original version of Bards Tale.

Bards Tale 1&2 are amazing, just like I remember them. the first time I loaded them it was too fast, but the second time it was perfect. Kinda weird, but works good now! Love it.

bards Tale 3 on the other hand  - WTF is this crap???? Its so bad. I dont know what version or crap this is, looks like some college kids shareware version of 1/2. lol.

Anyways, got my original Bards Tale 1 in all its glory. Loving it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082474364', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1482614849}
review: Unfortunately I wasn't able to actually play this game.  I was really excited for it since I've read so many great things about it.  However, I run Ubuntu on my pc and there is evidently a graphics bug in the Linux version of this game.  Several people in the community hub complained about the same problem starting in at least Feb 2016, so I doubt the developer is making any attempt to correct the issue.....and so, I can't recommend this to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035675216', 'num_games_owned': 2110, 'num_reviews': 486, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1481417074}
review:
so the only bards tale i played was on playstation 2 and i loved it. the comedy and music were right up my alley. so when i saw this come to steam i had to grab it. sure its a little odd playing with keyboard until i can get my controller to work. not to mention once i get enough time to play through it and the others. 


so yes its an older game and it does have a different sense of humor so i just want to put that out there. that might stop some people from getting it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036656180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1510491901}
review:
Вполне интересный юмор (относительно). Но убивается затянутым и однообразным геймплеем.
Версия под линукс вообще можно сказать, что не рабочая.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046511205', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1480792734}
review: Неоднозначная игра. Отличный юмор, но при этом ужасная механика игры, делающая игру крайне сложной в прохождении. Однако я её всё равно порекомендую. Если будет возможность и желание, пройдите её, не пожалеете.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083382405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1708999505}
review: "The Bard's Tale" is a hack and slash with slight "magic" twist . I completed the ps2 version when i was younger and it was an unforgettable playthrough,

author: {'steamid': '76561198103658448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1549734645}
review:
I would certainly recommend this game. It is an absolute riot to play and the gameplay, albeit mediocre, is entertaining to keep the game fun in between the hilarious cutscenes and dialogue. Anyone with a good sense of humor would fun this game incredibly fun to play. 

Slight Spoilers:

The game is set in a medieval era magical world where a young bard is sent on a convulted adventure to save a woman. Pretty classic story, but the humourous cutscenes make it 110% better than most other games. The bard gets caught up in countless hijinks both in the main storyline and also in alternate missions througout the game. 

10/10 would spend an hour running into people just for a couple of funny cutscenes again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960329049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1540976016}
review: Old but gold. But its time for Bards Tale 4.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018628181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
This is one of me best games i´ve ever played, if not for it´s playability which is decent enough, because of the story, the characters (specially the Bard), the choices, the twists...and of course: the karaokes

I couldn´t stop laughing all game long. It kept surprising me untill the end and when i lost my hard copy when moving, i bought it again here.

It´s worth every cent spent on it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053964448', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2902, 'last_played': 1388971780}
review:
После 10-летнего перерыва с играми я получил бонусом к бэйку Wateland2 код к Bards Tale и меня затянуло. Интересный и незамысловатый сюжет. Английский язык в игре наполнен мертвыми словами, мне как любителю лингвистики это было интересно. 
Нормальная графика  (для меня, человека выросшего на Quake2 и Half Life), удобное управление и интерфейс, отличный геймплей.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032552314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1480175044}
review: Very funny game dashed with a bit of musical elements that the game gives subtitles to sing along. Bard is voiced by Cary Elwes of Princess Bride and Robin Hood:Men in Tights fame. It is a nightmare to control on keyboard and mouse. So if you can play it with a controller instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030865227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1542931952}
review: Have you heard about how fully this game is? -If you like obscure jokes, Mel Brooks type movies, bad puns, and horrible Dad jokes then this game is for you. If you are an older gamer like myself then this game definately will bring back memories. Younger gamers may find the jokes stale and the action unfullfilling though. I for one loved it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025821861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1677991215}
review: Lot of laughs playing the new tale, Looking back at the original games, I dont know how I played these. I remember the graphics were amazing at the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993793337', 'num_games_owned': 2354, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1356768000}
review:
Absolutely abyssmal.  It is supposed to involve humour, but the main character is a mysogynistic narcissist whose ramblings I simply could not bear to listen to.  He sounds almost as though programmed to trump what a president might say.

This 'game' looked nice, and was a remake of something I played decades ago, so should have ticked all the boxes for me as an RPG, but I could not stomach that disaster of a lead 'character'.

The only things that could make it worse are orange skin and bad hair.  Wait!...

author: {'steamid': '76561198022388297', 'num_games_owned': 1330, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1332658800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081193352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1481205964}
review: Apesar de um jogo antigo lançado para ps2, The Bard's Tale é um excelente rpg de ação, baseado nos livros de rpg. Historia muito divertida, graficos muto bons apesar da época e jogabilidade boa. Super recomendado pra quem gosta de rpgs e fantasia.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970800893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1510319985}
review: Die Grafik ist vielleicht nicht mehr ganz auf der Höhe der Zeit und der Humor mag Hardcorefans der klassischen Spielreihe auch sauer aufstoßen. Für mich ist The Bard´s Tale aber eine Rollenspielperle ungeahnten Ausmaßes. Seien es die absolut genialen Lieder oder Oliver Kalkofe als deutscher Sprecher (der anfangs noch etwas lahm wirt aber bald richtig auftaut), die dieses Spiel so besonders machen - trotz kleinerer Bugs kann ich es wirklich jedem absolut ans Herz legen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993919070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1352966400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007700244', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1375085848}
review: A funny and often overlooked portrayal of the common RPG that's seen little exposure over the years, a great but flawed classic that's in need of a bit of a modern touch up. (Note I've only really played two hours of it, but that's due to also having played through it a couple of times through on the PS2 version way back when. Hopefully will change that once I get it to run once more.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198319147171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1480203659}
review:
К сожалению пришлось поменять обзор с положительного на отрицательный. Сначала по старой памяти расхвалил игру, а потом оказалось что реализация под Linux багнутая настолько, что играть в нее невозможно.

Звук в видеороликах заедает, через некоторое время игры фпс падает до нескольких кадров и весь экран окрашивается в один цвет.

Сообщений об этих ошибках на форуме хватает, но похоже годы идут, а исправлять их не собираются. В общем спасибо за то что выкинул деньги на помойку.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198229231924', 'num_games_owned': 1565, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1475232243}
review:
The bards tale is a action comedy rpg, and the spiritual successor to the old school "bards tale" games.

The story of the game is as sterotypical as it gets. A princess is trapped in the top of the dark druid tower, and sealed there by an evil mage. Your task as the bard is to rescue her. However, the story is much more interesting than it sounds, as the game actively takes pokes at the sterotypical plot points of fairy tales and will take every chance it gets to mock the main character. From the main motivation of the character being the furthest thing from noble, to the many dead "chosen ones" who litter your path and who die pointlessly. 

The main gameplay is murdering dozens of enemies at a time with one of five types of weaponry. Two handed weapons, bows, sword and shield, sword and dirk, and flail and shield. Its really up to your tastes as to which one you use, personally i preferred the two handed weapon as it had the greatest damage. Then there are your summons, minions that follow you around and help you in battle. Each summon is drastically different from each other and serves a specific purpose, however, you can only summon one at the beginning, but you can upgrade to 4 slots by the end of the game. Typically, you need to carefully plan which summons you want to have out before going into any encounter, especially later on in the game when they can potentially deal more damage than you.

The game does not look pretty, it has no really unique looking characters aside for one or two exceptions and the soundtrack is pretty bare bones save for the few times you actually get to hear characters sing. These rare moments are the best part of the game, and had me laughing my ass off every time they came up. They are pretty spaced out, but if there were any more, it would be very annoying. 

It does have quite a few flaws though, the combat normally devolves into a button masher where fights can often be decided by how often the enemy randomly blocks and whether the AI decides to crowd around your character or just go after your summons. Though, it doesn't matter if your summons die, just that if you die, then the game is over. This can often result in you just running around in a circle while you resummon all of your minions, which is really dull. The boss battles in particular are extremely dull, since you can literally just sit back and let your summons do the work while occasionally shooting an arrow in there. The gameplay gets pretty repetitive after a few hours, by that point, the only real draw of the game is the comedy, which is pretty good, but its difficult to sell this game on that aspect alone. 

This game also had a very bad glitch of sorts as well, when i played it, i found the game extremely slow, and after getting stuck on a bit, i looked up a playthrough and saw how fast it was compared to mine. So i had to install an external mod that forced the game into windowed mode in order to restore the game to full speed. This was after i was an entire five hours into the game...

Bards tale is a decent, simple action rpg, but lacks any elements that make it genuinely fun to play aside from the comedy. I would recommend giving this game a try or looking up a video before buying this to see if you would enjoy the jokes in this before buying, because unless it gets a laugh out of you, there is literally no point for you to play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049667705', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2019, 'last_played': 1482259795}
review:
Нормальная игра, про нормального парня. Это только в сказках некий Избранный спасает принцессу, потому что он такой классный и избранный, а здесь таким быстро пускают стрелу в лоб. Насовсем. А принцесс спасать доводится тем, кто меньше всего в этом заинтересован... Ну, пока не предложат достойную награду. Потому что за кучу золота и саму принцессу в разных позах три раза в день, кхм, можно немного и потрудиться и головой рискнуть.

Ставлю 4,5 Бодба из 5. Снял половину Бодба, потому что безрукий и безногий. Иногда запинается и не реагирует на команды.

Игра, кстати, отлично запукается на современных конфигурациях и в высоком разрешении.

Однако, рекомендую я эту игру только самым терпеливым и увлекающимся, потому что проблем с управлением, дизайном уровней и сложностью очень много.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112937591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1964, 'last_played': 1472260229}
review: "The Bard's Tale" is a nice RPG game with lots of humor. The story is the driving part in this game. It's mocking the cliches in the fantasy genre. So, don't expect to play this game as a chivalry knight but as a half-drunk wisecracking bard. Even that he don't want any adventures, the adventure wants him. About the game-play, it's a simple, more casual type of RPG. The fights are little repeatable but enjoyable. The level design is little flat. Great voice acting and songs. Sadly, they added achievements, which means getting all of them can be little annoying.  But still, this is a good game, if you want just to relax. And to not forget to mention, that the original three "Bard's Tale" games from the Commodore era are included with an in-game emulator.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980652563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1326614400}
review: The graphics are old and the controls are wonky but you know what?  This game is a classic!  Top down dungeon crawling has always been a fun game style.  With game like Diablo and Baldurs Gate Dark Alliance there was just something missing from this genre.  And then it came to be, The Bard's Tale!  Of any comedic style dungeon crawler, this one will always bring sweet memories.  From the song of Beer to the dancing skeletons.  Nothing beats a good Bard's Tale.  FYI it is also the greatest class to be!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052309645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 1549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1549, 'last_played': 1472364965}
review:
With an awesome ideia, this title manages to bring some original elements to RPGs. Adding importance to music attracts me so much that I got hooked from the very begining. Everything has a pinch of comedy behind, making many parts of the game funny, even though the background history is not that original.

Through the game you'll sure notice that usability has not been on focus, like save points badly positioned, movements too slow (not only walking, but atacking, defending, conjuring and so on), lack of explanation of some mechanics (not really a problem for many games, but the kind of info that is missing and the way the game exposes things to you doesn`t get along with this point), and other things.

It should receive a positive recommendation, but there is one thing that hurts the game badly: too much useless scenarios. Too much walking that could be cut in half, too much useless "do this", "do that" and missions that doesn't make sense. Beyond the acceptable. I could've spent half the time and still had the same fun.

Sadly, this makes me want to give this game a negative recommendation. Still, I would recommend for RPG lovers.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198011309884', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1475424432}
review:
Несмотря на то что прошел ее до конца, отзыв будет в отрицательном виде. Я, как и почти все остальные покупатели данной игры в стиме, взяли ее из ностальческих чувств, ведь играли в нее примерно 2004х годах. Тогда я ее не прошел, и возможно тут и спрятана одна из причин:
1) Отвратительный лвл-дизайн локаций.
2) Пустые локации.
3) Деньги некуда тратить всю игру, за 20 часов пару раз добираешься до магазина, и не факт что купишь пушку лучше той, с которой ходишь.
4) Куча клонов как врагов, так и нпц.
5) Сомнительная боевая система. Удары блокируются рандомно, нет никакой системы. Спец удары бессмысленны, т.к. во время зарядки удара, тебе настучат по башке, а урон сомнителен и ситуативен.
6) Зачистка локаций вызывает зевоту, впрочем, как и любая другая дьябло-подобная игра.
7) Бессмысленные характеристики вроде харизмы и удачи, на которые по незнанию можно слить опыт впустую.

Ну и пара плюсов:
1) Система призывов
2) Повествование рассказчика и юмор.
Вывод: Если вы когда-то играли в игру, то можно взять и побегать пару уровней, пустив скупую слезу по траве зеленой, если никогда не играли – проходите мимо, она морально устарела.

review: This game is fantastic. The story is fun, witty, sarcastic and charming. The combat can be a little grindy but the charm of the game will keep you playing. The controls are simple and quests are just hysterical. The game has replay value because almost every interaction you have, has a different outcome on the path you take to completing the game. In short, the game simply tells a tale of a Bard.

review: I loved the original Bards Tale as a kid. Me and 2 other friends mapped and played it for hours (bundled in the game with 2 and 3 and wizardry 1 and 2). I tried to relive my nostalgia and I just don't have the time or patience. The Bards Tale game (newer one) is meh. I don't like it. I tried to create a save file for my Wizardry loads and it tries to load up my saves for my Bards Tale 1. I have tried to shift the save option dest/source disk settings to other options but the Wizardry games won't do anything. I'm sad I cant get into any of the bundled games, it was nice playing for a minute to remember what I used to call "good graphics" on my commodore 64.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013723081', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 365, 'playtime_forever': 1684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1684, 'last_played': 1474422212}
review:
First off, i feel this game is not good for young children. It could be played by 15 year olds and up. Also, this is not the orginal Bard's Tale game, this is the remake from 2004.

Ok, here are the pro's and con's for this game:

PROS:

`Humourous dialogue between narrater and the Bard
`Numerous quests and some side quests
`Lauging your butt off at the jokes
`Unlockable things in the menu, including art and songs
`Sung songs by the "Trow Trio"!
`It features the Original trio of games, but a warning about that "The games usually super fast, coppy, and only allow you to use keyboard on them."

CONS:

`Outdated graphics(it did not bother me, but some might not like it)
`Some jokes are told over and over again in different ways, which can get tiring if you play it for a long time
`Cliches
`Old trilogy is touchy and does not work all the time..
`Some grinding is required near the end of the game.

All in all, a great little game that features hilarious interaction between the narrator, the bard himself, and NPC's found all over the game.

Definetly Recommeneded!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015083820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1274, 'last_played': 1469466280}
review: I have mixed feelings about this game. The humor is great but that is counter balanced by the extremely repetitious and monotonous combat sequences. The combat sequences tend toward simply trying to overwhelm you with large masses of critters which you have to slay with little help and then often have to repeat in the next area and this goes on again and again throughout the game.  If it weren't for the really great quirky humor in this game I would simply have stopped playing it at some point. The humor is so funny though that I went to cheat mode and just ran through the game until I completed it, doing combat when there was no other choice. To sum it up this is a game you will buy for the unique sense of humor and cut scene dialog, and not for the highly unbalanced combat.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198142856511', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1590668199}
review:
[b]Introduction: Me and The Bard's Tale[/b]

I'll start by saying that this is one of my all-time favourite games. I have it both on Steam and on CD and I've played through it at least twice on both. I played through it on Steam in 2017 just before the achievements were released (perfect timing), and after that I lacked the motivation for another immediate playthrough and half of the achievements were also bugged to begin with. All of the achievements have since been fixed, and I completed my latest playthrough of the game on Olde School in May 2020, finally attaining 100% completion.

[b]The Bard's Tale[/b]

The Bard's Tale is from early 2000's, so the graphics are of course not the best. It's still quite visually pleasing and you should be fine unless you are a graphics snob. The game is played from a top-down perspective from start to finish. Although you would sometimes wish to see from a third person angle e.g. to see further away, top-down works surprisingly well most of the time. There are three different difficulty settings, but they mostly just affect the number of save points available throughout the game.

The fighting mechanics in The Bard's Tale divide opinions quite a lot. I for one like them because of their simplicity and because they don't require you to constantly give a 101% to survive a fight. You have a small collection of fighting styles: sword & board, two handed, dual wielding and ranged. These styles are quite nicely differentiated from each other and give you a bit of choice in which one/s you want to specialize in.

I've read that ranged is supposed to be one of the best styles to use in combat, but after my latest and first playthrough using bows almost exclusively, it has turned out to be one of my few gripes with the game. The Bard's Tale was released in 2004 with consoles in mind, and thus aim assist is very, very much present in the game. As a seasoned FPS player it hurts me infinitely to aim at something, only to have The Bard do an 90° flick to shoot the arrow in to a wall, just because there's a barrel behind it that's nearer than the enemy is. Ranged combat is on the other hand also a bit too powerful because you can shoot enemies that are off-screen, and thus easily thin down a huge group before getting closer. This is why I recommend melee combat and I do find it generally to be more fun.

The Bard's Tale is an ACTION role-playing game, so there isn't a whole lot of character customization à la D&D, for example. I personally like that, because you don't have to spend more time planning your character than playing the game (although planning is sometimes nice as well). You have six different stats and most of them will be maxed at the end of the game, as you get two points to raise them every level. You also have a list of talents (~feats) to choose from, and you get a new one every odd level. There are also tokens to collect in game that raise stats and provide additional benefits. I very much love the fact that overall, there's not too many items to collect and you don't have an inventory to manage, which in most games can be quite pesky.

Like in the Finnish national epic Kalevala, The Bard's magic stems from his music. He can summon between one and four allies simultaneously, depending on how good your instrument is. There are sixteen summons in the game (plus upgraded versions of them) and they are one of the core mechanics that make the game fun. You can make up many different party compositions that support different playstyles. Later in the game your summons tend to deal damage almost more efficiently than The Bard.

[b]Why should you play the game?[/b]

The things I haven't talked about yet is the story, the atmosphere and the all-around quirkiness and humour of the game. The game is not meant to be taken seriously as it doesn't even take itself seriously. You will notice from the get-go that what drives the game forward is the humoristic and sardonic demeanour of The Bard and The Narrator. The voice actors responsible for The Bard (Cary Elwes) and the game's Narrator (Tony Jay) are especially magnificent and lively.

All of the humorous lines are the framework that gives The Bard's Tale its unique identity and feel and that keeps the whole package intact. There are spoofs of general fantasy and RPG clichés and also a lot of quarrelling between the protagonist and the Narrator. There are also a bunch of fantastic songs that you get to hear throughout the game – most of them related to the story. The atmospheric sounds are also a very nice fit for the different levels in the game.

To sum up, just try the game out and see if you like it. It's worth playing through at least once if not for the gameplay, then for the story and the dialogues!


EDIT: Review completely rewritten on 28.5.2020

author: {'steamid': '76561198046102986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1148, 'last_played': 1637032733}
review:
If anyone could ask me to point to the funniest game I've ever played, instantly I'd point to this little obscure masterpiece of a game.

The Bard's Tale: A Quest for Coin and Cleavage is a rather unique sequel to the interactive novel series Bard's Tale, which revolved around a Bard with a magic lute going about saving the day. This technical third game in the series is relatively simple on the surface: top down 3D light Role-Playing Game with stats, unique weapons, and magic. Gameplay-wise, it's very simple: use weapons to kill monsters, get gold, level up, progress through the game, yadda yadda. A unique element the game has is the Song System, in which the Bard uses magical instruments to summon different helpers to either aid in battle, heal quickly, disable traps, locate treasures, light up dark places, and be good little arrow meat shields.

HOWEVER, the story and writing is really where this game shines. The premise is simple: guy gets chosen to rescue a princess from a wizard by disabling the barriers to her prison. The catch: the alleged 'hero' is probably one of the biggest ass-hats on the planet. When the subtitle of the game is 'A Quest for Coin and Cleavage', you know you're in for a treat. All the Bard cares about is getting rich and getting laid. The first mission of the game literally only occurs so Bard can get with a sexy barmaid! Oh, and that's not all. Throughout the entire course of the adventure, the player can make choices to either make the Bard seem like a decent human being or the biggest douche ever with the Naughty and Nice dialogue system. Be warned, depending on your choices with Naughty and Nice, certain quests may become either difficult or unavailable, but the humor is plenty. OH GODS ABOVE THE HUMOR!

The Bard's Tale's writing can be summed up in one word: Satire. The entire game's writing is satire on the fantasy and pretty much all RPG genres, making jabs at pretty much every turn. Example: the first mission in every fantasy games is the standard 'rats in the cellar' jazz. Bard's Tale has that, except the rat is the size of a house and breaths fire! You know how in fantasy games they play to the rule of the 'Chosen One' being the one who can save the day. There are a LOT of Chosen Ones in this game to the point it's a running gag. Oh, and need I mention that there are musical numbers around every turn, and they never stop being funny and catchy.

If all I've said hasn't convinced you to buy this game yet, then let me say one last thing: The Bard is voiced by Carry Elwes, Robin of Loxley and the Dread Pirate Roberts himself, and the cynical narrator is voiced by the late Tony Jay. And the two fight... a lot...

Anyway, if you're looking for a good fun game from the old days, then I highly recommend buying this gem. Or else ya must really be an anus!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2454, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 7097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1509412434}
review: Tries to be funny by breaking the 4th wall and with fart jokes. Isn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009093962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 284, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1457324858}
review:
A fun little romp in nostalgia, The Bard's Tale is a Diablo-esque action RPG that, instead of demons and a dark atmosphere, takes place in a relatively pleasant land where humor abounds.  As you venture through the game you'll encounter all manner of singing goblins, hilarious misunderstandings, and of course, your own personal bard who doesn't so much want to adventure as get laid.

Playing as an all around shady individual in a hilarious atmosphere is good fun but the majority of the mechanics in the game are noticably dated at this point.  I recommend the game for those who enjoy humorous stories that don't take themselves too seriously and for those who had a blast in old-school action RPGs (Baldur's Gate or Champions of Norrath on consoles come to mind).  I do not recommend it for people looking for anything groundbreaking in today's era or those looking for a game with complex mechanics.

A good game as long as you go into it expecting it to be what it is and not something more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134708941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 2331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1062, 'last_played': 1541649379}
review:
Совсем нечасто РПГ радуют нас действительно уникальным миром, с необычными расами и нестандартными возможностями. Наверное, все ужа давно привыкли и воспринимают как данное всех этих эльфов и орков, рыцарей и землевладельцев, фаерболы и магические артефакты. Но есть еще игры, которые могут удивить, захватить и покорить. И одна из них - это, конечно же, Bard's Tale. Очень вольный ремейк легендарной трилогии восьмидесятых не просто дарит игроку очередное приключение, но в первую очередь высмеивает все штампы и клише жанра, при этом развиваясь в весьма нестандартном сеттинге.
Вот о нем мы и поговорим в первую очередь. Наши приключени будут происходить на безымянной земле неизвестного мира, который, тем не менее, целиком и полностью основал на кельтской мифологии. Своеобразный жизненный уклад местных жителей, сказочные существа и типично английские народные песни - все это отсылает нас к фольклору англичан и шотландцев. Теперь, когда дано общее представление о мире, нужно и про главного героя обмолвиться.
А таковым выступает самый настоящий Бард. Наглый, циничный, думающий только о выгоде, любитель выпивки и девиц не самого тяжелого поведения - это один из самых харизматичных главных героев, за которых Вам приходилось играть. Его язык столь же остр как и его меч, а пустым обещаниям приключений он предпочтет звонкую монету.
Именно этот Бард становится избранником прекрасной принцессы, которую держит в заточении Колдун. Разумеется, Главному герою нужно ее освободить. Разумеется, все не так банально как кажется на первый взгляд, ибо сюжет полон пусть и не самых внезапных, но зато очень смешных поворотов. И да, предсказуемость с лихвой окупится тремя концовками, каждая из которых просто великолепна.
Что касается геймплея, то он столь же прост, сколь и необычен, ведь Бард по сути своей... Призыватель. Да-да, игрой на лютне он призывает различных существ, которые будут ему помогать. Например, Героиня отлично стреляет из арбалета, Взломщик вместо Вас попадет в ловушку (где его, например, проткнут десятки шипов), а Бегемот ворвется в самую гущу врагов, чтобы благополучно там подорваться. Но это не значит, что пока все эти ребята защищают главного героя, он будет скучать в сторонке. Нет уж. Меч/кистень/электрогитаротопор в руки - и ну кость супостатов направо и налево. Жаркие битвы будут чередоваться с сатирическими высказываниями и довольно "оптимичтисными" песнями, которые будут навевать на вас желание дернуть большую кружку старого доброго эля.
Bard's Tale красивая игра. Пусть локации в сути своей довольно однообразны, но это искупается всем остальным. Юмор,  саундтрек, боссы, непрерывный экшен и драйв - вот что делает эту игру шедевральной. У неё есть своя душа, открытая для любого игрока. А что может быть красивее?
10 Бодбов из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198131902493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1668429280}
review: Grew up on the original 3 games, I finished this game when it came out for the Playstation, but when I saw that the Steam release came with the original 3 stories, I had to pick it up. This is my all time favorite game franchise, and has been almost 30 years now! Can't wait for BardsTale IV to be released.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988428639', 'num_games_owned': 907, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1253, 'last_played': 1460065122}
review:
As soon as I played the demo, years ago, I knew I had to buy it, and so I did.

Even though I do not know why exactly I waited years to play it, I found this game to be absolutely brilliant, fullfilling all fun and sarcasm present in the demo, and delivering it in spades. There are so many single moments in this game I bloody loved, but I won't spoil it for you. If you're concerned about the graphics (it's still a 2004 game), you should absolutely look past the aesthetics and do yourself a favour playing this. You won't regret it.

It even comes with the original 3 games, developed for Apple II. Absolutely amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030770625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1557672001}
review:
Un grand jeu!

C'est toujours un plaisir de se relancer dans l'aventure et de diriger le barde. Un homme choisi bien malgré lui comme héros d'une histoire alors qu'il n'avait absolument rien demandé. Un musicien-guerrier vraiment particulier car uniquement intéressé par les paires de nibards proéminentes, la bibine et les thunes. 
Le restant, il en a strictement rien à cirer le barde. L'aventure il s'en tape, cogner du vilain ça le saoûle, sauver des innocents c'est le cadet de ses soucis et alors nettoyer des dungeons remplis d'infâmes engeances, franchement... il s'en fout royalement. Mais bon, il se peut qu'il y ait un trésor ou une belle femme au bout du périple alors... dans le doute...

Les dialogues entre le narrateur de l'histoire en voix-off et le barde sont vraiment excellents, et je me suis même rarement autant marré en jouant. Ils valent à eux seuls l'achat de ce titre selon moi et hissent The Bard's Tale au rang de titre unique. 

Un jeu à faire au moins une fois. 
Fonctionne parfaitement sous win 7 64bits, et sous les résolutions adéquates grâce au patch.

Du grand art! 

Un petit reproche cependant qui n'a pas été revu malgré la mise à jour, la caméra est trop proche du joueur. Sinon, rien à dire! Si vous le trouvez en solde, ajoutez-le à votre bibliothèque Steam! 

(Je l'ai en version boîte donc mon nombre d'heures Steam n'est pas exhaustif)

-- THX INXILE! Really good job! Great game! --

author: {'steamid': '76561198076339745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1458008864}
review:
The Bard's Tale... truly my all time favorite game.  Not this game, the original, I played it as a teenager on my Commdore 64.  If you were to try to play it today you'd not make it 5 minutes in.  I know this because as big a fan as I am of the game, I tried to play it and didn't make it 5 minutes in.  Yet I will always look back on it with great fondness as the first game to truly open another world for me to explore.

Is this Bard's Tale as good as the old one?  Who's to say really, it's a completely different game.  What I can tell you is that I found it quite a lot of fun to play and so extremely funny it had me LLOL.  (literally laughing out loud)  I waited for a sale and there's no question it was worth every penny I paid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165480472', 'num_games_owned': 1721, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1458745760}
review:
Fun game to play with nice humor, but I had hard time to get my game pad settings right. 
At level 7 I met a boss where as soon as I was still engaged in fight couldn't move without entering the quest menu. I had the problem all the time earlier too, but this was the first fight where I had to use more skill to kill him.

If your playing the game with mouse I think you should try it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011212291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1502243295}
review:
Too soon to tell. Just purchased Bard's Tale collection on a Steam sale. Graphics seem a little dated, but the humor is droll. Unfortunately, ran into navigation and control problems starting a new game cold wthout reading the Manual. Got my butt handed to me when the Giant Rat appeared after I killed the first little cellar rat. Fortunately I had Saved a chapter when I first entered the cellar.

I know, "when all else fails, read the #*@!?!" manual. Lesson re-learned, Manual now downloaded and printed.

Another review forthcoming when I have a little BT experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034980187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1492186432}
review:
Good game as I remember it, have yet to play the "Classic Content". I would Recommend it to "Old" and "New" fans, but; I'd say, it you do not like a Boarish, Crude, Sexist, Male Anti-Hero, Protagonist, then maybe it's not for you... but I'd at least can comfort you that Everyone, including the Narriator, seem to hate him, and the "4th Wall" jokes, seemingly over the top at times actually made me laugh, but the Dark Humor, and Lighter Humor of the Game is around the Misery and Hell the Bard has to go through to "Rescue", the "Princess" again no spoilers, but that makes me laugh... Good luck knowing you get what you sow, and literally the Endings all three are good, the "Neutral Ending, while semi-dark is kinda funny, and I loved the Dance off with the Zombies Vs Skeleton-Zombies (A.K.A., the "You Got Served" Scene), too funny and original. 


Story is great, actors are original, and your choices of "Snarky" or "Polite" at "Certain Points" of this game are ironically funny, again no spoilers... Would Recommend a Must Play Classic, even if outdated... Would Put it up there with Fable Classic and Fable Anniversarry Edition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010630138', 'num_games_owned': 3422, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1509106278}
review:
[quote=Narrator]Where were we... The Bard was making an ass of himself... And then... ah yes here it is...[/quote]

[table]
[tr][td][b]Audio[/b][/td]
[td]9/10[/td][/tr]
[tr][td][b]Graphics[/b][/td]
[td]7/10[/td][/tr]
[tr][td][b]Gameplay[/b][/td]
[td]8/10[/td][/tr]
[tr][td][b]Story[/b][/td]
[td]7/10[/td][/tr]
[tr][td][b]Time to beat[/b][/td]
[td]15hrs[/td][/tr]
[tr][td][h1]Summary[/h1][/td]
[td]8/10[/td][/tr]
[/table]

[h1]PROS[/h1]
[list]
[*] Graphics aged well
[*] Great songs and atmosphere
[*] Suprisingly good humour
[*] Intuitive, simple character development 
[*] A little plot twist
[*] Multiple endings
[/list]

[h1]CONS[/h1]
[list]
[*] Some bugs (not many, tho)
[*] Not very challenging
[*] Small replayability potential
[*] "Choices" that do not really influence anything
[/list]

[h1]STORY[/h1]
[spoiler]You play as a bard (or The Bard), whos only goal in life is to sleep with as many sexy women as possible. Unfortunately he becomes The Chosen One and is told to save the princesss, locked on the highest floor in a tower. You'll wander through several dangerous locations and fight with the most dangerous creatures in the world. Is it worth it? *looks at princess's big breasts* Hell yeah! [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198007197608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1354176000}
review:
I'll be the Devil's Advocate here and write a negative review. Please note that I'm ONLY reviewing the 2005 game Bard's Tale, NOT the classic games bundled with it.

The game itself is pretty meh. Yes, the game can be funny at times but coping with the poor controls and gameplay is not. If you didn't love this game when it first game out, and aren't looking to get the classic games, buy something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987388969', 'num_games_owned': 1728, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1452141759}
review: The Bard's Tale is another classic dungeon crawler, originally released in the mid 2000's. The story is about a Bard who is recruited on a quest to free a princess named, Caleigh. There are several different endings you can choose from, each with their own consequences and humorous rewards. There are several songs throughout the game which are memorable and still fun to listen to today. While graphically lacking by today's standards, The Bard's Tale is still a fun game to play.

review:
고전게임이라 지금 나오는 알피지겜에 비해 그래픽은 후질지 모르나 나름 성인지향적 위트가 섞인 괜찮은 게임이다.

문제라면 불편한 시점과 스토리성은 0지만 나레이터와 주인공의 유머덕에 충분히 즐길수 있는 게임이란거다.
