author: {'steamid': '76561198032029345', 'num_games_owned': 3657, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1509649753}
review:
[i]Zaśpiewam ja wam,
piosenkę o dzielnym bardzie,
co w cycki wpatrzony jak słup,
ale niech ktoś za skórę mu zajdzie,
ten martwy jest, ten już jest trup...
...a przynajmniej tak mówią.[/i]

Gra dla miłośników RPG potraktowana bardzo humorystycznie. Gra się bardzo lekko i przyjemnie, co rusz doświadczając nowych dziwnych przygód, które tylko chory mistrz gry mógł wymyślić. Epicka walka ze szczurem? Tylko tutaj. Jeśli oczekujecie poważnego RPG, to szybko zwijajcie manatki tu go nie znajdziecie. 

W wersji steam, gra nie posiada spolszczenia, co bardzo psuje nam Pol akom rozgrywkę, bo jest to jedno z najlepszych spolszczeń z tych jakie było mi dane doświadczyć. Grając w tę grę pierwszy raz miałem zawsze do kilku widzów, a jeden z kolegów to wręcz błagał mnie, abym nie grał bez niego:) Gra w wersji polskiej jest wyśmienita.  Wersja angielska tylko nieznacznie ustępuje wersji polskiej(Zauważcie, wersja Angielska USTĘPUJE wersji polskiej. Ile znacie takich przykładów?:)), w wersji EN to nie jest już to samo...ehh

Rodzaj rozgrywki, to hack&slash, z opcją przywoływania towarzyszy za pomocą instrumentu. Gra ma minimalistyczne opcje rozwoju naszego bohatera, uważacie, że Diablo ma prosty rozwój postaci? Tutaj jest to jeszcze 10-sięć razy prostsze. Maniacy grzebania w statach raczej się zawiodą. To samo tyczy się ekwipunku. W grze nie uświadczymy standardowego managera przedmiotów. Itemy lepsze od razu zastępują te gorsze, natomiast gorsze są spieniężane z automatu. Początkowo takie uproszczone rozwiązania dziwią, we wstępnej fazie rozgrywki nawet frustrują, aby w pewnym momencie wzbudzić salwę śmiechu podczas rozmowy Barda z Narratorem wyjaśniającej ten ewenement. Gra skupia się ewidentnie na rozgrywce i opowiadaniu historii, upraszczając całą resztę. Z perspektywy czasu, wiem, że takie rozwiązanie w tej grze jest odpowiednie, bo głównie liczy się tu fabuła i różne gagi humorystyczne, w trakcie gry nic nas nie rozprasza, a praktycznie brak rozwoju bohatera pozwala uniknąć zbędnych przestojów w rozgrywce. Twórcy bawią się z graczem, wyzywając go od wybrańców i tym podobnych, potrafią zastopować nagle rozgrywkę, aby skrzaty mogły nam odśpiewać dziwną piosenkę po czym zniknąć itp. Jeszcze wam mało? A co powiecie na taki klasyk jak gadający miecz? Gagów tego typu jest tutaj bez liku.

Gra w późniejszych etapach staje się całkiem wymagająca. Dobrze jest więc przemyśleć stopień trudności już na samym początku, bo potem już zmienić poziomu trudności się nie da. Na koniec dodam jeszcze, że mało jest gier które w życiu przeszedłem więcej niż raz, a jeszcze mniej takich w które grałem co najmniej trzy razy. Miło mi zatem oświadczyć, że w tą grę obecnie gram już czwarty raz. Oczywiście z nakładką języka polskiego na wersję steam. 

[b]PLUSY:
+ Bard i Narrator ( Historia o dwóch takich...)
+ Narrator i Bard ( Wersja PL: Borys Szyc jako bard i Piotr Fronczewski jako narrator)
+ Genialne spolszczenie łącznie z piosenkami
+ A nade wszystko humor i...piwo. Właściwie w tą grę powinno się grać tylko przy piwie:)

MINUSY:
- W późniejszej fazie rozgrywki zdarzają się nudniejsze momenty
- Grafika ma już swoje lata
- Brak wersji PL na steam
- Dla niektórych uproszczony rozwój bohatera.[/b]


[h1]OCENA:[/h1]
Wersja EN - 7/10
Wersja PL - 9/10

[h1]BONUS:[/h1]
Gameplay z Polskiej wersji:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rMN8B_jNNYQ&t=25s

Nominacja do nagrody "Owoc Miłości 2017"  - Po 14-nastu latach nowa aktualizacja:)

review:

the various skills you choose on level up allow you to change the way you attack your enemies

author: {'steamid': '76561197983806198', 'num_games_owned': 943, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1588495679}
review:
An action RPG where you play as Robert Downey Jr.
It has nothing to do with the first 3 Bard's Tale in both gameplay and story, it's still pretty decent. There's a wide range of summons and a fair amount of equipment to use that'll keep the gameplay interesting enough till the end. 
The game doesn't take itself seriously, the Bard always has a casual attitude a which I didn't like that much at the beggining but started to grow on me. The humor is hit&miss, I found maybe a few moments legitimately funny which is alright in an era where developers either think they're too grown up to put in a little life with their game and end up making grimdark garbage or either think that stuffing their games with ebin 9gag memes will make it hilarious.

The game also has some songs of pretty good quality, on top of that each summon is made through playing a bit of music with your instrument. That music changes with each instrument and as you learn upgraded versions of your summons it gets more and more elaborate, a really nice touch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032379371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1685567913}
review:
This game is old but gold. Its an interesting tale of some guy named Bard who became hero of his new tale. For me most enjoyable parts are a lot of humour, narrator and system where you rely on creatures that you can summon with your musical instrument. Story is pretty common but still fun, with a lot of mockings of modern fantasy settings and tropes. The only downside of this game that you cant get throught some game progress without grinding and btw you can easily level your Bard bad so the game will become unplayable so better use autoleveling. 

8 out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198191212223', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1618499244}
review:
Jogo bem feito, boa interface, jogabilidade e história incrivel (superou e muito minhas espectativas).
Recomendo, apesar de que poderiam haver algumas atualizações, joguei a versão de computador e a de Android, achei a jogabilidade melhor na plataforma Android.
-_-_-
Após remasterição: Os gráficos e jogabilidade melhoraram(controles, gamepad etc), bugs corrigidos.. Se ainda não jogou está esperando o que? Ótimo jogo!
Infelizmente no Linux há vários bugs mesmo tendo versão nativa, como não ser possível editar os controles, nem do teclado nem de controle, o personagem bugar andando para um lado infinitamente também, o que pode inviabilizar com que seja jogado de forma satisfatória, uma pena pois o jogo é bom.

Jogabilidade no windows/Linux: 7/4 (4 no linux devido aos bugs)
História:10
Trilha sonora:10
Gráficos:7

author: {'steamid': '76561198032636062', 'num_games_owned': 2816, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1444209346}
review:
Personal Rating: 0 of 10

I do understand that this is a very old game, looking at the dated graphics. We shall begin with the pros.

- This game has fully voiced dialogue
- Hilarious songs and dialogues (not your usual lame jokes)

And this is as much I can say for this game. The main reason for the low rating is mainly due to constant framerate drop (not entirely sure but the dialogue does not follow the subtitle) to the state where everything is in slow motion. Few reasons I could think of:

- Game does not support Windows 10
- Outdated engine
- Not compatible with ATi Radeon Graphics Card

(I have a decent machine that can run Battlefield 4 on Highest Setting)

And since this is a quite old game there are a few things you need to know before buying/playing too:

- Hit boxes are horrible (the sword clearly swings right pass the crate but it did not break)
- Voice dialogue are recorded poorly (sometimes it gets soft slightly)
- Controls are awkward because keyboard movement does not work sometimes (other actions are fine just WSAD)

And there is as far as I can comment too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026316931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 9198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5938, 'last_played': 1442264326}
review:
First, this is a review from The Bard's Tale, not the 3 originial bards tale 1-3 that come with the game. The Bards tale is  a lackluster, basic rpg that you will enjoy playing but doesn't have the depth, roleplaying aspect, nor versitily to be a good rpg. Most characters wind up exactly the same, the only difference is if you want to concentrate more on an archer character (recommended) or a melee character. 

You start off as The Bard, and like all rpgs you run into problems, have to fight monsters, visit stores and talk to people, and bla bla bla. Unlike some rpgs this game tries to keep the Bards Tale humor in it, with funny comments and happenings. Sadly this does not add to the gameplay or the depth of the game so instead of making the game better, all it does it make it a tad funnier. If i wanted funny i'd watch a comedy stand-up show. 

You can fight either with melee weapons or archery, and your main ability is to summon allies to help you in your quests. You really have no choice on your character build other than if you want to focus on melee or archery, all characters usually wind up with max summoning, luck, endurance, etc. Your real only choice is to have strength and use melee weapons/shields, or dexterity to use bows, and since bows seem to be vastly superior to melee choice, most just go with bows. You only have 1 line of bows to be skilled in, while if you focus on melee you have a variety of choices such as 2 handed, dual welding, weapon/shield, etc. If you pick bows, you just focus on bows and get better much easier. Plus bows let you attack out of range, bows are useful vs all foes in the game, and only bows are useful vs some foes in the game, making picking anything other than bows as your main attack ability wasteful. 

The maps are small, basic. The gameworld map overland map is small, not many locations, linear in nature, you do get a few extras while playing such as artifacts to use in combat, which sadly you won't use 99% of the game because it isn't a hard game especially with your summons. You can summon a variety of helpers to use, a few you will use a lot but many you won't even touch due to there not being a huge variety of combat gameplay that would need them. You can summon melee warriors, area-of-effect summons, distance attackers, plus support healers, light casters, etc. As you progress you can upgrade the summons once into better summons, but again you will find yourself simply using a half dozen or so summons all the time while the rest sit in the dusty closet never to be touched. You and your bow are the main force in combat so you'll have some melee fighters to hold off foes while you plink away at them, and a backup healer just in case. Thats about it.

Most fights, even boss fights just require you to smack them until dead, very little strategy nor difficulty. Some boss's i just blasted with arrows and my summons and they were dead in 10-20 seconds.. Not very difficult boss fights. There isn't really an inventory system, there isn't really a stat/skill system to vary your characters other than noted earlier, melee or archery. There isn't any crafting, not many secrets, not a huge store variety to buy stuff (you are given most of your gear as you play), and absolutely no replay value to the game at all. 

Lackluster graphics, gameplay, maps, and rpg elements make this game a nice buy when its on sale due to the inclusion of the original bards tale 1-3 games, plus the game isn't incredibly bad, but just make sure to pick it up on-sale so you can enjoy a basic so-so rpg game that you've seen 1000 times before, usually with better gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174670974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1673247142}
review:
SO. MUCH. FUN. Everyone needs this game. Everyone wants this game. They just don't know it yet. In The Bard's Tale, you play (you guessed it) the Bard. The bard is Chosen to go on a quest to rescue a princess from a tower controlled by a viscious ne'er-do-well. 
This plot is so out done that The Bard's Tale could have slipped into anonymity amongst the countless rpgs with the same plot line. However, this game stands out because the Bard is not the shining example of heroism and chivalry one has come to expect from the protagonists of this type of game. He's a scoundrel interested in only three things:  money, drink, and women (the princess offers all three in exchange for her freedom).
But the awesomeness doesn't end there. This game is ripe with bawdy, snarky humour and genre bashing. And don't get me started on the fourth wall breaks --the Narrator and the Bard constantly argue with each other. 
This is a third person game and the action controls are simple. Every time you level up you get stat points to put into the basic rpg categories. As a bard, you are able to summon creatures known as "tunes" that act as other party members under your control. Each tune has a unique ability that comes in handy. 
This is a great game with a great plot and a great playstyle. It's one of my all time favorites. 
P.S. Watch out for the chickens

review: I really wanted to like this game.  There is so much cleverness and wit here.  Great ideas.  The narrator and bard voices are well acted, but somehow it just falls flat.  The combat is annoying and repetitive.  And most of thde jokes, things that would be funny to describe simply aren't funny when they do them in this game.  Bugs and a general lack of polish don't help either.  All in all, brilliant ideas with execution just poor enough to sap away all the fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972584572', 'num_games_owned': 1620, 'num_reviews': 384, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1439172972}
review: A fun little (2004) action rpg. You play a bard and navigate (pretty) linear areas, use melee weapons, bows, and summons, and collect money to buy better gear. The best parts about the game are it's humor (it is actually pretty funny) and the freedom of combat options (depsite being only able to play one character). You level up abilities which in turn allows you to specialize in summoning, melee, bows, etc. Worth a play. Around 12-15 hours or so with one or two optional sidequests. Like I said, It is pretty linear, so dont expect Diablo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090879160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1487875995}
review:
I remember playing this game on the PS2 when I was little, and I thought it was among the most stupidly funny games I'd ever played. Having bought the PC version of it, I can say the same still applies, this game is still fun, BUT:

This game has an awkward camera that refuses to budge, it also boasts a rather brital combat system that thinking about it now, feels sort of like Overlord to me in the fact that the player character sucks at combat for a long time, leading to you being put in some truly crappy situations.

However, I still think that this game is worth the purchase for it's goofy humor, cliche story, and nice challenge. (Also, don't kill the horse on the burial mound, just don't do it.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064153655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 1960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1960, 'last_played': 1437264730}
review:
This was a fun tale. I especially liked the dialogues and how funny all the characters were, even those that seemed too serious.
 Take your instruments out, it's time to jam.

+) Good and funny story which also has just enough richness.
+) Easy mapping and puzzles.

-) Zoom in/out changes itself almost everytime.
-) The angle changing of maps makes the game play inconvenient.
-) It is hard to distinguish certain things from the map, such as chests. You have to open your eyes open, real wide, Haha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110802817', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1437250126}
review:
[h1]Моё дело - вино, женщины и песни . . .[/h1]

[b]Могу заметить в ней огромное количество плюсов:
+ Юмористический, нелинейный, интересный сюжет.
+ Отличная система прокачки персонажа.
+ Очень харизматичный главный герой.
+ Возможность выбора, который отчасти влияет на развитие квестов и концовку игры.
+ Великолепная оригинальная озвучка.
+ Приятная графика, а для своих лет просто отличная!
+ Огромное количество секретов.
+ Неплохой арсенал оружия, доспех, магии (некоторые из них нельзя купить, их можно только найти или получить за квест).
+ Пьянство! Много разных сортов алкогольных напитков, разные напитки дают разные плюшки!
+ Возможность иметь щенка. Он будет помогать вам в боях.
+ Кроме основных квестов есть множество дополнительных заданий, некоторые из них доступны только по определенному стечению обстоятельств.
+ Большое количество враждебных юнитов.
+ Огромное колличество вещей, выпадающих при разрушении объектов и убийстве персонажей.
+ Большое колличество локаций, также есть рандомные локации в режиме ПОХОЖДЕНИЙ.

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
- Ужасно неудобная камера и не самое комфортное управление.
- Странная система лута и экипировки.
- Весьма слабая сюжетная линия.
- Чересчур затянутая концовка.
- Немного однообразный геймплей.

[h1]. . . Хотя может, и нет: сначала женщины, а потом вино![/h1]

Оценка игре по 10-ти бальной шкале: 10/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198000245179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1441236330}
review:
Witty, entertaining and armed with one of the best plot-twists in video-game history, The Bard's Tale manages to keep up with many of the modern RPGs in spite of its age. 
Definitely recommended, although I suggest you play with the german dialogue if you know the language. The German voice actors did a tremendous job on this one. 

Now for the rating...
The first time I finished this game I was 12... And my rating at that time was a 9/10. I'm gonna listen to the kid of the past and stick with it.  

Tl;dr
9/10, darn awesome game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011546793', 'num_games_owned': 1147, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1674105207}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998775097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 1347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1435459958}
review:
...and thus ends the Bard's Tale.  This was a GREAT hidden gem, which I think a friend sent me.  In anycase it's been sitting in my game library for awhile so decided to play it.  It's a top down diablo adventure style game.  The game is decent and challenging and perhaps the only thing I didn't like about it was the top down view, it just took awhile to get use to.  The storyline and game play is very close to a Monty Python, Princess Bride, and Robin Hood Men in Tights.  It's just full of great derp.  The narrator, by Tony Jay brought the game to life.  The voice acting was wonderful and it was hard to put down.  

Just like Bard's that spin up a great story, The Bard's Tale tells a great story and it was really enjoyable..  I recommend it to anyone that needs a good smile brought to their face.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063386567', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1595882478}

author: {'steamid': '76561198105979486', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1435214223}
review:
[h1] Моё дело - вино, женщины и песни . . . [/h1]

В своё время The Bard's Tale обошёл меня стороной. И вот, спустя 10 лет после его выхода, мне всё-таки удалось пройти эту игру.

[table]
[tr]
[th] ПЛЮСЫ [/th]
[/tr]
[/table]

+ Необычное, авторски-книжное повествование истории
+ Очень харизматичный главный герой
+ Добротный юмор, которым пропитана вся игра: от начального до финального ролика
+ Возможность выбора, который отчасти влияет на развитие квестов и концовку игры
+ Великолепная оригинальная озвучка
+ Большое количество призываемых "компаньонов"
+ Неплохая рпг-составляющая
+ Песни, песни и ещё раз песни!

[table]
[tr]
[th] МИНУСЫ [/th]
[/tr]
[/table]

- Ужасно неудобная камера и не самое комфортное управление
- Странная система лута и экипировки
- Весьма слабая сюжетная линия
- Через чур затянутая концовка
- Немного однообразный геймплей

The Bard's Tale оставил двоякое впечатление.. Пожалуй, пройти эту игру стоит только ради главного героя с его искромётными репликами.

[i] Моя оценка: 7.1 из 10 [/i]

[h1] . . . Хотя может, и нет: сначала женщины, а потом вино! © [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198094929671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1179, 'last_played': 1434956662}
review:
This game is filled with humor. The Bard is vibrant and brought to life through banter with the narrator and other characters in the game. The character skills and attributes are similar to diablo 1, you can sort of choose how you want to play, as a tank, as an archer and some magic but in the end it comes down to being a tank. Unlike Diablo 1 it is not a game to be taken seriously, there are jokes and clever come backs around every corner. It took me about 20 hours to complete the game, there are a couple of things I missed but I don't really want to play through again to find them.
The bad things about the game are that it is an older game, the models are pretty low quality (you can't really zoom in on some of the characters ;), the engine doesn't "do" 1080 -that is you can see creatures freeze/activate in the corners of the screen on a larger monitor (lets you have a 1080 screen though), the game mechanics are basic and some things are missing (you can't buy everything you need (magic crystals for healing) to prepare for the final boss, no fast travel, you can't give advanced orders to your followers like tell one to stay back and heal -the healer always runs into the middle of things and gets killed).

I enjoyed this game and would recommend it to others!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045980480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1443711646}
review:
I bought this for The Bards Tale II: Desteny Knight

My dad purchased a commodore 64 when I was four years old, along with this game.
He spent hours upon hours moving one space and drawing it down on his graph paper. 
I was a cool kid and would fetch him beers while he mapped every square inch of the towns, dungeons, and forrests.

He made a character that was "mine" and would ask what to do when that characters turn came up. He even let me name him "foopicker"  <--- I was 4...

We spent so many hours having fun playing this RPG, it brought back a lot of memories when I seen it on the market.

Today, thirty years later, it's fathers day and I took my laptop over to my dad's house.  
I created a party and had him name one of the characters.
He choose "foopicker" and laughed then went to the other room as fast as his broken, old body could take him.

He returned with a weird smile on his face, in his hands was a dusty old shoe box that looked like time forgot about it.

When I opened it, it had his old graph paper maps, some barely visible. 

He then handed me a beer he got from the fridge, sat down, and we played this RPG together again, perhaps for the last time.


This is the power of The Bards Tale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012545565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1438075974}
review:
Windows 8 users, STAY AWAY from this game, it will crash and take your system with it. In case your wondering, I started the game, decided to play bt1, set up a party, entered the city, instantly got in to combat against kobols, and it instantly crashed!

OK, so, I tried the newer version of the game and it seems to be working, but am still dissapointed about the earlier games not working!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025724769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1289, 'last_played': 1390930276}
review:
I haven't played the originals that come with it yet, but even by itself, the remake was well worth the time I spent with it. At first I was a bit put off by the realization that the game is a musical, but I came to appreciate the songs after a while (they are relatively rare, if that worries you). A lot of the scene and cinematic pacing is very awkward from the slow camera pans, adding long pauses between lines of dialogue. This throws the voice acting off, but the lines are so well delivered that it hardly matters. And even that weirdness seemed to have its own charm by the end of the game. 

Frankly, it's nice to see a title that doesn't take itself so seriously. Despite that, and considering it was built for mobile originally (I think), the design and RPG systems are surprisingly robust. Graphically, the game looks dated, but takes very little getting used to, and the character models are still pretty solid. The game has charm where it counts. Considering it comes with the original trilogy, it's  a pretty good deal even at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103394360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1630433218}
review: If you are purchasing this for the original 3 games that were on the Apple IIe and Commedore 64, Don't purchase the game. Though the game is fun for the first 15 minutes. It locks up every fifteen minutes and you lose all progress from the last save. You find yourself not wanting to go adventure because you have to stay near the adventurer guild to save. Very disappointing since I really bought this game for the original games and nostalgia.  I will try play the Bards Tale IV just to see what that is like, but that is not the reason I bough it. So for now... I don't recommend the game, especially since i doubt they will debug a 1984 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987471006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1514, 'last_played': 1430582228}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198041944840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1605996080}
review:
The creators of The Bard's Tale (2004) said that they wanted to create something special and that's exactly what The Bard's Tale is. The game is something of a fractured fairy-tale and focuses more on poking fun at the fantasy/adventure/rpg genre than creating just another entry in the sea of fantasy rpgs. You play as The Bard (voiced by Cary Elwes) who is more interested in women, wine, and coin than adventuring. He uses his magic for his own personal gain. Being pulled into an adventure to save a damsel in distress and stop an evil sorcerer was the last thing on his mind. So of course... that's what happens. And so our story begins... The game serves more as a vessel for crude humor, snarky remarks, and breaking the 4th wall. This may not be for everybody but certain lines are bound to make you chuckle. As for the gameplay, it's not bad at all. The game is solid, simple, and different from most fantasy games. Rather than having convoluted tech trees and a long list of abilities, The Bard's Tale focuses on simple top-down combat and using summons. My main complaint is the repetitiveness of the combat. Some segments felt like they were there to pad the game time and give you more experience but gaining new summons and the occasional weapon upgrade help to keep things a bit more fresh. Overall, I had a lot of fun playing this game and enjoying some sharp wit and silly songs while exploring a unique Scottish fantasy setting. 

For those who are fans of the original games, the original Bard's Tale trilogy from the 80s now comes with this game. I haven't played them but I've heard that The Bard's Tale (2004) hardly resembles the original games. With 4 games in 1, this may be enough to hold you until the release of the newly kickstarted The Bard's Tale IV.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198126632263', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1434189255}
review:
Eine Mogelpackung ...
Wie so manch anderer habe ich mir dieses Spiel nicht wegen der neuen Version, sondern wegen der drei mitgelieferten Spiele, den Originalversionen Tales of the Unknown: Volume I – The Bard's Tale, The Bard's Tale II: The Destiny Knight und The Bard's Tale III: The Thief of Fate geholt - und diese drei lösen nur einen schwarzen Bildschirm UND anschließend den Crash des Steam-Klienten aus. Witzig ist's nicht, Spaß macht's so erst recht nicht - und das Schlimmste: dieses Problem besteht wohl seit Jahren und wurde niemals behoben!

Schade!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999725847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1612177737}
review:
After a year of making a bug report, there have been no updates or comments from the developer. This game is no longer maintained. Don't expect it to work in future versions of Mac OSX, or Windows (Windows 10 is supposed to be the "last" windows version, according to Microsoft, after which they will focus on maintaining the system only).

If you're buying this game because it supports Linux, don't. The audio/video codec used here is seriously bugged. The video/audio will play for a short while, pause, then play again--and I'm running this on an 4.0 Ghz 8-core system with 32G of RAM.  If you're in a quest, the audio playback is based on a timer, so you'll only hear half of what the other characters were trying to say, so the game is essentially unplayable.

If it weren't for this playback bug, it probably would be a good game. It's been over a year since I reported this bug. Since then I've built a new system with all new hardware, and upgraded my OS to 14.04.  The bug still exists for me-- you can expect it to also exist for you. You can also expect new bugs and compatibility issues to go unfixed that can surface with the release of new operating systems and video drivers.

I got this game for free when I bought Wasteland 2, which is a great game, and runs perfectly on Linux (in fact, it runs better in Linux than it does in Windows for me on my system).

author: {'steamid': '76561197964867567', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1431979710}
review: I remember looking forward to this game when it was announced, but now that I've gotten around to playing it . . . I find it wanting. Not because it's dated, but because I'm 18 hours into it and I've finally admitted to myself that I'm just not having fun. The writing is sometimes clever, particularly the bits that break the fourth wall with the Narrator, and the songs are well-done and quite funny. But it's not enough to keep me going through the bland hack and slash gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052628235', 'num_games_owned': 973, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1631, 'last_played': 1564441702}
review: Der Titel ist (bekannterweise) irreführend, weil das Spiel mit dem Klassiker von 1985 wenig gemeinsam hat. Aber der Humor, die Lieder und der schottische Akzent sind einfach köstlich - schon alleine die erste Quest ist eine Persiflage des Genres. Kurzweilige Unterhaltung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013328690', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1426447528}
review:
One of the best rpgs ever made. you don't have to now the forgotten realms or the prequels, you can pretty much just dive in and you WILL love it.

stellar writing, voice-acting and gameplay make for a grand game even today. yes the grafics are dated, but tbh. with a high enough resolution your eyes won't start bleeding. 

if you got just an inch of love for rpgs or great story-telling you gotta buy this pearl.

you will learn summoning diffrent allies: starting with a simple rat, a healing "witch", or a wartorn mercenary and and and. you got the choice between diffrent melee-weapons or bow (recommended).

there is also your usual rpg char-progression: every level you can spend 2 stat points, ever second level you get to pick a trait.

it's more the love to detail which makes this game: you get an "explorer" summon, which is basicaly an old man running around disarming traps for you (by walking into them..which is hillarious on it's own), now try walking into trap while you got him summond-> he's quite amused by that
the game is filled which such small little conversations, songs and the writing made me laugh my ass off more than once. 

definitly a must buy for adventure or rpg fans. 

some starting tips: go ranged, pick easy (which gives you more save-points and more initial starting attributes) and be nice to the dog.

review:
It's not the greatest, and it can get frustrating and a bit grindy from time to time, but it is fun.  Good voice acting, decent humor, moderate gameplay.

My biggest complaint is that I can't get BT 3 to work, as it keeps asking me for the character disk, which I don't have, considering I last played it on an Apple II back in the 80's.  I'm sure there's a work around, but I haven't looked yet.

Wait for a sale.

review: I first played this on the PS2 after playing Dark Alliance half expecting the cliche D&D adventure game, which is basically is with quite a bit of humor. The Bard is selfish, he breaks the fourth wall, he's sarcastic. It's all quite good. Combat can be a bit repetitive but it never dulled my experience. Would recommend to any adventure RPG fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042576053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1535805577}
review: So I played the original back in the day and yes this one is very, very different. Some people say it's unfunny but I disagree. For what it is the graphics are pretty nice and the story was worthy of a good comedic movie. It was also one of those games that took almost 10 years for the graphics cards and drivers to catch up and make the game playable. Overall a very simple game you can plow through in a matter of hours or couple of days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064314558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1425160030}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027368456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1424163564}
review:
It's all about the originals, 

The Bard's Tale I is a classic, and though (for me anyway) there are some sound glitches, honestly it's as good as I remember.

The new game is OK too, as some have mentioned the dialogue is witty and it's a solid game, though honestly I won't play it nearly as much as I will be revisiting the classics.  It's like a free newer game with 3 older ones you've been missing all these years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047117921', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1435147119}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006552939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1574, 'last_played': 1423109859}
review:
Despite the moan and groans of fans of the original(s), The Bard's Tale is great fun.  Sure, it's definitely ARPG rather than RPG and combat and inventory management have been simplified muchly..and sure the top-down view and controls won't be to everyone's liking, but it's made up for with witty, sardonic dialogue and narration and lots of things to do.  Of course, many won't appreciate the humour, but preview the start on youtube and see if it to your liking.

[b]Linux users:[/b] Sadly, it's a terrible port.  It is playable, but there's lots of reports of multiple problems.  The main one being large portions of the screen will turn white or yellow (sometimes bleeding out of a light source) and fps will drag in next-to-nothing.  None of the current proposed solutions appear to work and inXile have washed their hands of it.  Reloading is the only way to get around it (and it happened many tens of times in my playthrough).  I also found FMVs to slow and stutter (there's not that many of them though) and the original trilogy (that's included with the game) will CTD.

Despite this, I still played through the whole thing (including finishing all the side quests I could find) and would definitely recommend..just make sure you set the game to autosave!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014704153', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 2414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2414, 'last_played': 1422971222}
review:
This game is sort of alright.

Love the songs in this game.

That is probably the only thing going for it, the humour and awesome songs.

The controls, combat and camera are very clunky and awkward and the constant load screens are annoying as well. No inventory, little depth to the game and it becomes repetitive.

Though no inventory can be classed as a good thing especially if you're a hoarder who finds it hard to part with anything in case you need it later. Not so with this game, no need to sell anything, it is automatic, any loot you pick up whether it be wolf pelts, or jewels etc. immediately turn to silvers, the currency of this game. If you find a weapon more powerful then the equipped, it immediately equips it and turns the old into silvers. But it also means less depth and not really any choice of what you equip. Such as you would rather equip a faster sword that has less dmg, but nope it would equip the weapon does the most dmg. 

This game is also very linear and more like an action adventure game than an RPG. 

I like the main character he is rather snarky and selfish and not a typical save the world hero, which makes for a nice change. He's in it primarily for coin and booty.

But even so the fun songs become repetitive and don't vary much, always the same bad luck song with slight variation sung by trow. So 7 Trow songs and only 2, more unique songs that I came across and Iam very thorough in exploring so don't think I missed any.

Can't recommend this game for the humour alone does not make up for the negatives.

I  found it a bit too repetitive to recommend, I only kept playing as I hate leaving a game uncompleted and it was not so terrible that I couldn't stand playing and now that I completed it,  it's not a game Iam likely ever to play again. And to see the other ending I can just watch it on You Tube.
5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198085377999', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1510224958}
review:
Начнут с того, что эта игра - кусок дeрьма. И дело даже не в графике, хотя вместо ненужных портов на другие системы лучше бы улучшили графику. В начале игра словно заманивает вас: "смотри, у нас тут большие сиськи у сексапильной (единственной в деревне) цыпочки, а дальше еще будет круче", но нет, дальше все будет унылей - типичный развод для спeрматоксикозных школьников. 
Основные недостатки игры:
 [list]    
 [*] Управление. Кому в голову придет ходить персонажем с помощью мышки? Он ведь везде застревает. Да, разработчик догадался сделать стандартное управление WASD, но оно все равно отстойное. Бард и другие обитатели этой дeрьмовой игры вечно застревают где-либо, порой пытаются пройти сквозь невидимую стену.
 [*] Бесполезные помощники. Почему паук-молния никак не помогает в бою с первым босом Бука? Почему паук без особых усилий смог убить гигантскую крысу, но не может нанести урон всего лишь идиоту в медвежьем костюме? Что за хрeнь? Вы когда-нибудь пробовали бить электрический разряд? Знайте, вы слабаки. 
[*] Боевая система. Она просто отстойная. Удары медленные и неуклюжие, порой ваш меч проходит сквозь врага, не нанося ему урон, это очень плохо, потому что когда вы так мимо бьете враг вас атакует и нет возможности защититься; блок ставится хреново, вы всегда будите пропускать удары. От врагов невозможно быстро увернуться. Просто отстой. 
[*] Загрузки. О да, это одна из тех старых дeрьмовых игр, которые любят загружаться по любому поводу. И знаете, она чертовски долго грузится. Решили войти в маленькую хижину? Ждите 10 секунд. Захотели выйти? Ждите еще столько же. И чем больше локация, чем больше придется ждать. Если сложить все время ожидания загрузок, то выйдет куча времени, в котором вы просто смотрите надпись "Загрузка". 
 [*] Сохранения. Почему нельзя было сделать возможность сохраняться в любое время? Вы пришли к боссу, сохранились около входа и дошли до конца пещеры, где ждал вас противник и вы умерли. Загружаетесь, бежите снова в конец пещеры и умираете. Снова, снова и снова. О чем они вообще думали? Почему бы не поставить сохранялку прямо перед босом? Нет? Наxyй тогда эту игру.
[*] Камера. Позиция камеры очень неудобная, сложно сориентироваться где ты находишься и куда нужно идти.
[*] Локализация. Русская локализация, как всегда сосет. Они даже не стали заморачиваться со шрифтом, они просто взяли обычный Arial. Работа локализатора настолько никчемная и дeрьмовая, как и все остальное в этой стране. Делают гoвно и хотят получать за это деньги - нет, сожрите свое гoвно сами 1С.[/list]
Итог: корявое управление, неудобная боевая система, очень долгие загрузки.

На самом деле, идея юмористической фентезийной игры неплохая и мне она понравилась, но все ее недостатки делают эту игру почти неиграбельным куском собачьего дeрьма. И как у этой игры могло набраться столько положительного рейтинга? Люди, что не видели по-настоящему хороших игр?

author: {'steamid': '76561198088829107', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1428932631}
review: Kind of like an old school Bastion, and still very playable. Voice acting (for the main characters) is brilliant, while general sound design and music are very solid. Graphics are passable, especially for a fairly old game. Progression system is simple but allows you to customise your style of play a decent amount. There aren't too many items to be bought, which is a shame. Usually simply upgrading power and occasionally adding an elemental power. Runs very smoothly, no problems with the framerate. Keep in mind that this also comes with FOUR games, the entirety of the Bard series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055599776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1251, 'last_played': 1419756642}
review:
Probabilmente uno dei giochi più divertenti che abbia mai giocato: l'ho amato dal primo all'ultimo minuto!
Devo dire che il livello di difficoltà è stato abbastanza alto in quanto a differenza dei classici Hack & Slash, è meglio essere cauti nel scegliere il proprio gruppo, e quanti nemici combattere allo stesso tempo...il che è effettivamente giusto che sia, dato che il nostro protagonista è ben lungi da essere un grande eroe!
Comunque, a parte il dettaglio dei combattimenti, questo gioco ha avuto sopratutto una cosa che io ho sempre voluto vedere in un videogioco...la terza opzione. Chi ha finito il gioco, sà di cosa parlo.
Comunque, è un gioco che raccomando a chiunque abbia una buona conoscenza dell'inglese: peccato che non sia tradotto in multiple lingue (credo che non dovrebbe essere molto difficile in quanto non molte battute sono basate sui giochi di parole), il che avrebbe probabilmente dato anche un pò più di visibilità al gioco, che definitivamente merita questo ed altro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058953348', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1485859028}
review:
Xboxon ismertem meg a játékot, de sajnos nem igazán működött úgy, ahogy kellene neki. Most, hogy gépen játszom, eléggé csodálkozom, mivel egy elvileg gagyi játék furán szaggat egy kétmagos laptopon. Vagy a játék bibis, vagy valamit nem szeret a grafikus kártyán, de egy idő után rémesen idegesítővé teszi a játékmenetet.
Nagyon nagy kontra a játékban, hogy nincs zenéje és a hp töltés kicsit nyomingerül van megoldva.
Az alapötlet nagyon jó, tetszik a szarkasztikus már-már bunkó főhős és az egyéb humoros benyőgések.

Sajnos a lag probléma nem ritka, ezért csak piti összegért vegyétek.

SLOW MOTION BUG!!!

This game is an amazing example of good solid gameplay, perfect writing and a well executed concept. When friends ask for recommendations for fun or funny games, this is always at the top of the list. The interations between the Bard and the narrator are priceless. It may not look like I have a lot of time played, but i owned it on another platform and only repurchased it on steam to play it again.

why are you still reading this, you should be purchasing Bard's Tale now! Go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052284811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1418320939}
review:
He tenido que iniciar una partida para poder escribir la critica y me encontre con
la sorpresa que esta traducido al español. 

uno de los mejores juegos de Brian Fargo creador de fallout 1 y 2 y la  serie wasteland.
Te mueres de risa llevando al bardo.... el sentido del humor, la musica todo es genial.....
es un juego que debes jugar..... 
si tienes un dia apagado, triste o se te ha muerto el perro o te ha dejado la novia/o este es tu juego...
te reiras y olvidaras de tus problemas.... es lo que el doctor te receto para la depresion... risa y diversion.
y un humor con mala leche poniendo a parir a los juegos de rol.... no se puede pedir mas..... bueno si
puedes pero no te lo puedes permitir.... asi que deja de leer esta critica y compralo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982654788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1424648394}
review: I purchased this game primarily for the three original Bard's Tale games - which were favorites back in the days of my old C64.  However, I've been pleasantly surprised by newer version, even though it has little in common with the original series.  The Bard's Tale has a sharp wit and isn't afraid to lampoon traditional sword & sorcery RPG games in a most amusing fashion.  With Carey Elwes providing the voice of the Bard, the producers couldn't help but tip their hats to "The Princess Bride" at various points in the story.  While the game is hardly cutting edge in terms of game play or graphics, it is a breath of fresh air compared to much of the turgid and predictable fare found in fantasy gaming.  An overlooked gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095662367', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1799, 'last_played': 1549566158}
review:
Лично я играл в эту в возрасте 6-7 лет и дичайший восторг у меня вызывал система боя ,способность призывать в помощь себе всяких серьезных ребят ,сестема развития персонажа , графика ,и то что можно было с собой взять в путешествие собаку.Сейчас я переиграл, и ко всему, что было до этого ,добавился юмор.Чего только стоит осуждающий вашего ГГ закадровый голос,а ответы ГГ в его сторону ?ТРИ концовки!Как ни крути все отличные. А сейчас игры редко могут похвастаться одной хорошей концовкой.
+выбор тона ,в котором ты говоришь(грубый или уважительный), который встречается по всей игре,и хоть на концовку он никак не влияет ,но доставляет кучу лулзов когда ты говоришь: "Слышь ,г*вно гони бабки"-а тебе в ответ: "Хорошая шутка ,друг мой , я знаю что тебе ничего не надо" .
В общем и целом игра хороша ,хотя пару моментов были скучными, а еще парочка была непроходимыми и приходилось просто убегать.Хотя в этом я нашел свой особенный шарм.
Кароче пытаясь  найти что-то плохое я ничего не нашел и хоть игра по сути на 9ку
я ставлю 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198076540932', 'num_games_owned': 1223, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1825, 'last_played': 1415536025}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043065283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1785, 'last_played': 1344495600}
review:
Using the motor of Baldur's Gate, it lacks a bit a of large views. Besides that, the humour is really the masterpiece of that game. Some scenes are just hilarious. It also mocks the bad habit of "rpg" games like when our non-hero tells "WTF  ? Dropping a sword on a wolf ?". 
Gameplay as some nice ideas too.

Anyway, it could be a bit hard to understand if you are not used with Scottish accent, but playing without it would lost a lot of interest of that game

author: {'steamid': '76561198106648313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4385, 'last_played': 1511429122}
review:
I enjoyed the game from the very beginning till the very end and probably will replay it at least once sometime later to buy all the extras (funny songs and arts there) and find two last tunes. The game is short enough (about 20 to 25 hours of gameplay tops, and you level cap could be achieved easily) but very funny and costs every cent of its price. 

The strongest part of the game are its witty dialogues and excellent voicing, however the plot is not so bad too and jokes are good (and yes, I’m almost forty). Combat is simple, especially with a bow and easy mode (which affects only start attributes and number of save points, so don’t bother with harder difficulty). This game is really a game, not some kind of computer sport where you need huge guides on spell usage and skills allocation. Still, the summons are fun and efficient, the weapons are sparse but don't become obsolete too fast. You are free to experiment. Save points number and location are well chosen. Songs and music are awesome! I sing them under my nose now and then.

In short I like the game, the way it is designed, its gameplay and humour. If you are not combat-obsessed power gamer try it. If you are, still try it to for a change.

UPD: After three years I'm playing it again, ant it's still good. And I still use "Oh it's bad luck to be you" song as my ringtone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963624833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 86400}
review: This might be humorous to the <12 crowd.  To me it was inane and insultingly stupid.   No character progression.  Story lacks motive or interest.  The only challenge is fending off boredom as the repetitive click & wait combat grinds inevitably towards completion.  The game is horribly prolonged by long boring combat that simply takes a long time with no risk or challenge.  Levels are 1-track railroads.  No significant puzzle element.  No relationship at all to the original Bard's Tale series.  I don't understand why this has any positive reviews. Literally one of the worst games on steam.  Don't even buy it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033203249', 'num_games_owned': 1362, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1358668800}
review: Теоретически, игра могла бы быть хорошей, в ней присутствует неплохой юмор и дьяблоподобная механика, но... это ужасно, она глючит везде, геймплей кривой и косой, и чем дальше - тем хуже, если в начале еще играть можно, к середине игра превращается в борьбу с глюками, а сюжет в отстойник дуратских шуток. author: {'steamid': '76561198043767177', 'num_games_owned': 783, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1666, 'last_played': 1357200000}
review:
Gameplay ain't the best in the world, but this game doesn't shine in the way you play. The most glorious thing this game gives you is humor.  This game is do. Fucking. Hilarious. I can't even tell you how awesome it is being a dude who doesn't want to do anything but party, drink, and maybe score once in a blue moon. 

That doesn't mean it isn't fun as all hell to play, either. The gameplay is just lacking in originality and variety, but still fun. 

Conclusion: 7/10
If you're tolerant if stale fights in exchange for laughs, or just love comedy, this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115314564', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1537956023}
review: Данная игра для меня сейчас является ностальгией. Дело было давно,когда она вышла в 2004 году,я взял её у своего знакомого, она была вроде на 4 дисках или 6 в то не легкое время. Поиграв в неё я не мог оторваться первые часов 5 точно. Реплики рассказчика, полные искрометного юмора, его споры с самим Бардом — главная особенность игры, ее изюминка. Не хватит слов для описания столь совершенного создания. На то время для меня она казалась лучшей. Да и сейчас пробегая по сюжету вспоминаю те проведенные часы в то время.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021692037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1518459955}
review: Вы любите РПГ? А хороший качественный стеб над РПГ, с великолепным немного пошлым, немного черным, немного циничным чувством юмора? Если да- то вы просто обязаны поиграть в Приключения Барда. Простенький геймплей скорее в стиле hack-n-slash сочетается с гениальными диалогами и ситуациями, большую часть которых можно разбирать на цитаты. А ещё здесь есть ода ПИВУ и сиськи х)

author: {'steamid': '76561198138578369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3849, 'last_played': 1410684140}
review:
A highly underrated classic from the PS2/Xbox Era of gaming, The Bard's Tale offers challenging combat along with hilarious dialogue that will keep you lauging through out the entire quest for Coin, Clevage and Song. The Combat system is fairly similar to what's seen in the Fable games and offers many different ways to dispose of various threats to The Bard, you can chose to use a Sword and Shield for a balance of attack and defense, dual weilding to increase your Damage output or Two Handed for similar results. Or you can use a Flail to execute an unblockable attack, or you can summon allies through various songs you'll find through out the land and have them take care of your light work.

The Songs that play through out the game are not only hilarious but also very catchy, you'll no doubt find yourself singing at least one of them at some point after playing. Though there isn't much in the way of background music, the amusing and witty banter between the Narrator (Voiced by the late and Great Tony Jay) and The Bard (Voiced by Cary Elwes) is more than enough to make up for it. The humor is enhanced more if you're familiar with the various scottish folklore that inspired many of the monsters you encounter through out the game,


Graphic wise The Bard's Tale sports standard PS2/Xbox quality while not the most spectacular graphics by today's standards, at the time of the game's release they're not hard on the eyes either. All in all I recomend playing through this game at least once, I guarantee you'll end up laughing out loud numerous times and singing along to the games catchy musical numbers.


This version also comes with the original Bard's Tale games so you can experience  the classic games in addition to this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120624506', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1525981905}
review:
I've played RPG Games since I was 3 years old! I've played "Gothic", "Risen", the RPG Shooter Game "Hitman", and others.
These games don't need high graphics to be played. So does "The Bard's Tale"! It's an awesome RPG, even if doesn't have high graphics! 
I really like the storyline of this game and I like that you can choose which side to be on, what you can say in the NPC Chat, and other cool stuff. 
I really like and recommend this game !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004376257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1405269771}
review:
This breaks ground in that it marks the first time i have played a self parodying game. The graphics can be forgiven as its an older game, however the grinding slow story and game play cannot. The humor is forced though there are a few good chuckles so far. What is killing it for me is the clunky combat controls. All in all its a very generic hack and slash trying to pass itself off as clever. 

It may be that I haven’t given it enough of a chance or that its simply not my cup of tea. Some may like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991103051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1404557229}

I tried playing it but it just couldnt grab me. The combat is fairly lackluster and the humor just isn't really my cup of tea.

When its al said and done I just didnt have any drive to push through the combat and what I saw of the story to see if it gets any better later on. It might but Im not going to find out.

The dated graphics dont bother me but if thats important for you keep that in mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022820771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1409565977}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sa4JFE5bShk&list=PLTj9drPC92M2iXZVy0bCpf02SUE8zLaKG&index=2

The Bard's Tale is a comedy based action/adventure with RPG elements. 
The plot of the game is your sterotypical 'rescue the princess and live happily 
ever after' story, but with a comedic twist.  
Ironically, the game that centers around a Bard has a distinct lack 
of music, which does take away from the atmosphere somewhat.

Despite this being a game from 2005, graphically it does a good job
of keeping up with the times. Visually the only issue I noticed was 
as the game wasn't designed for 1920x1080, the overhead view was
lacking a bit in peripheral vision, making it difficult to see far ahead.

The level design does hint at its' age, and although it isn't bad,
and ties in well to the world map, it does harken back to ye old "05.
It does a good job of showing different atmospheres, but does get 
repetitive as you travel between the main towers of the game.  That 
combined with the limited combat makes for a stretched out feel, and
takes away from the enjoyment of gameplay. 

The UI is well done, and every object in the game has the potential 
for synergy with other objects.  One big plus is that unwanted loot 
is automatically changed to money, eliminating the need for constant 
return trips to merchants, or constant inventory management.  As a 
self-admitted loot whore, I found this to make the game stronger by 
playing around its' limitatons.

Overall, this game is well balanced, has a strong and entertaining story,
and while it may not be 'game of the year', it's a fun experience that
I can happily recommend.

For more details, see the linked video review, as this is a basic summary of what I cover in my video. 
Thanks for your viewership and support for more videos check click here. 

http://www.youtube.com/user/SocioPyscho

author: {'steamid': '76561197979609703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 14647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4896, 'last_played': 1703138400}
review: I remember people playing the original Bard's Tale, which is included but I did not play.  Rpgs have come a long way, suffice to say.  I don't know how much the new game relates to the original, but it was quite enjoyable.  The player controls a roguish bard who learns to summon allies.  The dialogue is funny and worth playing different ways just to see the different reactions.  Very good action rpg.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025303925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1468013263}
review: The humor in this game is a driving factor for why I play. It may be dated but the ease in which the story unfolds is akin to being sprawled out on a sofa next to a fire. It is an omage to simpler times in a modern package. The combat, however, doesn't suit the game type. What has historically been a multiplayer genre (pen and paper RPG) is now a single player experience with no ability for co-op fun. This alone hurts this game and ultimately prevents it from reaching 'Classic' status. Worth your money? Yes. Could it be better? Yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053536848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1413049495}

review: Ностальгия. Вспомнил 2006 год. Игра очень интересная есть и всякие призывные существа, разное оружие которе подходит под определённый тип врагов, хорошая музыка, интересные локации. Игра старовата но игра всё ещё интересно

review: Heyyo, the comedy is solid, the gameplay is fun and the storyline is decent! I recommend this for anyone who's a fan of Action/RPGs. It's even ported to smartphones via iOS and Android for fun on the go... definitely check this out since it's not an expensive game and it'll give you hours of entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073605605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1697275643}
review: UN TRES BON JEUX GRAFISME BIEN ON PEUX JOEUX AVEC LA MANETTES XBOX 360

author: {'steamid': '76561198039899950', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1500178698}
review:
This game sat dormant in my library for some time, as I assumed my craptop wouldn't be able to run it. However, to my surprise it runs beautifully. And now I regret that I didn't start playing it sooner, as it is one of the most funny and fun games I have played in a while. I haven't been able to put it down.

I have enjoyed the gameplay. I'm a fan of the action RPG type genre, and this fits that bill. The best part of the game is the humor. I find myself laughing at the dialogue, and the god-awful singing! Stitches.

I look forward to playing the rest of this game, and hope the remainder of the chapters are just as enjoyable as the first!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056594265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1573539691}
review: Played this game years ago and I'm happy to do so again...full of humor...albeit to some it may be a little crass, as it is filled with 'certain' inuendos...so I do not recomend it to younger players as they might not 'get it'....that aside, this is one of those games that I thoroughly enjoyed playing and am looking forward to playing again....a great mix of humor and adventure....although this is an older game and the graphics are not as up to date as some of the newer releases, it is still an enjoyable and enteraining game to play...my rating?.....7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996899722', 'num_games_owned': 1436, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 7563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1411, 'last_played': 1407115053}
review:
There are very few games I play through more than once.   There are even fewer RPGs.  This is one of them.  With the amazing vocal talents, excellent music, laugh-out-loud funny comments, asides, and conversations, this game will forever give me a smile.   

As with the majority of RPGs, you're a low-level schmo who gets 'invited' to partake on an ever-expanding adventure where you ascend the level tree, getting bigger weapons, fighting bigger monsters, and eventually get the girl, and live happily ever after.  Except in this case, the game shows that things aren't quite peachy, and seem to go downhill, rather than up.   

The game shows you the wonderful side-effects of your murderous misanthropy, as you gaily stab, shoot and zap your way across a beautiful scottish and norse-themed fantasy land... Whether you follow the plot, or try to deviate from it, the wonderful writing keeps you amused, and on your toes, guiding you in the right direction at all times.

There's a LOT in this game, although it sometimes doesn't feel that way.   The level-grinders will find a lot to keep them amused, the magic-lovers, the archers, the swordsmen, will all find that the balance is quite nice (although I think the bow may be slightly under-powered compared to the sword, but only by a fraction, and the ability to sit out of the action and pepper opponents with arrows is fun enough.).  I've played this through as both sword and bow, and both are very playable.  

I can heartily recommend this to anyone who likes a good old-fashioned RPG, but wants something with its tongue firmly wedged in its cheek.    Wonderful on both PC and android, it's a great game for whiling away the hours.  

The voice acting of the wonderful Tony Jay will forever be missed.  His voice lives on in all the games and TV media he did.  You should play this, just to hear his wry humour and phenomenal voice.  

Thanks  InXile! You've made an old-fashioned RPGer very happy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078815782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1394903666}
review:
Questo gioco è un vero capolavoro dall'inizio alla fine. Benchè non abbia un sistema di gioco così innovativo ha una trama condita da ottime battute e ricca di episodi divertenti. 
Peccato non ci sia una traduzione in italiano, ne varrebbe veramente la pena. 
Consigliato agli amanti dei giochi di ruolo che conoscono bene l'inglese.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007900673', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1399736746}
review:
Перед тем как написать обзор, не знал ставить ли этой игре плюс или минус. Проиграл в нее прилично (так и не закончив) и больше не планирую возвращаться к ней. Попалась игра в бандле. Своих денег она в принципе стоит. 
Игра оставила очень смешанные чувства. С одной стороны неплохой сюжет и юмор. С другой, тухлая графика (даже для 2005), однообразность, неинтересная прокачка и не особо увлекательный геймплей. Сначала игра понравилась, но вскоре ее однообразность свела меня с ума. Сразу становится ясно, что у разработчиков не было много денег на ее разработку, хотя игра далеко не Trash. Если вам нравится жанр hack&slash или rpg от третьего лица, то вполне может понравиться. 
Оценка: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064586532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1408213842}
review:
The game looks interesting and promising.
But quickly you realized that such gameplay gets boring. Quest and acting from a point on repeats and loolks like the previous one.
You can easily get killed by anything. 
You can't contol your company and give orders and separatives instruction to any of them. Its just a crowed that follows you and shoots enemies or heals you.
Save sytem not fit to such games. An rpg much have free saves anytime.

The hero its funny. Enviroment and dialoques are well made but this isn't enough.
Sometimes oldies are not goldies.

review: I had never heard of this game before it simply popped up in my library after supporting the early access version of Wasteland 2. I'm really looking forward to the release version of W2 because I am a huge fan of games like Fallout 2, Dragon Age: Origins, etc, etc. To sum it up, I like crpgs. This game, however, I did not like because of its very simplistic loot, skill and combat mechanics. The humour in the game is crude which I can appreaciate for a while until it gets repetetive and stale. The game is not really worth your time no matter the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999346443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2255, 'last_played': 1405202024}
review:
Top-down view RPG-lite, more of an action-adventure, I suppose - one of those titles that focuses more on the characters and story rather than loot, combat, or game mechanics in general.

That is not to say it abandons game mechanics completely - just simplifies them compared to more mainstream RPGs (especially "western", as opposed to JRPGs).

However, in the story department - it excels, with witty, humorous writing (it's essentially a parody/spoof of fantasy RPG games) and superb voice acting (at least in English version). Well worth playing just for that! And you'd be surprised how much is based on real world mythology and places.

There are essentially two main characters in the game - the eponymous Bard, whose misadventures you follow and whom you control directly, and The Narrator, who holds the Bard in great contempt, never failing to throw in some sarcastic commentary. There's fourth wall to be broken for sure, and generally the game does instill this idea that it is a tale, sort of reenactment you're witnessing, rather than directly participating in, at least that's how it worked for me - I would place myself, perhaps paradoxically, more next to The Narrator, who's spinning the tale, rather than the Bard, who's living (reliving?) it.

The story mostly revolves around Bard being [i]a[/i] Chosen One, enduring trials and tribulations to save a princess, although his motives are clear: coin and cleavage, and definitely [i]not[/i] saving the world. Which rapidly enters worse and worse state. Which may or may not be related to Bard's questing around. Nothing really to dwell on much, you're here pretty much to enjoy the ride.

I finished it on hard difficulty, but I wouldn't really bother if I were you, it only serves as annoyance really rather than a proper challenge, and everything can be easily cheesed anyway, with you shooting offscreen enemies with bows, minmaxing dexterity and rhythm (as a bard, you can summon variety of allies and rhythm makes them stronger), so playing it easy just lets you enjoy the ride more.

If you're unaware, it's well worth pointing out that none other than Brian Fargo is behind this game, one of industry titans (does Fallout ring a bell? something he was personally responsible for, not mentioning other great titles he was more or less involved with, and most recently, Kickstarter backed great promises of Torment and Wasteland 2). You really should cast away any doubts with regard to writing quality this game has to offer (mind though, again, it's not a "serious" title, and not big one either, giving off somewhat indie, passion project vibe rather than triple-A vibe Interplay could muster and inXile not so much, at least until Kickstarter and ever growing technological advances.. but I digress; look the guy up on Wikipedia if you don't know who he is).

[i]Oh, it's bad luck to be you.
A chosen one of many isn't new
When you think you're full of luck
in the bullocks you'll get struck
Oh, it's bad luck to be you.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198045987644', 'num_games_owned': 686, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 4631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3366, 'last_played': 1406418691}
review:
~~~To make a small clarification for people who might not know~~~
This game does include all three text-based Bard's Tale games from the 80s but that isn't all, the game you see screenshots of is the "sequel" made in 2004 by a different company that never actually owned any rights to the original games. Hence it's not really a sequel. This short lil review is about the 2004 edition.




Jesus fucking Christ it's been so long since I played this game last. On my long-gone PS2 the week it came out in 2004. Got it from one of my best friends not long ago, haven't played anything else since. Playing it as a kid was amazing, but I can't begin to describe how much fun I'm having now that I'm older, understand sexual jokes and implications, and know what the heck the 4th wall is.

This game is a gemstone among PS2 games, and having it re-amped in HD on my PC is beyond amazing.

If you played this even once as a child, getting it now is like giving your childhood memories multiple orgasms, but even if you never did, it's a game definitely worth playing. More suggested and recommended than any other game I've played <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198087922049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1828, 'last_played': 1457391139}
review:
The Bard's Tale is not for everyone. The humour is most similar to Mel Brooks, a director of parody films that not everyone finds funny. On the other hand, I do. It has Cary Elwes (Wesley from Princess Bride) as the Bard's voice, and Tony Jay (Megabyte from ReBoot) as the narrator and the two have a charming back-and-forth. The game is routinely funny and though the gameplay is nothing new it does add some interesting bits you won't see in most game, ex: FLAILS.

It's not without it's flaws, the soundtrack is meh, which is sad for a game starring a musician, and the animations are as dated as ever, as well as having some issues with controls. I myself dislike top-down RPG format, but this game does it competently enough that even anti-fans may enjoy it. Its graphics seem dated in environment textures, but the character designs are still pleasing to the eye. Granted, the game can slow to a crawl sometimes and gets somewhat repetitive, but overall the humour and the gameplay gets the job done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067367945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1666547760}
review:
Данная игра для меня сейчас является ностальгией. 

Дело было давно,когда она вышла в 2004 году,я взял её у своего знакомого, она была вроде на 4 дисках или 6 в то не легкое время. Поиграв в неё я не мог оторваться первые часов 5 точно. Реплики рассказчика, полные искрометного юмора, его споры с самим Бардом — главная особенность игры, ее изюминка. Не хватит слов для описания столь совершенного создания. На то врем для меня она казалась лучшей. Да и сейчас пробегая по сюжету вспоминаю те проведенные часы в то время.

review: Classic. A very nice game, the story is interesting, full of humour and songs. The gameplay is repetative, enemies are strong and usually there are many of them, but the story really worth it and several bugs can make battles easier (sometimes enemies just stand in a corner without casting spells or attacking). If you are going to buy this game - don't expect really interesting gameplay features, but I'm almost 100% sure that you will sing songs along with the NPCs and laugh at dialogs between characters or narrator's comments.
