author: {'steamid': '76561197967154991', 'num_games_owned': 1098, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1283, 'last_played': 1398175879}
review:
Ce jeu fût une surprise. Offert sur un forum je m'y suis essayé et ne l'ai plus quitté jusqu'à le finir il y a quelques minutes. [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/Harest/screenshots/?appid=41900&sort=oldestfirst&browsefilter=myfiles&view=grid]Quelques screens par ici[/url] (spoilers potentiels).

Le point fort de ce jeu est probablement son humour tout au long de l'aventure, avec un gameplay relativement classique mais solide. Vous ne vous ennuierez clairement pas. Etant un barde vous allez pouvoir apprendre différents airs qui, lorsque vous les jouez, invoqueront différentes créatures vous aidant dans vote quête. Du garde du corps en passant par l'archère, l'élémentaire de feu ou l'infirmière de service, il y en a 16 en tout à trouver ainsi que leur amélioration. Vous pourrez en avoir 1 auprès de vous au début et jusqu'à 4 vers la fin.
Vous concernant vous pouvez parer (notamment avec un bouclier mais toute arme le permet), étourdir et attaquer avec l'arme équipée. Au choix :
- Arme à une main (possibilité d'ambidextrie avec un poignard via talent)
- Arme à deux mains (à débloquer via talent)
- Arc (pas mal puissant dans ce jeu mais je l'ai découvert un peu tard)
- Fléau (à débloquer via talent) : possibilité d'étourdir à chaque coup mais plus lent.
- Deux armes uniques ayant chacune leur spécificité assez sympa. J'ai fini le jeu avec l'épée unique d'ailleurs dès son obtention. Elle a une allonge conséquente.

Pas mal de talents vous permettront d'avoir des capacités en plus pour les différents types d'armes (pluie de flêches, charge (bouclier), ...). D'autres talents indépendants sont très puissants comme la possibilité de faire des coups critiques et bien d'autres.

Pour ce qui est de la durée de vie, j'ai mis ~21h. En temps de jeu réel : 17h. J'ai joué en normal, et même là parfois le challenge ne manque pas. Vous vous rendrez compte qu'à certains moments dans le jeu il y a des pics de difficulté. On ne s'y attend pas trop mais avec les points de sauvegarde généreux vous vous en sortirez sans trop de mal. D'ailleurs outre les airs classiques il y en a 4 autres plus importants, n'hésitez pas à les utiliser. Ils utilisent des pierres mystiques qu'on trouve dans les coffres entre autres. Elles sont limitées dans le jeu mais y'en a largement assez pour les utiliser régulièrement. Si je l'avais fait plus souvent, j'aurais sûrement moins "galéré" sur certains passages (j'ai fini le jeu avec quasi 200 pierres).

Bref, un bon jeu d'aventure, bien fun et qui change un peu des classiques jeux dans le genre grâce essentiellement à son humour. Et rassurez-vous le gameplay est bon. Ce qui m'attire dans un jeu à la base c'est le gameplay, le scénario j'en ai jamais grand chose à foutre, c'est toujours la même chose. Ici ils ont su apporter un peu de fraîcheur et le tout se combine très bien ensemble.

NB : Petit conseil, à part si vous rushez le jeu, ne mettez pas plus de 17 points dans une stat. Vous trouverez des symboles en jeu vous permettant de gagner jusqu'à +3 dans chaque stat. Et le maximum / stat est de 20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013908822', 'num_games_owned': 839, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1398094114}
review:
После почти 2 часов игры у меня смешанные ощущения. С одной стороны, неплохой юмор и неплохой геймплей. Но с другой какие-то совсем раздражающие вещи (например, сохранение только в точках сохранения, ага, как в GTA: SA), плюс, сама игра выглядит... дешево. Как будто денег недодали. И еще, конечно, смысл в это играть, когда есть Diablo/Torchlight/Sacred.

Вывод: игра безнадежно устарела, ознакомиться можно, но надолго игра вас не затянет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048904450', 'num_games_owned': 1787, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1395113357}
review: Another victim of consolitis I'm sorry to say. Awful controls, loading screens every two steps you take, static save points... You'll also be getting the original 'Bard's Tale', so I guess there's that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028777066', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1036, 'last_played': 1395227263}
review:
i can´t compete with the frustrating gameplay. maybe it´s just me, but the healt-restore system is just fuckin depressing, when you need to regain life in the middle of a fight.

 will continue playing though, maybe it gets less annoying. 

the fights are difficult as hell. i would call this an unbalanced game. it´s pretty hard to fight through a scenario, the story advances quickly and despite you level up constantly, your hero is simply weak. 

another con would be the backtracking. silly game makes you fight through the same scenarios and same enemies all the time. this combined with quite annoying health-restore system makes it not an easy task for you. HOWEVER...

you may use cheats, like I do :-)

i simply don´t have time to deal with dying over and over, and thus want to go through the story, cause it´s really funny!

yeah! the dialogues are hilarious, the jokes are (mostly) intelligent, and the satire is obvious. that´s something I really love about the bard. the pointless quest of neverending saving of a princess is wonderful when served like this. the story is a big motivation for me to go on. and the bard himself is just a selfish asshole, who just wants to reproduce and drink. whis is totally ok with me :-)

+ story
+ dialogues (fun satire)
+ songs
+ the hero
+ the narrator

- repetitive gameplay
- backtracking
- frustrating health-recovery system
- poor weapon variety
- hard overall difficulty

author: {'steamid': '76561198077942975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1899, 'last_played': 1516274324}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007823333', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1507622061}
review:
Tony Jay, I miss you so god damn much. Cary Elwes, you made 12-year-old me realize whole new tingly implications of the word "sexy". Bard's Tale, you bring me back to a time of Reboot and Princess Bride and Dragonlance and 3D Doritos. You also manage to do this while being pretty damn funny, and within a game whose sheer format is telling you not to take it seriously, relax, just enjoy the show. There's a lot of love here. Well-expressed, well-designed love.

I STILL CAN'T CHANGE MY SCREEN RESOLUTION GUYS WHAT THE HELL

review:
I absolutely loved this game, from the first cutscene to the last.  The somewhat predictable story and average gameplay is completely overshadowed by the hilarity of it.  The game plays of every one of the horrible overused RPG clichés that remove them from being realistic (such as how animals drop items) with alot of wit and charm.


Overall a great game.  Better than a lot of AAA titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082561250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1411072643}
review:
A fun, great RPG with really witty dialogues. I really liked the main character, who's not really your average "knight in shinning armour", but rather more of a Byronic hero.

Overall the gameplay it's great and from a story point of view it's one of the games which actually makes you laugh. It pokes fun at many of the "serious" and more dramatic RPGs (the hero it's more interested in having fun, rather than saving the world).

Looking forward for a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993499640', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1393510899}
review:
Interesting game. It's very dated in the gameplay, lots of stunlocking (from you and enemies) which means fights later on can be completely one sided. To seemingly combat this, there are save points practically every 5 feet. I've had fights where I have sat with my back to a wall spamming parry+counter attack for a few minutes, staying invincible while doing damage. I've also had fights where I get charged in to a stunlock and killed before I can move.

The game pokes fun at the standard RPG quest requirements, where the main character often mocks how stupid the idea of climbing an impenetrable tower is, but every time there's a silly thing you are forced to do, you just joke about it then do it anyway.

All in all it's entertaining.

Controller recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995050418', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1593443467}
review:
It is by far not perfect... but i think this is the charm of this classic... Play the Bard, a charmant (not) music artist who is in LOVE with Women and Money... mostly their money... and the thing he likes most : PROFIT.

And throughout the game you are given Choices : Give them a good answer or an evil one.
Each one has consequences to the good and to the bad. But they have no influence on the end of the game. That depends solely on YOU.


Oh i nearly forgot : You have a REAL NASTY narrator. The Grand Master of Sarcasm.

Oh and the conversations between the Bard and the Narrator are really something...

PRO :

All of the above
+ Crazy Characters
+ Real Crazy "Weapons" (There is a speaking one!!!)
+ Easy to learn controls
+ Hilarious companions
+ Ridiciulous Quests (the good Ridiculous)
+Easy Level System
CON : 
- Too Many Levels full of Clone-Soldiers 
-Simple loot System
-Simply Story
- meh... can't remember


I SAY :

BUY IT.PLAY IT.AND DON'T YOU DARE TO NOT LIKE IT !

author: {'steamid': '76561198033897440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1554709326}
review: Incredible game, I haven't played it all that much, but it is one of the funniest game I have ever played. Would recommend buying it, you won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981405537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1380242502}
review:
"Oh, it's bad luck to be you..."

Ok, so on the surface this game isn't all that great.  The graphics are outdated, the combat is rather bland, the story is shallow and linear... But you know what?  None of that matters, because this game is freakin' hilarious!  Between the spot-on genre parody, the musical numbers (such as the Oompa-Loompa goblin squad and the zombie/skeleton dance-off), the constant bickering between the Bard and the narrator, and so many other humorous moments, this game will have you literally laughing out loud from start to finish.

If you enjoy a good parody, this game deserves a spot in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081296862', 'num_games_owned': 3183, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1509045347}
review:
Отличный юмор, симпатичная графика, которая нормально смотриться даже сейчас.
Поддержка контроллера (Что для меня очень важно). Правда игра поддерживает только dinput контроллеры, так как мой Defender Scorpion X7 поддерживает и dinput и xinput. В общем в игре и в меню кнопочтк не от XBOX360 так что пока привык к нажмите кнопку 1 или 2 что бы сделать тото тото. 

Играть в игру надо, ибо РПГ с таким юморцом я еще не встречал) Да и женщинам в игре всегда грубите. Вдова например если ей нагрубить переспит с бардом.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979332326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1509504154}
review:
I don't know what a really bad old Xbox game (the original Xbox) is doing on Steam, but it should probably go away. That's no slant against the Xbox mind you, as Escape from Butcher Bay came out four months prior, which still holds up today, even with its load time Xbox pacing problems. That just speaks volumes of what an ill conceived project Bard's Tale is.

It has horribly ungainly controls/UI, that, unless you want to play with a controller - which I certainly don't - and if you're the same way, you definitely won't like this. (And static save points in a WRPG? Really?) I audibly said "you've got to be kidding me" when the only way to change the camera was with my keyboard, when I have this right click button on my mouse doing absolutely nothing.

When it comes to hack and slash, this might have cut the mustard back then if you only played console games, but even some of the oldest ARPGs kick this games butt. Give me Nox, give me Champions of Norrath, even give me god damn Dungeon Siege any day of the week. Really, The Bard's Tale's only competition is Fallout: Brotherhood of Steel for goodness sake. 

It's not fun to play. Plain and simple.

The one saving grace would be the humour. Right? Nah. Not really. It has really obvious and telegraphed jokes and satire that might have been cute back then, but is just grating now, especially when it relies on trying to be incredibly cheeky on top of that. It's just not as funny as it thinks it is, which is possibly the greatest sin anything unfunny can do. It plays more like a bad comedian striking out to a dead audience. It just made my skin crawl. Not even the talents of Tony Jay can help save this dreck. 

If you're digging up old game cliches that any dime store web comic* would have stopped making fun of at this point for fear of unearthing the Tutankhamun tomb and unleashing his curse, your jokes might have been a little outdated for 2004, let alone 2014. All this game needs is All Star by Smash Mouth to start playing to be even more irrelevant. 

On top of all that, the game features really compressed video(like the fog you can see is just how badly compressed the videos are) and some art assets were made clearly in 4:3. It was a sloppy port both to the PC back in 2005 and now it's inexcusable on Steam in this day and age. Why is it 4gb exactly? 

It might... MIGHT, have worked, if it played like Fable, rather than adding the pretense of a top down RPG for no good reason. In fact, if you want your fantasy games skewered and the humour that comes with it along with decent gameplay, play Overlord or the aforementioned Fable. 

Overall, Cary Elwes delivers a better performance here than he did in SAW at least.

*Unless you're Penny Arcade or CAD

review: Old school RPG, cheeky humor, fun graphics and a good story from what I've played. The controls feel a little weird to me and there is a lot of loading screens but all in all it seems to be a fun game. I wish it had more of the Diablo click on the mouse of the person you want to attack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009583492', 'num_games_owned': 679, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1391040147}
review: Bard’s Tale is an action ARPG that takes everything good about the games it’s copying, Diablo 2 and Baldur's Gate, and ruins it. For starters the controls and gameplay make it feel like you’re fighting in water. The combat is clunky and slow and it’s nowhere near as fluid as Diablo 2 is. The other thing I couldn’t stand about this game is the humor, beneath the seemingly clever satire of ARPGs is tasteless “lol boobies” and “cursing is so cool” jokes that only middle schoolers enjoy. I couldn’t stand to play more than half an hour of this game, good thing I got it in a Humble Bundle otherwise I’d be mad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025165921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1390160308}
review: Wow.  I'll admit, I only made it through 6 minutes of this game.  But honestly, it only took me 6 minutes to be completely offended by the painfully blatant sexism rampant in everything about the story.  First, I wasn't allowed to make my character female.  Ok fine, I recognize that sometimes it doesn't make sense to replace the gender of the character.  However, once we meet the female characters, every single one is in skimpy clothes, often with clothes that defy the laws of physics.  As soon as I made it into the inn and we got a close-up screen shot of the clevage of the widow mary whatever as she was giggling while asking me to do a job for her, I couldn't take it.  There's bad, and then there's bad.  Whatever 12 year old boy wrote this needs to grow up and realize that female gamers exist and we have better things to do than be treated like useless objects.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962175059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3836, 'last_played': 1389667931}
review:
Well, I spent the time to complete this, and was pretty satisfied.  Wasn't spectacular, but provided a few chuckles along the way and a somewhat casual pace, easy to play in 10-20 minute chunks til you got to the next save point.  I very much enjoyed the dog companion, especially training him to attack and dig up treasure... once he joined me  I don't think he ever left my side.  The story was corny and cliche (intentionally) and voice acting was well done.  The songs with the oopah loompah type guys got annoying after about the 2nd time, but I toughed through those moments.  I do have to be fair to the content and the game that was made.
OK fun.  Probably about 8-12 hours of gameplay for this new Bard's Take

Absolutely worthwhile if you do want to go back and play the originals Bard's Tale 1, 2 and 3 as well.
I did play these on C64 back in the day, Bard's Tale was one of my favorite RPG/DnD franchises of all time (others including Wizardry, and Ultima).
This new game was different and ok, but so nice that they included the old school originals as well for when/if the urge hits (though the originals might be a bigger timesink than this new game).
Thanks for reading.  Good night, good luck, and game on.

Wiseone 
:ccknight:

author: {'steamid': '76561198045197278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1388529216}
review:
A Bard's Tale: A Quest for Coin and Cleavage

Quite the catchy title for a game wouldn't you say?

I was pretty happy to see this package on Steam.  The original three from way back are nostalgic titles, even if they were just on Apple IIe. Was a Vic-20/Commodore/Amiga owner myself so wasn't privy to the series until I was at my friend's house who was an Apple fan, and let me 'try' it out a few times.
If you're a BIG fan, you might want to check out http://www.bardstaleonline.com/ for all your Bard's Tale needs.

Now, for the recent Steam release of The Bard's Tale (original game release in June 1985 according to Steam), I'm having a blast playing it.  I had played it just a little bit on the old Xbox since my son had got it from some bargain bin at Zellers.  Now that I've played it for 8hrs, I'm really wondering if my young son 'got' some of the off-the-wall comments our Bard throws out there or the one's by the commentator for that matter.  One thing is for sure though, I'm finding it very funny and have been laughing my ass off at some of his antics and those impromptu singing groups that appear throughout the game.

The gaming itself is pretty basic with a simple questing system with corridor like zones where you complete these quests received from the denizens of various towns you travel to.  Other than having to set my compability settings to Windows XP Pack 3 to eliminate a nasty Crash-To-Desktop (CTD) issue when starting the game, I've had no issue whatsoever playing the game.  I'm running Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit, an i5-2320 CPU @ 3.00GHz (4 CPUs), DirectX 11, and a somewhat crappy (ok, crappy) Nvidia GeForce GT 520 card.

So what does the game entail and what does it let you do?
1. You do get to upgrade your gear by buying it from a blacksmith or looting some in chests you can loot,
2. Smash and break tons of barrels that don't hold anything, but you do get paid.  You may ask, "Uh? How? Why?"  Those are well asked and valid questions, since I had made the same response.
By the vendor who actually makes the barrels of course!
All depending on how many replacements he sells to replace the ones you smashed up obviously.  You obtain the quest from him after you break one of his barrels just outside his place at the starting town.  I believe he pays you $5 for each barrel you break, and you can collect payment anytime you come see him.
3. Obtain new songs, which are a bard's magic spells per say, which allow you to heal yourself and friends, or summon a helper with specific skills, and other things,
4. Each level you get 2 points to spend on your stats: Strength, Vitality, Luck, Dexterity, Charisma, and Rhythm, to a maximum of 20, except luck is 21 due to skipping the unlucky number 13.

Wow! Ok, just noticed how much stuff I wrote into this review of mine, so I'll shut up now and let you guys go and buy the game so you can also play this pretty fun and funny game of coins and cleavage.

For more fun stuff about the game and a walkthrough, if you care for those, see an IGN guide at this website: http://ca.ign.com/faqs/2006/the-bards-tale-810205-walkthrough-562447

Silly Me!!  Almost forgot to mention a true hero to us all who has a tribute in this game.  None other than Charlie Mops! The mythical inventor of Beer!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZzHqXzcuWuE
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Mopps

review:

There are severe graphics and playability issues crop up under all of AMD, Nvidia and Intel drivers. It essentially renders the game unfinishable, expecially at later levels.

Quite a shame, because the first part of the game plays flawslessly, and just when you are enjoying the game the ridiculous amount of bugs are cropping up. It feels like a betrayal :-(

The developers also appear to ignore the issues that are reported.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041952447', 'num_games_owned': 975, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1390675451}
review:
The Bard's Tale is a hack 'n' slash, dungeon crawl style RPG that doesn't take itself seriously. Straight from the off you'll find extremely blunt sarcasm and tongue-in-cheek puns, the humour of which not always finding the mark and at times will leave you cringing, other times providing you with a good chuckle.

Ignore Diablo II comparisons, this is more along the lines of Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance, there isn't a loot system to speak of, all findings add to your gold tally and you make purchases from shop keepers as you go along. The summon system is functional, if a touch on the conservative side, with choices becoming quite obvious as you get deeper in the game which rules out the need to experiment with your companions.

Whilst The Bard's Tale doesn't provide anything original to the genre by any stretch of the imagination, it is worth a punt when on offer and will keep you engaged for a short stretch of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048958882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1451, 'last_played': 1386865889}
review: Que dire sur ce jeu? Bon, commençons par le début, c'est un hack & slash relaitvement basique dans la forme. Pas de classe, mais un peu de personnalisation via les caracteristiques, les talents, et les armes. Loin d'avoir l'étoffe d'un Diablo, il se défend. Alors, pourquoi est-ce que je ne joue pas à Diablo 3 au lieu de ce petit jeu au graphismes datés? Parce qu'il est drôle. Le héros est drôle, le narrateur est drôle, les personnages sont drôles, le scénario est drôle, les dialogues sont drôles... Ce jeu est rempli de petites blagues et références un peu partout, et le pire, c'est que par je ne sais quel miracle, ça ne devient jamais lourd, au contraire on se surprend à attendre les jeux sur les clichés, les piques du héros, ou les remarques du narrateur. Et puis il y a des chansons de tavernes avec karaoké, ça c'est cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982788843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1378118839}
review:
О Bard’s Tale можно долго говорить. Рассказывать о системе прокачки персонажа, видах заданий, геймплэе,  да бог знает о чем. Только все эти разговоры – пустой звук. Достаточно запустить игру, и лишь войти в первое же здание. Эта игра – кладезь сарказма и иронии. Над RPG. Над ролевиками и компьютерными задротами. Над жанром fantasy в принципе.

Устаревшая графика и кривое управление? О чем вы говорите, окаянные? Вас не впечатлил ролик-заставка? Пройдите два шага. В этой игре можно в первой же таверне залипнуть над песенкой пьяниц минут на 15, повторяя ее по кругу раза три. А дальше – больше.

В наше время оценивать эту игру с точки зрения графики – смешно, она и в свое то время была не ахти. Эта игра не для этого.
Это игра не для манчкина, не для ролевика, не для слэша или лута. Это игра for-fun. И юмор этот для той половины любителей жанра, которые готовы адекватно взглянуть на RPG, оценить fantasy как направление и вместе с Брайоном Фарго и Майклом Крэнфордом посмеяться над собой. А идущие в комплекте оригинальные Bard’s Tale лохматых 1985+ годов под настроение подарят минутки ностальгии по давно ушедшим временам.

Оценок давать не буду – слишком много времени прошло с момента релиза. И еще совет – постарайтесь играть на английском (не смотря на поддержку в Steam русского языка), не то пропустите ряд каламбуров, зачастую уровня Кэрролла.

Для ценителей RPG жанра – 100% must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063454111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1386223820}
review:
The Bard's Tale is a great casual RPG that takes  you back to gaming as it was nearly ten years ago. So be prepared for a top down third person view most of the time.  What makes it most enjoyable are the bawdy humor in the dialog and the lyrics to the songs.  

Our hero in the game, The Bard, is not really a hero; but a scounderal given to snarky comments and possessed of an ability to get himself into trouble.  His comments are not limited to dialog with NPC's.  He is equally capable of taking issue with the narrator and both seem to have a mutual hate relationship which adds to the fun.  You'll also encounter Scottish, English and French accents with a healthy dose of Scottish words for things, which is fitting for story based on legends from the Orkney Islands of Scotland.  

The Bard needs to recruit a team to help rescue a damsel in distress and true to his character, he's not willing to help without a reward, which the damsel offers.  That offer ought to make you chuckle.  Along the way you'll summon many creatures and finally figure out which ones are most useful to you.  After that you'll have an opportunity to really wreak mayhem and get yourself into some interesting situations.  The game is full of cliche's on purpose and they spice it up instead of detract from game-play.  And of course there are always complications along the way to add dimension to the game.

The screen resolution choices are based on what was available at release time.  Don't fuss over them too much.  Pick the largest resolution with the same ratio as your screen and it ought to look fine anyway.  Works fine on a 1900x1200 monitor.

It can be played with a controller, but you may find the onscreen prompts to be confusing and awkward.  If you do use a controller, you can find a useful list of controls at http://www.gamefly.com/Rent-The-Bard%27s-Tale/109860/GameplayControls/ - seriously though, the game is best player with a mouse and keyboard.  It just works better for a game this old.  

The original game was released in 1985 and twenty years later this version was released with much improved graphical content and music.  If you want the full retro experience, the menu system will let you load up the original game and have a go at it.

If you want to get a feel for the music and dialog in the 2005 version of the game, I would recommend these YouTube videos:

*  [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1JQpE7n6eUk]The Tale of the Nuckelavee[/url]
*  [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2B3nloST8Xc]The Bard's Tale Silkbeard and the Viking Song[/url]
*  [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbsNlHANRbI]Here's to the Bard[/url]
*  [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FjeKjzn5Jvk]The Chosen One #4[/url] (There are several variations of this song and all of them have an Oompa Loopa feel to them right down to ending with a Diddly-Do.)

I just replayed a bit of the game on my Win gaming rig, but it will play equally well on a computer with low graphics capabilities.  Worked just fine on a stripped down Mac Mini when I played it a few months back. (Disclaimer - used non-Steam version on my Mac.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014766672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1394924027}
review:
This game is not a challenger to Diablo. You will not horde items and decide whether you would like the quicker sword with a less power, or the more powerful t hat's a bit slower. You won't have to make difficult decisions about whether to save a woman or save a town. The RPG mechanics are not innovative or thought-provoking. And the quest will not demand countless hours of your life. You will, however, enjoy every step in your (short) journey.

It's funny, it's quirky, and you'll never have to worry about anything except from moving forward. Everything you pick up is something you automatically equip or something that turns instantly to gold. (you should still look at what these things are, though, as often times it's hilarious). Even new weapons when you find one, will be automatically equipped, and your old sword will turn to gold. These are not admirable designs in deep, generic adventure games. In this game though, which you play alone, they are godsends.

It's cheap right now on Steam, and worth every penny. It won't change your life, but it will leave you happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000650062', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1382487627}
review:
An absolutely underrated gem by inXile. With a combat system remnicient of the Dark Alliance and Champions of Norrath games for PS2, this wonderful adventure filled with song and dance has some of the most clever writing and dialogue I've seen in a comedic RPG. You play The Bard, a quick-witted silver-tongued minstrel with the power to summon creatures and companions through song. Narrated by the sultry Tony Jay, this snarky, heart-warming tale of adventure will have you singing in bloody stitches.

Prepare your Fourth Wall. It's in for a good breaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047403119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1356163200}
review:
Your standardish Diablo clone.  The gameplay is repetative, but is rarely boring or tedious.  Almost all of the creatures you can summon are interesting and useful.  However, you will always be down one summon slot for the Witch (who heals your troops) since she is so useful.  Half way through (maybe before I can't remember the specific point) you'll have your team of high DPS/strong critters decided on,  and with my remaining summon slots devoted to them I ended up with little reason switching them out.

I played/toughed through it mostly for the humor and songs.  The Bard is the perferct parody of your standard RPG character.  If you don't want to put in the time to actually play through it, you should at least look up the songs/cutscenes on youtube.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970309405', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1382525711}
review:
Poor graphics, poor game gameplay mixed with a poor attempt at satirical humour.  A stinking blott on the original franchise name.

The only reason to buy this shambles is that it contains the original 3 much better games running under an emulator (though you can probably get these elsewhere I'm pretty certain).

Only reason I got it myself is that is was part of a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064959889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1994, 'last_played': 1385884410}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090757837', 'num_games_owned': 1400, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1694190012}
review:
[h3]Pros:[/h3]
[list]
[*] funny (!!)
[*] voice acting
[*] songs
[*] RPG classic
[/list]

[h3]Cons:[/h3]
[list]
[*] buggy (!!!) Linux users read below
[*] outdated visuals
[/list]

I finished it on Windows many many years ago and, hell, it was fun! It's sad whoever did the job of porting it to Linux didn't put much effort into it.

Interface often doesn't listen, in-game map stops following player's direction after 360 turn, support for generic controller (anything but xbox360) is only partial (and can't remap), abusive particle system sometimes renders game unplayable (if unlucky, one torch on the map will freeze the game entirely).

author: {'steamid': '76561198031671144', 'num_games_owned': 725, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1384808552}
review:
This is a pretty hit-and-miss game. The gameplay is shoddy and unremarkable, the only thing I find charming is the wit and humor, which is /usually/ good. As a genre parody it's worth checking out, but as a gameplay experience, you'd be better off looking elsewhere. It's not awful, but I don't see myself ever finishing it.

5/10, or 3/10 if you don't like the kind of humor it has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998766396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1388921223}
review:
Bear in mind, first, that I never finished this game.

That said, the six or seven hours I played back when I had it on Xbox were a blast. The combat is....okay, I guess. Exploration and loot? Eh....I've had worse. Classes and playstyles are....well....

Look, honestly? To me, none of this is what the game is about. If you're playing this game, you're doing it to have a laugh, and a laugh you shall have, my friend, because the Bard is a womanising, sarcastic, world-weary sleazebag, but ultimately a pretty likeable guy. He is frequently taken advantage of and made the butt of some fairly sadistic humour by an array of entertaining support characters - and his morals are so mercurial that you just know, bone-deep, that he'd do exactly the same thing given half a chance.

Bottom line: the actual gameplay ranges from dull to forgettable, but the story and comedy are well worth making the effort. It's dirt-cheap, will probably run on a calculator, and will keep you thoroughly entertained with the dialogue alone. Seriously, if you can't get a laugh out of this game, you're a pod person or something and have bigger problems than the three bucks you shelled out for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050738867', 'num_games_owned': 2005, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1704399929}
review:
- The Bard's Tale - игра уникальная. В том плане, что под маской типичный экшн/рпг скрывается столько циничного, острого, интеллигентного и черного юмора, сколько ни в одной другой, даже специально нацеленной на подобную аудиторию игре. "Похождения Барда" хочется растаскивайть на цитаты, каждое действие поставлено с такой иронией и сарказмом, что страшно представить, какой балаган творится в умах сценаристов (среди которых, на секунду, Брайан Фарго, автор Fallout). 

- Главный герой - самовлюбленный, эгоистичный, но отнюдь не глупый Бард (и имя, и профессия) с самым острым языком в мире. Он всегда отвечает настолько колко и саркастично, что не полюбить персонажа невозможно. Ему вторит Рассказчик, который повествует всю эту историю. Смотреть на их переругивания одно удовольствие. Остальные герои тоже не подкачали: самые разные типажи и характеры - они идеально вписываются в карамельные фентези декорации (поначалу).

- При этом игра не впадает в крайности: никакого сортирного юмора, никаких натянутых шуток, игрока не заставляют смеяться и не устраивают комеди-клаб или подобное какбэ смешное шоу. Это настоящая, штучная, ювелирная работа. Ну где еще можно пойти в магазин не за покупкой-продажей шмота, а чтобы послушать ехидные комментарии торговцев. Серьезно, это как наркотик, каждое действо ждешь, как День Рождения.

- За всем этим праздником как-то забываешь о том, что у нас тут рпг, и в нее надо еще играть. Рубка монстров, кач, шмот - всё на месте, но не отвлекает от главного. При этом у игры множество своих оригинальных идей, которые не хочется перечислять, потому что в стиме лимит на символы. Право слово, это ведь совсем не важно.

В итоге мы имеем действительно веселое произведение, которое не напрягает и дарит улыбку до ушей. А еще тут можно толкнуть корову, и она упадет. Да-да, как в той самой постъядерной ролевой игре на букву "F".

author: {'steamid': '76561198111628631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 0, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 0}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976543406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3, 'last_played': 1381950568}
review:
GET THE MOBILE VERSION.

This is a fantastic game, full of "flavor content" that you don't often see in an RPG like this. Full voice acting, narration, even sing-a-long drinking songs - it's hard to ask for more. Story is quirky, even slightly parodic, but not over-the-top like Grotesque Tactics. As a mobile game (played it on my Android phone, but also available for iOS), I'd give it a 9/10.

Unfortunately, the PC version of the game is just clunky and weird. The controls are slow, un-intuitive, and often buggy - and the graphics... hardly make it worth playing on a bigger screen. (Not to mention the added features in the mobile versions, like autosave, that are not implemented in this version). I had to stop after about 5 minutes and switch back to my phone. If you don't have an Android or iOS device, and can put up with the annoying controls - it might still be better than not playing it all. But not by much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009383387', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1376163243}
review:
These are the actual, old-school bards tale games.  I have no idea why this ia 4 gig install.  If you have nostalga for them, then I guess you should buy it.  I thought they were enahcned somehow, as in these were a remake of the bards tale games.  But no, they are the actual orginals.  

As much as I like adventure games, I can't deal with the bad UI. (I am not talking about graphics here).  For example in combat to cast a mage spell, I need to type out the code for the mage spell I want to cast.  One additional problem is, I have NO IDEA what spells my mage even knows.  There is no way to tell as far as I know.  

Then combat:  You can face 4 stacks of 99 monsters each.  On round one you need to give orders to your party, each member.  You might do 10 hp to 1 monsters in rank 1, out of 99 total.  Then you go to round 2 and you give orders to your party again, and manage to kill 1 monster, then repeat like 600 times and you fnish the encounter.

I didn't get very far, I just couldn't take it.  Maybe back in the day when this was the ONLY choice, but not today.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967324471', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1374341341}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000948476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1624, 'last_played': 1520314843}
review: What can I say, I hated this console import of a game. Now wait this is a recommendation, and that is for the three original Bard's Tale games that are included in this weak title. These games go back over 25 years so don't expect anything great for graphics. The games though are real gems. Fun, enyoyable, and simple game play, nothing complicated to do, not a lot of fancy keystrokes to memorize just a fun set of games. The title listed here in steam I would rate at 3 out of 10. The original titles now those are 10 out of 10. They are that much fun. You will have to search the internet to find game manuals and other documents to play them but it's worth the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037772389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1588255589}
review:
I first played this game on the PlayStation 2 and from it I found a rare gem amidst the gaming industry of that time, it has an essence of Baldur's Gate; except it had it's Tounge placed Firmly in its' Cheek, whether it be from the Bard himself, the menagerie of characters around him or by the Narrator-(who by the way is none other than the Late 'n' Great Tony Jay of Notre Dame and ReBoot fame)-who has an ongoing sence of contempt for the Bard.
The Gameplay utilized an interesting Summon Mechanic where the Bard could call Warriors, Mages,Mystical Monsters and the Odd Rat to his disposal with a high degree of abilities such as the Heriones Flurry of Arrows to the Knockers Wide Range Lightning Rods.
The Original Trilogy to me is a bit of an afterthough as I am not a man of the Commodore Days, but if you are then I'd give it a good ganders.
the only critiques I can offer is that the Enemies tend to get REALLY powerful around the Mid stages and that the story begins to stale out around the third act, but hopefully the humour can palate you all the way through the adventure.
P.S. visit the churches often, they're more rewarding than you would first think...

author: {'steamid': '76561198067164738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1450287047}
review: My Steam account doesn't list any  play time on this game, but I have played it before on the console it was first published (inXile copyright 2004-2012) for, nearly through to the end. I was playing it all the time, put it down to take a break and life got in the way. Now the very same game is back through Steam for PC. Steam did a great job of making it playable on the computer and I recommend this game. It's an adventure action RPG with a sense of humor, horror and originality. It's an adult game because of adult references but it isn't an adult theme. The bard has outrageous adventure after another. The bards music is a plus for those who like medieval music.  A word of caution, I have seen old comments saying people could not get it to play on their machine, I have not had this experience and I have a laptop. They  had Windows 8. Thank you Steam for offering this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989764320', 'num_games_owned': 2833, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1148, 'last_played': 1370170975}
review:
The story seems to be your typical fantasy RPG story: the world needs saving and you are the one to save it. 
Here's the thing though: you don't really want to.

The Bard's Tale is a comedic fantasy RPG set in yet another medival fantasy land with your typical story, but a rather atypical hero, mostly because he doesn't want to be a hero. But after he's promised money and the damsel in distress, he moves out, fighting bad guys and monsters, meeting up with a whole lot of strange characters, collecting new gear and summoning the help of his magic companions, all while arguing with the narrator as he goes along.

It may not be the most refined RPG, but it's a lot of fun. The combat, while a bit tedious at times, is good, the dialogue is absolutely great, partly so because of the voice actors who do a great job at delivering the lines.

All in all an enjoyable game, especially for action RPG fans who don't mind the abscence of serious business.

review: Esprili ve güzel bir RPG. Bard tam bir anti-kahraman ve görevlere yaptığı yorumlar, insanlara verdiği tepkiler ve düşmanlara attığı laflar insanı bayağı bir güldürüyor. author: {'steamid': '76561197996590747', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1361865600}
review:
A pretty good game; if you've ever played any of the Dark Alliance games, this is in the same game engine and follows the Dungeons and Dragons stat system (stats maxed at 20, etc.). The best things about the game are the writing (which is hilarious), the Bard himself (also hilarious), and the battle system. While not deviating heavily from the DA games, combat is heavily reliant on summoned monsters; if you try to go into any situations alone you'll get murdered. 

Overall, I definantly say it's worth a purchase, especially if you can nab it on sale for 5-10 dollars. The game is pretty short (I'm not 100 percenting, and I'm nearly at the end, with about eleven hours played) but has a ton of places to explore and a whole chapter that is optional (and awesome!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197983152533', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1569014730}
review:
Played it through almost 10 years ago and loved it. Playing its enchanted steam version today and still loving it. It's a good roleplaying hack and slash taking place in scottish fantasy world. Also like the dry sense of humor which game is filled with.
In addition of wide-screen running possibilty and windows 7 compatibility - steam version is enchanted with 3 ancient "Bard's Tale" - games from mid 80s. Bravo!

review: This is one of the best hack&slash rpg I have ever played. The combat is not anything special it even gets a bit repetitive after a while. But really what set it apart from other hack&slash games is the story. It is clever, funny, and unique. It does not take it self seriously at any point. its really a big goofy parody. The best bit (for me) are the songs, they will never get old.

review: Lots of fun, simple and it will make you laugh. There are many choices you can do to make differnt outcomes from Doing the dirty with a townsgirl or make a wrong one and sleep alone.  There are also differnt hits from NPCS you talk to you if you make a choice, sometimes better tips or even a better item!  save then try them and watch the Fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993039039', 'num_games_owned': 1963, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1524342108}
review:
Сколько лет прошло, когда я прошел эту игру, но до сих пор помню, что игра потрясла меня! Я далеко не любитель жанра RPG, но здесь нет занудных квестов, а наоборот - в игре очень много юмора. Потому даже те, кто не любит сей жанр, могут втянуться из-за забавной и добротной атмосферы! Собирай свою армию и твори добро, будь хорошим бардом! По ходу игры можно собирать команду, включая собаку, как в фильме "Маска", которую у меня (не по сюжету) убили в очередном сражении. Игра заслуживает должного ей внимания, но думаю, что вряд ли нынешние игроки будут нуждаться в подобной игре, потому как сейчас есть всякие Skyrim или Dragon Age. Но игра больше напоминает, как по-мне, Magicka, но только, скорее, на мечах. Магия в игре тоже присутствует, но по-большей части, вам ею не доведется пользоваться.
Хорошая игра, которую не стоит ругать за повторные сражения и плохую графику.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198008541101', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1236, 'last_played': 1338879600}
review:
The bard's tale is an enjoyable experience made by people that obviously had a lot of fun making the game. The game features silly humor and could be interpreted as a parody on the whole rpg genre. The story is as cliched as you could possibly imagine wich works well with the whole parody thing. Combat and stats are very simpel but good, and there is a big arsenal of weapons and spells that summons allies with cool abilities.

There is a few negative things about the game. 
One thing is that you can only save when you are at a savestation, which would be okay if there were more stations. There exist a graphical bugg that causes the game to run in slowmotion whenever a certain rain effect is used. It could also have been shorter by reducing the amounts of enemies.

Overall the bard's tale is a good and memorable game: 4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197996887527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1519891156}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045697475', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2287, 'last_played': 1518224815}
review:
Let's see here besides treasure beer and cleavage what more could someone ask for? Besides an Epic Tale of a Bard and a story with so much twists and turns it will have you playing though all the endings, with a sarcastic narrator and chars with a wick and sick humor all around this is a good game. Get it, so much to loot kill and buy..... You will have hours of gameplay you will love every moment of.
Get it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020738931', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2240, 'last_played': 1470859396}
review:
Por fin encuentro este juego. Y ha sido de suerte (no es que lo anunciaran mucho).
Por 1'74€ NO PUEDE ESTAR MAL. No lo he jugado pero, un bardo que va por ahí, como dicen el vídeo y la descripción, buscando dinero y escotes NO PUEDE SER MALO.

El pero es que, según parece, sólo viene con subtítulos en inglés (en España salió con audio inglés y subtítulos ene spañol); habrá que buscarse la vida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052935907', 'num_games_owned': 1994, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2325, 'last_played': 1334386800}
review: Admittedly not the best game out there -- not even close. But this game is mindless hack-and-slash fun. When you want to turn your brain off and enjoy a little PG-rated harmless violence, this game is exactly what the doctor ordered. The snarky humor is great as well. The game may get a 70 on Metacritic, but in terms of fun I'd put it at an 80. Definitely worth a spin at less than $5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027515855', 'num_games_owned': 1362, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1, 'last_played': 1348210800}
review:
Im Gegensatz zur ursprünglichen Rollenspielversion ist die Neuauflage dieses Spiels viel mehr auf Action getrimmt und entspricht eher einem Diablo oder Dungeon Siege - allerings ohne die dort treibende Itemjagd.

The Bard's Tale zieht die Motivation aus der witzig erzählten Geschichte und den genial eingestreuten Liedern (dem Beer-Song, The Tale of the Nuckelavee, ...). Im englischen Original sorgen insbesondere die Dialekte für viel Atmosphäre und Erheiterung.

Um es ganz klar zu sagen: Dieser Titel ist weder besonders fordernd noch besonders tiefgründig und nimmt sich schon garnicht ernst. Dafür hat er einen ganz eigenen Humor, mit vielen Anspielungen und Seitenhieben, der mir sehr gefallen hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993109243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
I was expecting an update of the old dungeon-crawl series. I was very disappointed. This has absolutely nothing to do with the games that it is named after. That's not to say that it's a bad game, but I wish they had named it something else.

This is a 2D isometric view hack and slash, and you learn summoning magic instead of actually picking up companions. Or I didn't play the game long enough to pick up my first companion.

Bard's Tale is just okay. I bet it gets better as you go (I've seen videos that look like a really fun game), but I just don't have the will to sit through the fart jokes and rat-killing.

review: Reminds me a lot of Magicka but probably because I played that first.  Hilarious game.  I wish there were more like it.  Surprisingly difficult the gameplay mechanics were simple but not just clickclickclick like other arpg's.  You got to block! lots to do with timing.  Highly recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002646606', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1534984974}
review:
This is a quirky old game which deserves some attention.  Cary Elwes voices a reluctant "hero" who tends to mess everything up and who is entirely motivated by the pursuit of coin and cleavage.

What really makes this game shine is the comedy of it, much of which is pure gold.  Gameplay is fairly basic, though there's an interesting shift from action to tactical focus as the game progresses and you acquire more companions.

There are a few downsides: the game suffers badly from console portitus, and I find it gets tedious about 3/4 of the way through, but it's still very much a game worth playing just for the delightfully sarcastic comedy of the thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968840612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1350630000}
review: Cary Elwes as the Dread Pirate Robards must escape the evil Jigsaw's trap, stuck in a 640x480 room and forced to move in slow motion with no hope of ever being patched, I mean rescued. Will sawing off his foot make this game playable in 2012? I highly doubt it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987916181', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1653047659}
review: If you like games with snarky dialogue and you are just in the adventure for the tits and the booze, this is the game for you because the Bard is in it for the exact same reason. You can snark or smarm in most dialogues to ponce your way through to your goal. Also, it has the late Tony Jay (voice of Megabyte from Reboot and Judge Frolo from Hunchback of Notre Dame) as the announcer. Which is AWESOME.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971304253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 3096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1783, 'last_played': 1596388085}
review:
Oldschool RPG game. The Bard can be trained in any kind of weaponry, however his strongest ability is playing songs to summon mercenaries (pets) who dish out damage, tank or heal.

Mixed with a classic comedy, as the narrator actually insult the Bard whenever you play. Likewise the Bard often argue with the narrator ending with some epic moments! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197971112582', 'num_games_owned': 921, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1643136771}
review:
This is the one game I would instantly recommend to any fans of Monty Python-style humor. Not only are the priorities of our hero at odds with the fulfillment of his tasks, he also happens to blindly run into any obvious trap with such style and conviction any British gentleman would be proud of.

Take the hero's first task, which is the obligatory rat extermination in a cellar, only accepted by the Bard due to the quest giver's well-shaped bosom. When the invincible, 6 feet tall fire breathing rat inevitably forces you to retreat, the game's narrator dryly and in a classy voice comments: "and so, our hero turned tail and began running up the stairs, all the while screaming 'I'm on fire!'".

author: {'steamid': '76561197971687824', 'num_games_owned': 1394, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1363244400}
review: Good, but different take on the old 3D Amiga game. Very tongue in cheek and it only runs in low resolutions. Kind of an action RPG but mainly magic user instead of warrior type classes. Cant go wrong if you are like me and love RPG's, good for a runaround in short bursts.
